text:
We ate dinner at Chin Chin on Friday night.  I wanted a variety of items and some kind of beef, but not a Prime steak.  We landed at Chin Chin for some good old Americanized Chinese food.  Since our last meal was breakfast we ordered up some chicken pot stickers, pork bao, half of a Hunan chicken, and Mongolian beef...and some steamed rice (more on that later).

It was all good.  The Mongolian beef was actually very good.  I am usually a little scared of the beef that ends up in Chinese food dishes, but this was very tasty.  

The Hunan chicken was a little tart for me, but it was nice and tender.  My wife loved it.  

If you are a char siu bao fan (yeah that is spelled a hundred different ways), don't order them here.  The filling was off and the dough of the bun was heavy and yellow.  My guess is that they were made a while before we ordered them and steamed up to serve.  By a while I mean at the day before...or earlier...

The portions are pretty good, so if you eat family style don't over order.  One dish per person is plenty.  

The prices were about $15 per entree, which isn't bad for a hotel on the strip.  Important note, rice does not come with your meal.  You have to order it by the bowl for $1.50 each or get fried rice.  That's kind of lame.  You really need to charge that extra $1.50 for a bowl of steamed rice?

Our server was a polite girl from some former Soviet block country.  Theek accent, but attentive to the table.

The Mongolian beef was good as any.

The Ma Po tofu was not flavored correctly. 

Service was good. Overall experience was average.

Every time we come to Vegas we come here.   The breakfast buffet is delicious and the prices are very reasonable.  Today we had Kate as our server, and as usual,  she was outstanding.  All of the staff here are very warm and friendly.   This is a great place!

We went there for breakfast. It was $17 per person, which I thought was very reasonable given their selection. The price also includes customized omelette. They put good amount of cheese on my omelette, cheese was oozing out and I enjoyed every bite of it. It was delish. My other favorites were their super crispy bacon and crab cake egg benny. I was most impressed by their friendly staff. We were greeted by super nice lady, and our server Pedro was friendly and very attentive. He even offered us take-out coffee on our way out which I thought was really nice touch.

Breakfast was ok but to see the way the male managers treated their employees was horrible to watch. Server girls were always with a smile on their face. Not a place i would recommend but would recommend Corporate office in better training their management to help build confidence to their employees not bully them !!!

If you want NON Chinese food, lousy taste and lots of "fillers", this place is for you. Unfortunately, it's not for me. The following email was sent to the management at Chin Chin. There was no response. I emailed the corporate office - still no response. Finally, I called "food and beverage" at New York New York . They contacted the Chin Chin manager and she called me say she regretted our experience. She also said she would add more meats next time. Too bad there won't be a "next time".   This is the email I sent:

While staying at NY NY in Las Vegas, my son and his girlfriend  treated me and my wife to dinner at the hotel. It was convenient and we were in the mood for Chinese food. To the point, it was the most disappointing Chinese food we have ever had. The Sushi was awful, the Chinese chicken salad was almost lacking of chicken - there was hardly any there. The King Pao chicken/shrimp[/beef was little more than a pile of chestnuts and peanuts. There were only a few shrimp, and a few pieces of beef and chicken. The tuna tartar was also disappointing. Our dinner was a sham. You are charging enough; you don't have to skimp with fillers. If it were just my wife and me, we would have walked out, but we were guests. In the end, you have 4 very unhappy customers.

Any other Chinese restaurant in Vegas would be better (and much cheaper) than Chin Chin.

We were really looking forward to Dim Sum and we were totally disappointed!  The service was horrible!  The potstickers were cold.  We sent them back and they reheated the ones we sent back.  I'm sure this is not allowed by health codes.  I ordered a salmon hand roll and it sat at the sushi bar for 10 minutes before I got it.  The seaweed was mushy so I sent it back.  The server was talking to another table and completely forgot about us.  Out of the 4 dishes we ordered they were out of 2.  The only thing that was good was the Gift Wrapped Chicken.  We will never go there again.  YUCK!
Food was delicious and not over priced like everywhere else in vegas..Ben our waiter was knowledgeable and so sweet! 5 stars for him too! Highly recommend
This place is awesome, the food is very fresh and good compare to what you pay for! It worth the try and the serves rock! Andres did an amazing job to take care of our loud family!

Had the lunch buffet for about $22 and it was shockingly good. They had a wide variety of options and they all were fresh despite it being later for lunch and very few people in the restaurant. They had a few sushi varieties which were good. I'm not a big sushi person so i can't say how they compare to most but as far as buffet goes I thought they were good. Lots of dessert options like cookies and pastries but they were all a little on the dry side. Chocolate covered strawberries were awesome and they had other fresh fruit. Service was great.

We were in Las Vegas and I wanted sushi.  My husband's usual sushi spot was desolate so we decided to try some place new.  This spot was fantastic!  The food was amazing and the service was incredible.  I was able to enjoy delicious sushi while my husband had some Chinese food.  The simple pleasure appetizer is a must as it gives a sampling of a little of everything.  The Volcano sushi roll was dynamite.  Pedro was our server and he was impeccable.  When we gave him accolades on outstanding service he was so very modest saying that he couldn't do it alone and that the cooks, bartenders, and even hostess do it all together.  After being in the service industry for many years, I was truly impressed!  Looking forward to our next trip back so we can visit this establishment again!!!!

I give this 4 stars instead of 5 ONLY because if you are looking for an upscale dinner and atmosphere this isn't the place (extremely upscale as this is pretty casual). Other than that, I would highly recommend this place.

horrible customer service. Waiter dropped a plate which shattered all over me, spilt water into my purse, and took FOREVER to do anything. Didnt even bother to check back on our table after the incident. When we asked for my meal to be comped due to our horrible experience he took our bill, was gone for 15min then just came back and dropped it on the table, not comped. No manager ever came by to ask if we were okay, there was glass everywhere. I would spend you money elsewhere.

My favorite restaurant of my trip. I ate here for breakfast both mornings that I was here. The buffet is wonderful, everything I had tasted great! The service was phenomenal! Our waiter, WAS IN POINT! I can't stress that enough. This place made my trip.

Vegans...dine elsewhere....they use chicken base in EVERYTHING.  CAN be made vegan upon request but ya gotta know what to ask for. 

Non vegans: yummy!!!

Dinner: Get "Dim Sum then Some" $21, you will get 3 portions of select dishes. More then enough food! Wish the portions were smaller and cheaper.
Get: sliced bbq pork (best dish by far), skip the Chinese chicken salad (not that great), the pork fried rice was a bit over done.
No one in our party was impressed.
Recommendation for restaurant: Smaller portions at more affordable prices would help fill your seats at dinner.

Went there for the breakfast buffet as I read that there was a Chinese twist to it. It's wrong, except for the Chinese fried rice and lychees in the fruit section. But the food was good. And the bar tender very friendly.
We were there about 3 weeks ago.  Cody was our waiter and he was very attentive and efficient.  He communicated very well with us.  The food was excellent!

Wow the quality of Chinese food is horrible. Service was fine. But Your better going to a food court in Vegas and getting Panda express and save your money. We ordered the hot and sour soup which had very little tofu and meat and way over soy sauced and corn starched. Jean longs noodles had no flavor and the Mongolian beef was way over salty. I can't speak for the sushi since we didn't order it. Look for something else if u want chinese.
tasty and fresh..but not the best I've had.. Piedro was nice and helpful... one meal is enough for two if you are not too hungry...the price for a meal is ok if you share it with a friend
great food, fast service, nice staff. we waited a lengthy five minutes for our food (wow).
Waitress and staff wonderful and friendly. Food really good with big portions. Two of us eating split two dishes and had way too much food but really good and fresh.
YUMM! YUMM! YUMM! The best lunch buffet, lots of choices and dessert too- great for the price. Our server Penny was delightful.

Food Poisoning !! Went to this restaurant in June of 2012 for lunch. Had the Shui Mei and pork steamed dumplings, along with the sampler sashimi plate. The food tasted sub-par at best. Several hours later, my companion was throwing up for the next 4 hours. Had to seek medical attention, a doctor was called to our room. My companion was trapped in the room for the next 2 days, dehydrated and too weak to travel. She could not eat at all, and we just stayed in. On the second day, I felt ill as well. This turned out to be a very expensive lunch, as the Doctor and the meds cost a large amount of money. So much for our vacation ! It was ruined, and we just left and drove back to L.A.. Since then (and it has been about 3 1/2 weeks since) Chin Chin management has not called back to discuss after I made reports to NY NY Risk Management Dept. I was told by NY NY that they lease and they passed the buck to Chin Chin, saying that they aren't directly responsible. All I can say is BEWARE of eating here ! My next call will be to the Nevada Health Dept. as I am getting no responses from either Chin Chin corporate or NY NY.

We went there for the breakfast buffet.  I wanted to go for the crab cake benedict. They did not disappoint!  They were great!  They had other versions of benedicts if you would prefer. I think Pedro was our server's name.   He was FRICKIN AWESOME.  He was fast and on top of it and so friendly. He is a keeper and you should give him a bonus or employee of the year or something.  Thank you!
Service was Great !! Ordered  Shrimp Fried Rice very Good.. . Mongolian Beef tasted good, but beef over cook (dry).

Ate the breakfast buffet two mornings while staying at New York New York Hotel Casino. We got there in time for the two for one deal. Both mornings the staff was exceptionally nice and attentive. The food was fresh and delicious and what a value! Anyone staying at New York New York should make sure to give the breakfast buffet a try at Chin Chin. You won't be disappointed.

Ate here while staying at NY-NY and found the food to be quite tasty, reasonably priced and a nice respite from the casino floor.

May I recommend the Wor Won Ton soup with veggies, seafood and won tons. It is a huge bowl that will serve 3-4 and it is quite tasty. The tangerine beef was tart and sweet. 

Good stuff and will eat here next time I am at NY-NY

My cousin and I ate dinner  here before going to see Zumanity. We had pineapple fried rice and curry chicken, both were excellent. The drinks were great too! She had a Grape soda cocktail and i had the Green Dragon Mojito, my favorite drink of the entire trip!. Our server Garfield was excellent, very friendly. Would definitely go back!

Went to Chin Chin for the first time and boy was I impressed! The breakfast buffet was excellent as was the server and manager. Our server Jordan was extremely attentive and was there before I even knew I needed something. He was talkative and very energetic which in the field of hospitality is a much needed asset. Linda was the manager and she visited the table and was very kind to myself and my girlfriend. Can't wait to come back next time.
Over priced, greasy crap. For $20 per person I expected better. Half the items I couldn't eat due to shellfish being so prevalent. Worst meal we had all week while in town. Never ever again.

5 stars is not enough, this person, lady who helped us at NYNY Chin Chin was phenomenon . She put us first with consistent unforgettable customer service. She was very entertaining and fun but yet professional. Her and her staff at NYNY  represent friendly and energetic staff who knows how to attract and retain loyal customers.  I will definitely tell my experience to my fans when I am on stage doing Stand Up. BTW, her name is Yanira Torres and she was wearing a red rose shirt. This type of employee makes a fine example of a contributor who will be a great asset to any company.  She surely stood out with distinctions in service, experience, and professionalism.

My partner and I were craving Asian food as it is easily accessible in Australia so decided to go downstairs. I don't mean to bash but this place does not serve authentic Asian food. Please note, I am Chinese myself. I'm no masterchef but this is by far the worst "Asian" restaurant I have been to. My hot and sour soup was extremely peppery, too thick and not the correct colour. Our beans and chicken dishes were covered in salt. Our summer rolls were not fresh. I could tell it was taken out of the fridge and cut up to be served. The rice was dry. I have never been so reluctant to finish my food. The only thing that was made right was our spicy tuna sushi. Nonetheless, the customer service was good as it always is in America. We reluctantly told the manager when asked how our meal was. When asking for the bill, we received a discount for the dishes we were particularly not happy with, which was nice. Need I say I won't be returning?

Second time here during our stay at the New York New York in Vegas.

Potstickers with chicken as an appetizer. Tasty and juicy.

Afterwards we had the Tomato and Garlic Beef. The meet was tender, the vegetables were crispy, and the sauce was extremely good. Portions are big, we (two) shared one main dish and the both of us got really full.

I really enjoyed this restaurant. There were four of us, so I got to sample quite a bit of their food. My friends were vegetarian, and I'm not - but surprisingly the thing I liked best was the Garlic Eggplant.  And I don't love Eggplant either though I've recently learned to like it.  It was really nicely flavored. I also tried and enjoyed the Chicken Fried Rice, King Pao Trio, spring rolls, and General Tso's chicken. It not a cheap meal, but this was in a Vegas casino, so I was expecting it.  I'd go back for sure.
It's really beyond my expectation. The food here is welcome by my families from China and the service is pretty good!

Sat at counter and ordered sushi. Waiter was so nice. Sushi chefs made us an extra couple pieces to try in addition to what we ordered. Order 2 rolls get a hot saki. Rolls were pretty good. Not best I've ever had, but pretty good. Sushi chefs made me a cat out of an orange.

Good food, good service.
Check in and get a free lunch with one regular lunch buffet.
ChinChin seems like a Chinese restaurant. However, mm....... This is not Chinese food, not even close, period!

Came in for dinner on the 28th and sat at the bar. I had an awesome time. The ladies behind the bar had smiles and awesome service. The sushi chef helped out and brought out my food from the kitchen. It is so awesome to see this teamwork!  Lauren is one of the bartenders and I forget the other ladies name. Again awesome people and truly let me enjoy my time here. 

Oh, the food was very tasty.

Came here everyday while visiting for my 21st birthday  and loved it everytime. So thrilled to have come back four years later for my 25th and everything about this place is still better than ever. Great service, the sushi chef even recommended a pho place in Chinatown to help aid my cold, which ended up being awesome!(Pho Kim Long) Thank you to the team at Chin Chin for being a reliable & enjoyable place to visit every time in Vegas. Looking forward to visits in the future.

Ate here a month ago and we're all still craving it... cannot wait to get back to Vegas simply to eat at Chin Chin in the NY NY Hotel again! 

Highly recc'd the eggplant dish! Also, General Gao's Chicken was OFF The HOOK. We travel the country for a living... we eat a lot of this stuff... Chin Chin owned it!

Priced well. $110 fed 4 people well and that included drinks. And by well I mean, unbuttoning your pants afterwards!

This was our second time eating here... and it won't be our last! Wait staff was attentive and kind. Service was fast and the place was bumping... very impressive. LOVE that all the food came out at once, nice and hot.... and being from Boston we of course all loved the free parking! :)
Ate here twice for dinner. There are decent choices for vegetarians and vegans. We had string beans,veggie dumplings, veggie spring rolls and veggie sushi. Food was great and service was EXCELLENT!
Very good service and decent selection of food! Limited on sushi options but still very tasty! All in all will recommend and its $20 for a buffet!
Muy rico para ir a desayunar con la familia y el servicio muy bueno la mesera muy atenta con todos nosotros gracias Andrea por tu bien servicio esperamos regresar pronto
I tried three different dishes and couldn't finish any of them. You can find much better food at panda express. Pathetic.

Al principio no me pareció buena idea, pero me decidí, ya que era la opción más a la mano antes de instalarme en mi habitación después de un muy madrugado vuelo desde San Antonio-LA-Vegas. 
Un desayuno buffet muy rico y variado. Excelente servicio y muy buen precio. Tal vez de lo mejor en Las Vegas para desayunar.
Dentro del hotel New York New York.
Awesome friendly service.  Had the breakfast buffet.  Which was delicious! We were planning on breakfast at the Italian restaurant,  but missed it. Chin Chin saved the day.

We had a fantastic meal at the Chin Chin lunch buffet on our most recent trip to Vegas!  They have an incredible selection of the most popular Asian dishes, which is great for someone like me who can never quite decide what to order.  I was able to have a little of everything!  If you happen to be traveling with kids who aren't crazy about Asian food, they also have macaroni & cheese and chicken strips to keep the little ones happy while mom and dad feast on sushi (veggie rolls, Philly rolls and California rolls) and tons of Chinese favorites.  They have the stuff you crave as well as some really healthy choices if you've already put a little too much Vegas in your Vegas trip and you need some veggies.  On the opposite end of the spectrum, the dessert bar is incredible, too!  We will definitely be back!
Our server Terryl was the best server we had our entire trip to Vegas.  the food was great too.  Kung pao chicken was delish.

This was our 2nd time eating at this establishment. We waited 30mins for our meal and as everyone was eating their food I had to ask 2 different waitresses when my meal was coming up. I continue to wait at least another 10mins but by now I just got up and settled for the lukewarm pizza with no taste across the way. It took a while to get that delicious pizza and while I was walking back I noticed that my meal had FINALLY arrived..  My family told them I canceled it and I complained to the waitress and the manager and all I got was a sad face from them. To top off my night, I waited some more to pay the bill with my credit card and asked some random waiter behind me if he could just process it for me but he said that my waitress will be right with me! At this time now my Husband chimed in and just paid cash cuz he did not wanted to be in this horrible restaurant one second more.

AMAZING EXPERIENCE!!!!!!!!!
FOOD- 5 stars (salt and pepper shrimp)
SERVICE- 5 stars
ATMOSPHERE- 5 stars

I never would have thought such a good chinese restaurant could be slapped in the middle of Vegas. Will definitely be coming back

Great food and great service.  My 10yo actually asked to spend his birthday at the New York New York.  It's our first night and everything was great.  Our server Pedro was great and full of energy and made it a great dining experience.  Mongolian Beef, Crispy Orange Chicken, Chicken Fried Rice were all great!

[this is an old review posted recently]

It's Vegas so it gets an instant 5 star or instant negative 3 stars... Who cares.

Mid grade hotel... Attempt at mass appeal acceptable. Mass appeal compelling volume-dining in Vegas.  Reasonably priced (but only for Vegas. Staff was friendly and attentive (+1 star).

Decent open kitchen, post modern copper and polished aluminum accents filled the walls and ceiling (+1 star)

Mostly veggie friendly, (already mentioned) affordable for Vegas (or anywhere +1 star).

The food came out fresh but instantly... How'd they do that (+1 star)?

High-volume, obvious faux-everything decor, greasy food (-2 stars).

Hungry?  On a budget? In the south strip? Chinese an option? Chin Chin at New York, New York.
worst service, I have ever received, I realize your in a casino but food and service both was bad, which I guess is why they are always hiring
Great food and Jordan the server rocks. Reasonably priced breakfast buffet with tons of choices. Will definitely come back.

This place was open late and in the area if not for that I probably wouldn't have gone inside.  

It's Americanized Chinese food which is what I like.  I got the General Tso's chicken and it wasn't too spicy.  The Seafood noodles were also good this place is fairly priced @ $14-$15 per entree.

First of all, I'm Asian so my expectations for Chinese restaurants are quite high. This is a pretty good restaurant! I suggest it for people who like more Americanized Chinese Restaurants. But.... 3 stars because some dishes are sour. Also, like I said before, I like authentic Chinese foods. If you're living in the hotel NewYorkNewYork, I feel like you should try it out! Just a bit (not really) too much vinegar. DON'T GET THE PEANUT NOODLES, YOU WILL FEEL LIKE YOU ARE EATING NOODLES WITH VINEGAR ONLY!!! Otherwise, it's pretty good!

So a friend and I decided to try this restaurant because it was convenient (we were staying in the hotel) and because the menu sounded promising. 
We went for dinner and while the hostess was extremely nice our waiter left a lot to be desired. He didn't seem to be throughly impressed that he had to wait on someone (never smiled, never asked how we were). He took our drink orders, delivered them and then took our food orders. 
I ordered the chicken mushu and my friend ordered the Jean's Long Life Noodles. The food came out and while I was mixing my food together I saw a piece of plastic in my food. Most people would complain about it and send it back but I already knew our waiter could have cared less so I just decided not to eat anymore and pick off my friends dish (which was tasty by the way). Our waiter never came by to see how our food was (no surprise there) and never offered us a dessert menu, he just came by and dropped off the check. 
The funny part of this story is, when he saw me pull out a bunch of $100 bills he suddenly became extremely friendly towards us. I left a small tip for him (I used to work for tips as a blackjack dealer, so I sometimes feel guilty when I don't leave anything). I wasn't impressed with this place and wouldn't recommend it to people.
The food was excellent. The service was very attentive. The dining environment was very relaxing.

The girl who "greeted" me me was rude! I almost left immediately - and I should have. The food was lousy, the service was slow, everyone there seemed grouchy, the dishes were dirty and I had to ask TWICE for clean silverware. No tip and no return trip!
The Red Velvet Pancake Triangles are soooooo yummy. The Honey spicy jumbo shrimps are a must too. The service is superior too.

This place was okay. The food was alright. I had peanut noodles with chicken which wasn't bad. 

The wait staff really did a phenomenal job, though. Polite, fast, and courteous. Well done. 

The atmosphere was fine. It was very loud but that was because of a party that was seated near to us. It wasn't a problem for us, though. I doubt it's always like that.

Chin chin is affordable, because They give you an insane amount of food. And it's super fresh and tasty. So many options and the staff is super helpful. Their Buffett 12:30-2:30 is a great option as well! Also highly recommend their dragonfruit mojito.
One of the best restaurants ever is Chin Chin. The breakfast buffet is fantastic. They have some much food yet everything tastes great. There is great service too. It's not overpriced either.

Very pedestrian and underwhelming.

Ripped seats, fortunes and plastic wrappers on floor. Food was okay at best.

If you are in Vegas because you are from the Midwest and not used to the lights of Sin City, you will be fooled into thinking that Chin Chin is worthy of your money.  Don't make that mistake.

I'm giving four stars based on how it compares with other restaurants on the strip. Very reasonably priced, decent food and pretty quick. The Sunday brunch buffet is basic but it's only $12.95 which is about half the price of other Sunday buffets.

I should never expect much for chinese food in vegas.  We tried one roll and it was pretty decent.  However, it was very small.  Stay clear of the peanut noodle.  Overly salty and didn't offer much.  Plus the noodles were like spaghetti noodles.  The curry fried rice was decent.  Potsticker could have been worse.  They have happy hour for $5 martinis but they didn't have any alcohol taste in them.  Stay clear of the sushi shots.  That was advice from our server.  O yeah, service was pretty wack since there wasn't anyone in the restaurant.
Excellent Food, Courteous Service. Ate at the breakfast buffet. Reasonably priced, well stocked buffet. Waiter was very courteous and attentive.
Be wary of this place - used a certain credit card here once during my whole vegas trip, and 3 months later find it has been skimmed and a bunch of fraudulent charges show up.

I liked this place.  I thought this place would be very Americanized Chinese food, which I loathe, but I was pretty surprised that it wasn't all that Americanized.

My friends and I were looking for somewhere to eat, and somewhere that didn't take forever to serve food because we were headed to MGM to watch a show, and we had about 2 hours to eat and head over to MGM.  We saw this place and we asked the hostess how long the food takes to be served.  She said that it was pretty quick, so we believed her and went in.  I thought that she was just trying to make us stay so she told us that it would be soon, but IT WAS FAST!

We sat down, read the menu really quickly and picked out stuff immediately.  The food was served just as quickly!  And it was good!  The portions were HUGE.   I mean coming to Vegas you expect to spend a bunch of money, but getting gypped because it's Vegas after all, but you definitely get a run for your buck at this place.  I ordered a beef chow fun or something, and it wasn't as greasy as most Chinese restaurants have it, which is good!  I was fairly impressed with the food, quality, service, and money-to-food ratio. :)  

I'd definitely go back if I'm feeling some Chinese food in Vegas next time.
absolutely worthless. the food is expansive and too salty, no test at all.

Staff is super nice and engaging! They seem genuine in asking how thing's are.

We were there for brunch and enjoyed the offerings.

When I'm back in Vegas, I'll stop in.

Beau B.

Some dishes better than others. The service was bad. Poor service! Our waiter thought it was more important to buss a table than to get our forks while our food was already at our table. Do you expect me to eat Meat with a spoon? Luckily the manager saved the day by bringing everything we asked for.

Went at dinner time on a Sunday night and there was no wait and we were seated promptly. Wife ordered the sweet and sour pork with a side of white rice, I ordered the chicken and rib combo with fried rice and vegetables. Food came out in about 20 min, and it was ok. Wife enjoyed her food, my chicken was dry, and the ribs were good, but not great. The fried rice was ok, would have been better if they gave you the option to add shrimp or chicken to it, but since it came with the meal that wasnt an option. The thing I don't like is 90% of the sides are a la carte so if you want chow mein or fried rice with your meal be prepared to pay $10-$15 more. Overall you can get better and that's sad for me to say as I'm a big NYNY fan. Our waitress ( who was the bartender helping out) was awesome!!!
Good food.  We did sushi and appetizers.  They have a buffet but I don't do buffets.  I will say our waiter, Jordan, was fun, friendly and a little sarcastic (we enjoyed his sarcasm).

I hate doing this cause I used to love chin chin. It has been one of my favorite restaurants for the lats 10 years and when I say this I'm talking about the one in Brentwood. Now in regards to the chin chin at the NY NY hotel in Vegas, is the worse The quality of the food is bad and the service, perfect match....horrible!!!. if you're looking for a pleasant place with a good food and good service this is not the place.

Staying in New York New York this is a very convenient breakfast stop.  4 of us had the breakfast buffet which was loaded with all of the classics plus a few surprises like breakfast fried rice.  All very good.  The coffee seemed very bitter and had a weird taste, the only disappointment in our visit.  Linda & Johana were very helpful in making our visit a 4 star.  You just can't beat great service while nursing a hangover.  Overall a great breakfast spot, we will have to try the lunch next time.

We had delicious experience at Chin Chin at NY, NY in Vegas. We were seated immediately after a very welcoming greeting by the hostess. We started with two very tasty drinks and then tackled an extensive menu. Rodrigo was our waiter and guided us on selections with thoughtful precision. His suggestions and guidance were spot on. He had a great laugh, very attentive and engaging. Our food - from appetizer to a scrumptious chocolate-maple cake were perfect. The velvet corn soup and tangerine chicken hit the spot. Servings are large and perfect for sharing. You can easily over-order. Prices were very reasonable.

Overall a delightful dinner.

We had lunch here and it was delicious! The mooshu pork with lettuce was spot on. It was to our surprise that the head chef was only 21 years old!! This Asian/Chinese food was on par with the ones in LA. I will definitely come here again.

We arrived after a show on Saturday night, no reservation with a party of 8. The staff was friendly and got us seated in a matter of minutes at a comfortable table. In our party two were sushi fans, one is gluten free, and remainder like traditional chinese fair. Everyone was pleased. The waiter was great. The cheesecake was amazing!

Horrible experience. Credit card system went down, they requested we pay in cash or take photo of our credit card so they could charge later. Manager handle situation poorly and very unprofessional. Do not eat at this location. They are shady and seemed to want to get over on our family.

Came here super late to eat dinner at 9:30 p.m. The hostess was really friendly. The waiter gave us a lot of information on the specials, what was good, etc. He also mentioned that if we don't see something we like on the menu to make a custom order (you rarely hear that at restaurants). Service was a little slow. Warning: 2 rolls of eel is $10. I was expecting more rolls but it's Vegas! Overall very nice place. It's kind of hidden in New York New York, it's too bad it's not in a better / more visible location. I would definitely recommend and come back here again.

Great chinese food. I would recommend this over PF Changs. The bartender there named David did a great job in serving us. They also serve sushi even though its not chinese food, but it is pretty good. Chin Chin also has a breakfast buffett which serves you regular breakfast food, not chinese food for breakfast

Must say that the service we had tonight was one of the best we've had in awhile. Our waiter CORY was awesome. Top notch service. Was very polite. Provided all that we needed and was on top of everything. He should definitely be looked upon as what waiters should base their service on.
Wonderful food, wonderful service!  Big thanks to Alex and Corey for making dinner such a wonderful experience.

Being in New York New York I expected at least mediocre Chinese food.  This was definitely the worst Chinese food I have ever eaten.  The drinks were so sweet we could not drink them, and the server even mentioned they were bad!  Then the food tasted like vinegar and chili sauce with a couple pieces of chicken.  We could not even tell the difference between sweet & sour sauce and orange chicken sauce.  Any dive buffet in any town would have far superior food.  Chin Chin's service was the worst we have had in Vegas as well!  Skip this place at all costs.

I wish I would of found this place before my most recent trip to Vegas. I have been to New York New York many times and never even knew this place was here. It is kind of hidden. Let me start out by saying the food was fantastic and the service was just as good. The wife and I shared the Generals Chicken  and a Las Vegas Roll which were recommended by our waiter Jordan. The food was delicious and just the right amount. Jordan was very attentive and a pleasure to talk with during lunch. The highlight of our lunch was Jordan bringing the Wife and I a slice of cheesecake to share in honor of our anniversary we would celebrate the following day. The cheesecake was delicious and a pleasant surprise to say the least. Just want to thank Jordan again for the awesome service and we will be back for sure during our next trip to Sin City!  Peace!!!!

Bad customer service.

Server forget my napkin, he didn't come back to even ask me how's my food. I have to asked the hostess for my check. 

Not coming bank and won't recommend to my friends.

This place is terrible.... we were seated right away but it took 10 minutes for a server to acknowledge us.... we get our drinks and our order in.... dumplings and seafood noodles.... it took 30 minutes  for these two items... The place wasn't even busy... When we finally got our food we were very disappointed.  The noodles were overpowered in soy sauce and the shrimp and scallops were over. cooked. The dumplings were absolutely tasteless.... I didn't dare send them back because I didn't want to wait another 30 minutes. I couldn't complain to the server anyway because after the food was dropped....we were forgotten about.... never again at this place .... I suggest you do the same

I used to love Chin Chin, but the service and food quality has gone down considerably. The decor is very nice and it is inside one of the best themed casinos on the Strip. Unfortunately, there is a loss of subtly in their cuisine. The flavors are too harsh and they would benefit from a menu overhaul and more careful attention to subtly of flavors.

Dim sum and the Singapore Style Noodles are what I would recommend, but all of their dishes are quite delectable.  The first time I tried Chin Chin, I was with a group of 12 during the Thanksgiving holiday weekend.  We ordered about 20 dishes between the 12 of us- food came quickly and HOT, and the quality of the food was great.  Have a craving for chinese food while in Vegas?  I would recommend this establishment.
Absolutely delicious food very friendly staff well priced. It cost me less than $100 to feed a family of 6 I would highly recommend it to any one.
Anita and Jordan are excellent waitstaff. Very attentive and helpful. LOVE the food too!
The service was very slow. Took forever for drinks. The breakfast buffet was limited but the food was good. Service workers were cold and appeared to want you in and out. Probably wouldn't go back.

Stopped here before hitting the road home on our annual trip to Las Vegas. Arrived about 11am for Sunday breakfast and was very happy with the breakfast buffet. A lot to choose from, reasonably priced ($23), and the service was great. Made to order omelettes as well as buffet style. Hostesses were cordial and our server Jay was awesome. He was friendly, prompt, knowledgeable, and great overall. We will definitely make this an every trip stop before we head home Sundays. My only complaint was the restaurant was fairly small but the food and service make up for that. Worth the try--highly recommend it.
Andrea is the best ever! She needs a raise or we WILL WALK!!!  Ryan is THE MAN! Focus up!!
Good food with amazing service. While breakfast was transitioning to lunch, the manager Linda and our server Jordan completely accommodated our requests. We'll be back for sure
Great Restaurant next to The New Yorker Tower Elevators and The American Style Breakfast Buffet is Amazing!
Solid chinese, little overpriced though.  Service is eh-ok.

Some would come here for the food, but I come here for the service. Hands down one of my favorite brunch places, not only is there a mean red velvet pancake, but the wide array of benedicts, omelettes, fruit and pastries are what all do it for me. But let me tell you what really shines. Our server Jordan. Not only was he courteous to my disabled mother, he was also attentive and always there when we needed service. Such a great conversationalist. Will
be dining here again!
Very very good food and customer service. Our waiter Pedro did an excellent job and was extremely welcoming to us.
The lunch buffet was delicious and Steven was a wonderful waiter! So glad we took advantage of the buffet!

Tastes just like home!

While roaming the Las Vegas Strip on our last day, we wanted to eat somewhere that was close to our comfort food. Being away from the island for about a week, you tend to miss food from there. In my case, my type of "local food" isn't a spam musubi or loco moco. I actually wanted to eat Asian food. Walking through New York New York after visiting the Hershey Store, I wanted to steer clear of the oily, fast food pizza and fried delicacies. 

Thankfully, one of the Chin Chin host/hostess were outside holding up their menu. Can't miss them. They are strategically standing right in front of the "We're still open during construction" words on the wall. We perused the menu and when the hostess said they mainly serve Japanese, Chinese and Dim Sum I was sold.

We walked with her to the entrance to the restaurant and waited a few minutes for a table to get cleaned. Our waiter Rob was really punctual and energetic. He showed us where the beverages were and the libation menu too. We settled for non-alcoholic drinks. Yes, I know....BORING but we were catching a flight that night and I still needed to pack. 

After contemplating the selections and reminding myself that my eyes were bigger than my stomach, we decided on the Szechuan Dumplings, Hot & Sour Soup, Pepper Steak, and Peanut Noodles. It wasn't long until our soup was sitting in front of us, waiting to be ladled up. This soup was delicious. Being of Asian descent, I feel like I'm a bit more particular on my "Asian" foods especially away from the motherland. The soup was the perfect amount of spicy and sour. It was very well balanced in flavor and we just wanted to drink it all up. 

Next on deck came the Pepper Steak. Now this might not be the most praised review on the Pepper Steak because I'm not a fan of bell peppers. This steak was oh-so juicy and the spiciness of the steak was minimal. There was so much bell pepper flavor that it overpowered even the onions. This was definitely my husband's favorite of the four dishes ordered.

The Peanut Noodles and Szechuan Dumplings were delivered at the exact same time. Let's talk dumplings! If you've had dumplings at a dim sum place, they are not usually covered in the sauce. Well, these were not your usual dumplings. The size of the dumplings were the same but these things were smothered in a cilantro sauce. When taking the first bite into the dumpling, you definite taste the cilantro but you also taste something sweet. Very unusual for dim sum. These babies were the highlight for me. Because of its unique taste, it will be forever remembered. 

The Peanut Noodles can be ordered with either chicken or shrimp but we felt like going plain jane with these. At first glance, the noodles glisten with the peanut sauce. Be careful of that first bite, it's thicker than it looks. If you want something filling, then order the peanut noodles. They will quickly fill you up but only order it if you love peanuts and or peanut butter. That is really what you are eating. These weren't that spicy. I think if you can stand a little heat, like a tease of heat then you should be ok. 

It was great discovering this new restaurant on the strip. I can't wait to go back and see it after the construction/renovation. Be daring, be bold and try Chin Chin.

With so many food options in Vegas, I would not typically choose to eat here as I always had the impression that Chin Chin's was super Americanized, overpriced Chinese food.    Well, unfortunately I wasn't wrong.  I went with the Chinese chicken salad because that's their "famous" dish.  It was OK but nothing special.  They were super stingy on the amount of chicken, and the ginger dressing was a bit strong.  The har gow (shrimp steamed dumplings) were horrible.  They were some of the worst I've had as they were really soggy, the dumpling skin was too thick, and the shrimp was unidentifiable and overcooked.  And to add insult to injury, I was super thirsty after my meal.  If they're going to use MSG so liberally, why doesn't the food taste better?  Never again!

Were this restaurant in my hometown, I would give it only 3 stars. But is is one of the better moderately priced restaurants on the strip, so plus one star for that. The portions are generous and many dishes are in the $12 - $15 range.
Koong is an awesome sushi chef! The sushi she makes are YUMMY! her friendly customer service as was very awesome as well! Thumbs up!
Food is totally tasteless, big portions, atmosphere poor.
Boring environment + moderate food + overpriced = chin chin

This place has excellent Chinese food & the buffet breakfast is as good as it gets. The breakfast is awesome. You have to have the mini potato pancakes, and eat as much of the bacon as possible. It's cheaper then Starbucks. I get 2 venti ice coffees & 2 breakfast sandwiches as sometimes I can't eat lunch at the trade show. Breakfast at Chin Chin is about $20.50. Starbucks is $26. The dinner menu covers all of Asia. Sushi to general chow chicken which is excellent by the way. Ask to sit in Kyle's area as she is an excellent waitress.

Sushi was good, but overpriced by a lot. The Sushi chef thought he was all mighty and talked derogatory about the other employees. We were sitting right there not like we could here. Just bad business. We ordered Sushi that was a special order, but the waitress got the wrong order. It was then given to another table that ordered one not fresh. Will definitely go elsewhere.

Between two Vegas trips, I've now been here three times. Wish I could give half stars, because I'd up this to four and a half if I could. The prices are very, very reasonable ($7 for pork buns, $6-10 for sushi rolls), and the food is top notch. The service is also great. I was nervous about making a 9:30 show across the street at MGM, sitting down to dinner with eight people a little after 8 p.m. We made it back across the street in plenty of time, and the waiter even courteously split our checks. 

Word of warning: I'd stick to the sushi and the dumpling-type stuff. The traditional Chinese food here is just average. That's why it gets four and a half stars instead of five. The sushi and the dumplings, on the other hand, are really good.

The first time I went, I got the mongolian beef. Total meh. People who got other, typical Chinese food (lo mein, fried rice, etc.) had similar experiences. 

Came back this year and wised up, ordering a spicy tuna roll, some hot and sour soup and the chin chin bao. All of it was top notch. Their spicy tuna, especially, is among the better sushi I've ever had. I tried a little bit of other people's varieties (shrimp tempura, some specialty rolls) and they were really good, too. The Chin Chin bao? Wow. Three puffy, steamed pork buns that pack a delicious barbecue flavor, served with a REALLY spicy wasabi mustard (good if you're in to that, my spicy food loving friends tell me) and a tasty chili sauce for dipping. The buns really fill you up in a good way -- definitely enough for a meal with just them and the sushi. Had some open-faced dumplings that were really good, too. 

For ordering two sushi rolls, you get a sizeable jug of hot saki -- a nice touch. They also knew how to make a good Manhattan, though their bourbon selection was limited. I'll definitely be back if I come back to Vegas. Not only is the sushi a nice, light compliment to other heavy meals I'm likely to have, the prices are very low by Vegas strip standards.

I'm in Vegas at least twice a year for buisness and try to visit diffrent restaurants when I can. This time i met a friend at New York New York and we decided to got to the Chinese restaurant. The server informed us that the portions are large and it's recommended to eat family style. We were plesent surprised that the portions were indeed large.  This is odd since most places on the strip over charge for food. I had the Mongolian Beef which was perfectly glazed with green onions nestled atop a bed of crispy white noodles. We also ordered the sweet and sour shrimp which actually came with too much shrimp.  I asked the server for some pepper oil, which arrived a warm in a gravy boat with large red peppers. The food quality was top notch, fulok flavor and plenty to go around. From beginning to end the experience was incredible. I will surely visit in the future.

Very pretty and convenient restaurant. Our waiter was very attentive.  The food was a disappointment, though. The sushi was supermarket grade at best--stay away from it! Wor wonton soup was unorthodox and bland. The Mongolian beef, however, was pretty good. Hot and sour soup not bad if you like it BLAZING hot. Verdict: OK if you want spicy meat dishes; avoid the place if you're inclined to order fish.

At the current time one should avoid this restaurant.  For some reason they are staying open during a renovation, and it is extremely noisy.  The choices on the buffet are slim pickings and at this time you are better served to take your business elsewhere.  I wish them luck and I'm sure after the renovation all will be swell.

Dined in a chin chin. Food was amazing! Everybody that I had was mouthwatering. My server Jordan was so friendly and kept checking up on me. I came in during the lunch buffet and my favorite dishes were the California rolls and beef and broccoli. During my meal I was greeted by the managers Linda and Kyle who are extremely friendly. I would recommend this place in a heartbeat if anyone asks. Amazing food!! Wonderful service. Awesome staff.

Great Asian fusion , a diamond in the rough if you will... you see it's not a big celebrity chef driven restaurant, and it's not in the top tiered hotels on the Las Vegas strip.. but the prices, service, selection, and food quality are unmatched !!!

Food was pretty average. Somewhere between Panda Express and PF Chang :) Our server Ben was very cool. Two stars for him! And drinks were outstanding. Expensive but all good drinks in Vegas are expensive. Two stars for that. 

Took away one for food. Good portion but nothing outstanding.
Out with family in Las Vegas..decided to skip a buffet tonight and came here.  Food was tasty...servers good.  Very noisy because of superbowl.

Overall, not impressed. First, I must say I've been to the original Chin Chin on Sunset Blvd and the food was great. Chinese chicken salad is the best. Las Vegas version, not so much. The Chinese chicken salad was ok, but the chicken itself tasted pungent. White meat chicken breast should have almost no flavor and should take on the flavor of the sauce. Not in this case. The taste was just way off. My friend had the cashew chicken which was good, but lacked flavor. Had to add soy sauce to dish to eat. Really good food should never need a condiment. What brought this review to 2 stars were the delicious egg rolls. They were awesome. But unfortunately the bad tasting chicken left a horrible taste in my mouth. Would probably not go back.  Not just for egg rolls.  Not worth the time and effort it takes to get to New York New York hotel.
I was there yesterday. Service was awesome. Food was crappy. We ordered the tangarine chicken and the orange chicken.  Both sauces were thick and tasteless.   It's a shame.

The breakfast buffet is highly recommended! From basic items (scrambled eggs, pancakes, bacon), to gourmet benedicts and omelettes made to order, this buffet has it all. This was a great value compared to some other Strip competitors! Our check for two (no alcohol) came to $46 with gratuity for our awesome waiter, Andres!

The breakfast buffet is worth every penny! The food is amazing.. But most importantly, the staff is phenomenal!!! Our server, True, provided excellent service! I'm amazed at his attention. Additionally, the Manager was super friendly & very funny! 
I highly recommend eating here.

Had lunch here yesterday and it was excellent! 

Our waitress, Jordan, was very nice and responsive to my family's needs. We ordered entrees instead of the buffet, but the servings were large and the prices very reasonable especially for Las Vegas. The only thing is that the food isn't as authentic as something you'd order on Spring Mountain.

Overall, really great! Will definitely be coming back!!

Chin Chin? No no. I will say that the service was fantastic and that is why I gave it the 2nd star, however the food is so bad. The lettuce wraps were the best thing we had but that's not saying much. The potstickers smelled like ass and tasted plain. The apricot chicken was bland and unappetizing and the house noodles tasted smokey and burnt. It was not good. Find another Chinese restaurant.

This restaurant is my favorite place on the strip to eat and my favorite thing about staying in the NYNY hotel. Not only can I eat my meal in the bar, close to the casino, but the yakisoba noodle dish I order - each and every time I stay here - is bombdiggity. 
I know it's weird to like a restaurant this much, over just one dish...however; when you find something you really, really like, you must stick with it. That means, I will walk over from the MGM or the Excalibur (God forbid I have to ever stay there again) or catch the tram from the Luxor or Mandalay Bay to have my favorite bowl of yakisoba. After all, buffets are only fun the 1st day or 2. Then, it's just too much and too expensive (the average about $25 now and higher on Sunday mornings). 
The restaurant itself is clean and lovely, especially for a Chinese restaurant. No offense, but Chinese restaurants are usually adorned with dated Chinese decor. This place is modern, light and sparse. Not dark and spooky (at least, that's what the Chinese restaurants in Portland are like). 
I don't have plans to visit Vegas in the near future, but can say for certain that I will eat here when I return.
Do not.  As a local. I will not come back. Slow. And over priced. Let the tourists pay those prices. Nit me. Mediocre food too   Stay away
I order a pad thai and chin chin chicken salad. Both of them tasted soooo SOUR ! Will never come back !

What a difference a year makes. I've enjoyed this venue on many of my Vegas trips but it has changed drastically. They remodeled since my last visit and the space is now incredibly bright & loud/noisy. The brunch menu has changed with less selection only having signature omelets or build your own. Speaking of menus, they handed us menus that were filthy. We sat at the bar and the staff seemed disorganized. The omelet I ordered never arrived, when I asked about it they promptly brought something that I didn't order. I ended up just eating off the buffet. Their buffet has always been "OK" with typical breakfast items but felt their strength was the menu. I have always liked their $5 bloody mary's. The manager did comp one of our meals since mine never arrived and asked that we come back to give them another try. I don't think I will be back not just because of this meal, but the space is not as quaint & quiet as it once was.
Great lunch buffet.  Sushi,  spring rolls,  variety of dishes,  tons of desserts.  All tasty and fresh.  Definitely would recommend!!

I always like coming here in Vegas when I can. I love the food, but this time the wait sevice I received from Pedro P. , was exceptional!! I took my Mom to Vegas for her 60th birthday(best son ever, I know)....maybe I can win son of the year this year!! 

Everything we ordered was really, really good, from the pork pot stickers to the young chow rice and the spicy honey shrimp. That last plate is very spicy, so be ready!  Pedro P. was there often and running around the place like a waiter who cares about his tables! When a waitress or waiter hustle like that, it shows extraordinary service and that's exactly what we got from Mr. Pedro P.! He even surprised my Mom with a birthday treat of cheesecake, berries and chocolate syrup!! He even sang a note or two from the happy birthday song to my mom by himself! Not much of a singer, but one hell of a waiter!!!

There was also a nice young manger lady with great energy and great service as well....didn't catch her name, sorry.

So if you want great food and even better service, this is the place to get BOTH!! If you're lucky enough to get Pedro P., then you'll be in great hands. He truly was one of the best waiters/waitress I've had in a long time....and I eat out a lot!

Thanks Pedro P!!...good looking out homie!

We had a sushi roll and the Dim Sum and then Sum with the slaw salad, fried rice, and Hunan chicken.  Both the roll and the combo were good.  Not incredible, but good.  What was not great was the pork belly.  This was mostly because it was not pork belly.  Trying to pass off a fatty piece of loin was pretty disappointing as everything else was good. Free refills on tea and soda and the service was fast and friendly.  But seriously, that "pork belly" was bad.  Bad enough that I only took two bites, one excitedly and the next one to make sure that yes in fact that was totally tasteless pork loin they were trying to pass off as pork belly.   Bad enough to only give Chin Chin 1 star.

Wow, complete garbage. If you like Chinese food, don't go here. The menu is standard crappy Chinese food staples, sweet and sour pork and fried rice. 

The food was not even decent, in fact I'd prefer Panda Express (and Panda sucks but at least it is priced as such). The entrees were goopy and overly sweet and sour when not appropriate. I ordered Kung Pao Chicken and thought, how could you screw this up! It was very tangy and sour as if they added far too much vinegar. The sauce was goopy and NOT tasty. 

The worst part for me was the rice. It cost $3 extra if you want a side of white rice. It says it is steamed rice but it was more like yesterday's Uncle Ben's instant rice that was microwaved to reheat. All that, and I haven't even mentioned the price!

The price is expensive even for a casino when you consider the comparables. $18 entrees and $3 extra for rice? That's just NOT ok if the quality is complete garbage.

Overall, the only reason to go here is if you need to appreciate your local crappy Chinese place more, this place will make it look like a 5 star restaurant.

I am just reviewing some of my. . well, reviews. . .and wanted to say this place is still my fav Las Vegas Chinese food.  It is just delicious and my mom and I still go there,  split the orange chicken and enjoy every bite.  Perfect amount for the two of us even though we often feel compelled to order more.

Chinese cuisine is something I really enjoy. We had a stop at the Newyork casino in Vegas at Chin Chin for our lunch. It appeared really expensive. Though we were in a dilemma we wanted to have our meal there, and thus went. Not being sure of the taste there we wanted to be on a safer side instead of experimenting. So we ordered a chicken fried rice. Trust me when I say this that this was the best chicken fried rice I have ever tasted in my entire life. Best flavour with best ambience and best hospitality staff. Its been almost 3 months that I had this meal and I still cherish it. Amazing food! I admit that I dint try other dishes but am sure that the restaurant has good flavours in the air. A must visit when you go to vegas! And yes the price was very reasonable. We had one chicken fried rice for 10bucks. One awesome experience! Thumbs up and cheers!

I wonder to know how people gave 3 or 4 stars?! Everything is ok, best service and good quality make a great special launch. I strongly recommend this buffet. One of the best buffet I've been there. They all try to make sure their customers  are enjoying. Christmas eve 2016

Very impressed with this Asian food available on the strip ! After a couple of nights of eating out my body was craving veggies done home style aka Chinese.

We had a plethora of dishes, all were extremely good and not too expensive.  Three people, one person had wine and the total was $80 with still some leftovers (which of course does you no good when you're in Vegas with hotel rooms with no frig or microwave.)  Service was really good, waitress was very thorough about letting us know the prep and cook times for dishes that took longer.

This place has been on the strip for a while and I can see why, it satisfies that Chinese food craving without a lot of pretention.

Gross food, and with the name like Chin Chin, I should've known. 

Ordered the Wor Wonton Noodle Soup and Yang Chow Fried Rice.

Wor Wonton Noodle Soup had a child's hand serving of noodles in a salty, msg-infused water, bbq pork was dry and the wontons were just a fail. 

Yang Chow Fried Rice was worse. Mooshy rice cooked in a pool of oil which gives it a huge unappetizing shine, and it was flavorless, you actually had to add soy sauce.  And every Asian knows you shouldn't have to add soy sauce to food like that....

2 stars for decent service, waiter was nice enough to get a new batch of fried rice.

We went with a group of 14 people. Nothing but friendliness. Imagine a restaurant in America where the waitress brings everyone water along with other drinks - thats pretty cool. 

Velvet soup was recommended to us by friends and was great order a bowl and share with atleast 6 people. The Anthony's noodles and General Tso's chicken was superb.

menu prizes are very very reasonable - Don't miss this place
Don't eat sushi here. Terrible Bought 50 platter got 2 ebi 2 hamachi 2 tuna 2 tako and 2 unidentified.  That's it no roe uni etc in pics on website.  Quality was fair.  Anywhere else is better.
Food is excellent I they deserve 5 stars for sure. Everything tasted great. Fish is absolutely fresh of its kind.

The only downfall to our experience was having to wait a couple long minutes before being served.  Other than than that minor mishap, everything else was good.  We had the Mongolian beef and the Pad Thai.

Felt so welcome right from the check in desk. I ordered my meal to go, was invited to sit at the bar while I waited. Ordered one of the best Moscow mule's I have ever had and was offered a glass of water I could take back to my room with my dinner. The wonton soup and pork noodles were delicious. SO delicious that I returned to plate 3x until I finished the entire thing. I look forward to my next trip to Vegas as this will be one of my go to spots.

Wanted to treat family members to a nice dinner, but was so disappointed!  The beef-broccoli had inedible mushrooms; they were like shoe leather!  I had to spit one out in a doily that was under a teapot (didn't want to use my cloth napkin for this).  I couldn't even cut it with a knife!  The noodles had a bad texture and flavor; they tasted old & gummy.  The orange chicken was pretty good, I stuck with that & my rice, which they charge extra for.  Most Chinese restaurants include rice with their entrees.  Our party of four had a bill of $66.97 & that was without drinks (only 1 in the group had a pot of hot tea).  I wouldn't have minded the high price if the food was good.

Breakfast and Lunch buffets are awesome! Staff is great and shoutout to Anita as she made our final meal at NYNY amazing! The $19 per person is DEF worth it folks!

Breakfast:
We enjoyed this buffet over the MGM grand! 
- Bacon/sausage links were good.
- to order omelets amazing!
- scrambled eggs and crab Benedict nice touch and flavorful!
- coffee and OJ was great... Anita even hooked us up with to go cups... Well needed!
- fruit and chocolate covered strawberries were fruit and sweet! 

Lunch:
- had sushi as we were full from breakfast. The California rolls were awesome and this place also rolls em fresh!

We had a late start so were able to enjoy breakfast and lunch for the same price as we happened to dine during shift change! We will definitely return if and when in Vegas! Enjoy folks.
Alex is amazing! Ask for him as a server! The sushi is the best I've ever had in Vegas!
Awesome and quick service. Our server Pedro was excellent with a cute smile. Lots of variety in the Buffet. Fresh and nicely arranged.

First impressions generally tell me what the future will hold ... with this restaurant, it's unremarkable.  I ordered the pineapple fried rice, which is mixed with cashews and shrimp.  The shrimp are tiny and the pineapple is small and few as well.  The whole meal was marginal at best.  There are so many other places to eat in this city.  Skip this place or try their sushi, and go somewhere else.   PS: Service was friendly and affable.
We have the 2 for 1 Buffett breakfast special before 9am. Good omelette and buffet selection.

They have a really nice breakfast buffet for a fair price!!! Got a good selection of breakfast items!! If you don't want to spend $25 to $35 for a huge buffet that you only going to eat less than half the stuff they have than this place is for you!!!
We hadn't been back here in many years due to a bad experience.  But we were so glad to give them another try!  Absolutely the best Asian food on the strip.  Can't wait to get back!!

Service was fantastic.  Our waitress was extremely busy running the bar as well as waiting on our table and she never missed a beat. Pretty talented. Unfortunately the food a Chin Chin is below average for the price you pay.  I understand it's Vegas, but value of product against its price want the best. We had the won ton stars as an app, I had the spicy seafood noodles and the wife had Orange Chicken (which that is what she eats at every Chinese restaurant). The spicy seafood noodles was to contain shrimp, calamari, and scallops in the noodles.  There was not one shrimp in the noodles. For $18 probably better not skimp on the shrimp.  The orange chicken that my wife had was $17 plus $3 for white rice and she said it truly was average.  By the time the damage was done it was a sub par $65 meal.  I'd suggest saving a couple bucks and head to Panda Express. Atmosphere was great though and service was great. Food was not the star of the show.

This was my first ever good sushi experience.  I'd only ever had bad sushi years and years ago, so I really didn't think I'd like it.  I'm glad I gave it a second chance.  We were pleased with all the sushi rolls we ordered.

The food was excellent! We started off with the wonton stars (crab wontons) with a delicious Thai chili sweet sauce for dipping. Unlike most places, the wontons were packed with cream cheese! So good! For dinner I had the Tomato Garlic Chicken it was DELICIOUS! So flavorful with a lot of chicken, water chestnuts and green bell peppers. The others I was with ordered Kung Pao Chicken, California Rolls, and Lo Mein. Everything was excellent And our dishes came with a choice of brown, white or fried rice. The service on the other hand was slow as molasses.  Not to mention our waiter was just completely rude, I would say however I would come back for the food, but they need to do something with their staff!
Nice environment. The choice of food is OK for lunch, don't expect too much. The food is a combination of American influenced Chinese food with some sushi, vet spring rolls. The dessert is nice.

Pros: very reasonable price, espeically if you use the yelp 2 for 1 deal! Server was quick with drinks. Xmas sweet decorations wete real and very cute.best mac and cheese ever!
Cons: apart from the mac and cheese, quality of food was pretty poor. Edible but not that great. And why have a server at a buffet?!? I suppose its good for employment statistics but we couldve got our own drinsk very easily and not had to tip!

How did I get to Chinny Chin Chin?? Welllllll, my gluten-intolerant friend (rolls eyes) and I were going to watch TIM MCGRAW & FAITH HILL at the T-Mobile Arena! YEEEEHAW! What's an Asian girl going to a country concert?? Asian people listen to country music you racists! Anyways that's besides the point because we still went to eat Chinese food (I'm not Chinese but it's Asian so close enough), so I kept true to my Asian roots - phew. 

Anyhow, we got there right before the rush, which I thought would be nice but nope, still waited for our food for what felt like forever (it was about 25 mins - so pretty much forever). I was going to knock them down 1 star for the wait but then when the food came I forgot all about the wait. 

JESSICA SHUT UP, what did you eat?? Well damn don't be so rude. So friends, I got the Crispy Spicy Honey Shrimp thing and my friend got the gluten-conscious Honey Walnut Shrimp. BOTH WERE REALLY GOOD AND I HIGHLY RECOMMEND. We also washed it down with 2 Lychee martini dranks. I would come back to order these two dishes but everything else looked meh and overpriced. I'd rather go to panda.

Great breakfast buffet!  

Chin Chin's doesn't say on the website that they have a breakfast buffet.  But it was good.  The previous day we had gone to the breakfast buffet at MORE in the Luxor.  Chin Chin has the superior buffet when it comes to quality of food.  The selection was very good.  I would recommend this buffet.  The service was very good as well.  Jose was very busy but he kept us stocked up on coffee.

Ive been a frequent to chin chin since 2001, and the restaurant has changed drastically in 16 years. It went from Chinese to Japanese and the decor is not as nice as it once was, plus the food has equally transformed. Service was not the best, and the plates and silverware were not as clean as it should be.

Came here for the breakfast buffet. Was pretty crowded that morning, but it was easy to get to what you wanted. 

Many choices of things to eat. All the go to breakfast foods. Bacon, sausage, pancakes, cereal, etc. They also had more specialty breakfast items like red velvet pancakes. I will say one thing not good was that the eggs with steak inside of them... Didn't have any steak. The best thing was the omelette. Tell your server what you want, and they will do it. You can even get shrimp in it! Try it, it's very good and the omelette was cooked perfect. 

The price for the buffet was outstanding for Vegas. You can that along with a drink like orange juice for under $20. I was shocked when my bill came to see that. Can't go wrong with the place.
Chin-Chin was our last choice for dinner and it wasnt that great.  I have had way better chinese and definitely better sushi.   If you can afford something else in NY, NY,  go elsewhere.

WHAT??!!  I cant believe this place has 4 stars!!!  the people reviewing this place have obviously never had good chinese food!  we came here for their breakfast/brunch and it was pretty awful.  they had regular eggs and cantonese eggs, which was eggs mixed with what was supposed to be chinese sausage and some other stuff - not good.  they also had egg fu young, which was also yuck!  they also had bacon and sausage and french toast...how is that chinese??  the only two things that were just ok were the egg rolls and the dumplings, but note that they aren't good...they're just ok.  i gave it 2 stars instead of one bacause the service was good and i didn't find a bug or anything in my food.  i don't think this place is worth the $14, even though that's pretty cheap for a buffet in vegas.  i know what a good chinese breakfast is and this sure ISN'T it!
Had the Breakfast Buffet and it was delicious and affordable 17.00 for adults and 9.00 for children. The staff was very nice and friendly. I am definitely coming back

We were looking for somewhere to eat before Zumanity.  We called Chin Chin and made reservations a few hours before just to be on the safe side.  When we arrived there was a small line - but we got right in.  Service was a little slow and the food was just plain blah.  I am shocked that people recommend this place and use the word superb in their reviews.
As always, the spicy tuna tartare with avocado on fried wontons was excellent.  I hate that I have to travel 1000 miles just to eat this.

If you're ok with take-out quality Chinese food at Vegas casino prices, this place will do. If you want sushi, avoid it. The sushi was flavorless, rubbery, viciously overpriced. Their saki menu is limited to $40/bottle low end stuff and $16/bottle pink stuff. Not a Japanese restaurant. I've had supermarket sushi experiences that trump this by a mile.

We were hungry and needed to eat right away. Didn't see anything interesting to eat in this food court. So we decided to eat here. We split a Chinese chicken salad witch was good. could have used more greens. Main course was ribs and chicken. chicken was good and the ribs was good too. But the cause was way to salty ! And the sause was mixed with the rice so it was like eating mushy salty rice LOL . Was ok . I tried my friend food and that was to salty to ! 
I have to give them three stars because the chicken was cooked well and the ribs was good.

Great service staff! 

Great food! 

Their breakfast buffet was so good, we will intentionally come back.

 I almost don't want to write a raving review because I selfishly don't want it to be packed the next time I go to Vegas. The wait wasn't long, and I'm still trying to find the words to describe the many food options.  There are many options in the egg department, lots of French toast options, their bacon tasted real..... Just try it.

After spending a fortune on mediocre food along the strip, I just happened to be at New York New York when I noticed this restaurant and decided to give it a shot. Listen, a chicken/shrimp fried rice is less than $9 here and taste like a decent chinese food !!! Now where on the strip would you find such a fair price ? On top of that the portion was quite generous and the service was fast !! I will DEFINITELY go back, trust me. Folks RUN AWAY from Panda express across the street. The food taste like plastic and cost bout $10!! Pouah !

My husband went to Chin Chin after a few days of me wanting sushi. We were in the NYNY casino and I decided NOW was the time for sushi! I saw chin chin and looked the menu over. Everything was reasonably priced, considering it's the LV Strip. The staff was all very professional and kind. We sat at the bar, the bartender was very welcoming and easy to talk to. He made a few suggestions for us. I forget the name of our appetizer he suggested, but it was a fried wonton. It was so good. Then we ordered a California roll topped with yellowtail and some different sauces, that was delicious. But our absolute favorite and most memorable was the "monkey brain". It's a tuna ball covered with avocado and a couple sauces, when you dip into it, it really looks kinda "brainy". It was without a doubt very memorable and extremely delicious. I had never had any sushi so whimsical and fun, not to mention yummy! I recommend that to everyone!!
I can't wait for our next trip to Vegas and our next monkey brain from ChinChin!!
We had hot and sour soup and lettuce wraps.  Soup was luke warm but tasty.   Lettuce wraps were good but not PF Chang's.  server was nice.

NYE dinner- Service was great, our server was sweet (but a little over the top with forced energy). The food was decent....no complaints. Not the best sushi we have had(especially for the price), but it was good(esp the hokey pokey roll). I don't think we have any reason to return, $11 for a 16oz draft...$9 for a small wonton soup, and $20+ per sushi roll. Too pricey when Vegas has a lot of competitor restaurants.

The Waitress was great, very helpful and recommended the orange chicken which was amazing with extra spice.  My friend had the walnut shrimp which he said was delicious as well.  As a starter, we had the dumplings with cilantro sauce which I would highly recommend as well.

First...the bad.
One of the chairs was broken and when my wife sat down a piece fell off, the chair shifted and pinched her hand to the point of drawing blood.  Never a good start but it did go better after that.  The staff was sincerely mortified and got us the requisite bandaids and towlette.

So on with the meal ( a little blood is not gonna get between us and Sushi).

We ordered entirely from the sushi bar so I can't speak to the Asian fusion kitchen.  We ordered 4 different rolls and some Hamachi sashimi.
The Hamachi was fresh and fileted into elegant ribbons.  It looked so beautiful I almost felt bad about eating it.  Until I took the first bite.  After that it could've been the Mona Lisa and and I would've scarfed it down frame and all.
There was not a bad roll out of the 4.  The rice was spot on Sushi grade.  Crisp veggies and fresh fish.  The flavors were carefully balanced to keep the focus on the ingredients rather than bury them in sauces.  
Service was outstanding ( but the whole bleeding thing kinda makes for attention afterwards).
I don't normally do desserts  (just not my thing).  However, they brought us complementary cheesecake and chocolate cake by way of apology.  I don't tolerate sweets well and these were so rich and decadent I was only able to do a few bites.  Well, I may not like sweet and rich but for those who do I highly recommend both.  I'm quite sure the cake will be outlawed once the government finds out about it.  It is the opium of desserts.
They do need to pay closer attention to the condition of their furniture.  They are aging and honestly we had a sense of humor about it but it could have been really not funny.
Despite that we all enjoyed the meal tremendously and spent the next few hours in a Sushi induced coma.

Chin Chin at the New York New York Casino & Resort is one of the best in Vegas!! It has a pleasant atmosphere with excellent service and even better food. I got the Chinese Chicken Salad, which is to die for, the dressing makes the salad. I had it every day for lunch during my stay. Kyle, I believe to be the General Manager came to my table to make sure all was good, and it was! 5 stars to them! Next time I'm in Vegas, I will be coming here and so should you!!
Horrible food. Our food was cold and extremely salty. This place is basically a gimmick, just look at where it's located. Honestly you would be better off going to Panda Express.

My sister and I were in Las Vegas this past weekend and ate at Chin Chin in the NewYork, NewYork Casino.  We loved it!  I had sushi which was great!  I also have to give a shout out to an employee that was super nice! Thank You Kooney for the advice for tired sore legs and feet!

I would rate it a 5 out of 10.  I had Mu Go Gai Pan.  Very little vegetable. Really only celery, which tasted pretty good.  The sauce was nothing special.  Could have been at any small town restaurant.  One step up from going to the buffet.

You don't come to New York New York for the Chinese food.  But if you find yourself needing some, this is probably the best and only alternative within the hotel.  Located right in front of the New Yorker Tower is Chin Chin.  Now it can be a bit confusing to see the name then to also notice the sushi bar inside is kinda confusing... so you would think this place is fusion themed but it's not.
Service was great!  Our waiter knew to match our vibe and he was spittin out jokes and was pretty entertaining.  
Onto our dishes:
Sweet & Sour Pork - Very good!  I actually found myself eating the veggies more than the pork which is unlike me.  The veggies were fresh and crispy!  Just the right amount of sauce and rice is oh so good!
BBQ Pork - Always a favorite of mine.  This was juicy and tangy just how I like it.
Tsao Chicken - This is always a crowd pleaser.  The tanginess and tartness of this dish just goes so well with any rice dish.  Probably my favorite dish of the bunch.
Shrimp Fried Rice - Talk about an abundance of shrimp.  There was literally 2-3 shrimps in every spoonful!  
So I give this place a solid 3 stars.  For the location and convenience, it's definitely something to consider.  The price for each dish ranges from $8 - $15 which is reasonable given you're in a Las Vegas hotel.  If the portions were only a tad larger, then this would've been 4 stars.

I went to Chin Chin in New York New York hotel and Casino Las Vegas this evening and our service from water Oscar was incredible. He was very personable and polite. My boyfriend said "if I ever come back to Vegas it will be because of the great service we had here". I got the Vegas roll of course since I was in Vegas it seemed fitting and it did not disappoint. I was celebrating my birthday and Oscar and the rest of the wait staff brought me an amazing complimentary cheesecake. Highly recommend.

Great service! Food was good and with the coupon it was a great deal. My favorites were the sushi (not a great selection but good enough for me) and salad bar with fresh avocado plus drinks included. Daughter husband and myself were happy which is a score!

Food was good and the hostess were nice, but the service was awful. Never saw our waitress more than 3 times and waited 45-55 mins for our food. Actually didn't even get to order till another 40 mins of wait and the bill took about 30 mins to arrive. Honestly,  the place was really not busy enough for the wait.

However , there were a great selections of vegan dishes ( for our friends )

Surprising to find a Chin Chin in Vegas! I've been to Chin Chin in LA and loved it so I had to check it out here. 

Couple of awesome differences than LA.
