-They have a full bar so you can drink right before the cirque du soleil show (which we did)
-SUSHI
-They have a breakfast buffet here!

We started off with sushi. Since the entire table wanted some sushi and sashimi, we asked to the sushi chef to go crazy with an assortment. (Pictures to follow)

After sushi we stuck with our favorites..
Chinese chicken salad, chicken potstickers, wonton stars. We only ordered apps since we got full off drinks and sushi.

Overall extremely friendly staff from the start to end. Managers seem to really care and table touch all the tables. Next time I come back to Vegas, I'll be coming back here for another meal.

Good food for a sit down restaurant located in a casino...much like being the skinniest kid at fat camp.  Chicken lettuce wraps were as expected. War won ton soup was enough for two.  My favorite part was the coconut cream tea!  Not much for ambiance and located across from the piano bar.  Pickup some Pei Wei and play some bad karaoke, you'll save yourself $75.

Service was ok. steamed rice was very dry. Mongolian beef had a good taste.  Mushu chicken was very bland and had to ask for plum sauce to be able to eat it. 
Would not recommend.

Looking for a quick lunch at $19.00?? Look no further as it is located in New York New York. Will definitely come back. 

Pros:

-Check in and get a free meal
-great ambience , small restaurant but gets to the point 
-friendly staff and would go the extra mile for your needs 
-delicious buffet selection 


Cons:
-Where we sat, my side of the booth seat was indented and lost its bounce back so pretty much it sinks in.

Pretty disappointing. Been in the US travelling for 1 month and this was by far the slowest service of the whole trip. Took 15 minutes to get beer. 30 minutes for our steamed dumpling entree of Shu Mai. And 40 minutes for main. Mongolian Beef was way too saucy and sweet and the Fried Rice actually had nothing in it, just soy sauce rice! Would not recommend to anyone, plenty of other good options at New York New York Hotel.
Great breakfast buffet options! The red velvet pancakes were oh so good!  Free mimosas! The sushi is fresh and plentiful. I appreciated the amount of seaweed salad I was given, which is delicious!

We had a great lunch here. Angel was our waitress and she did a great job and was very friendly. Everything tasted good and service was quick. Was a little on the pricey side but portions were good sized. We'll stop by again on our next trip to vegas.

I am absolutely obsessed with this place. I ate here on my first trip to Vegas a few years ago and got hooked right away. I've been making this a vegas tradition ever since.

Their spicy cilantro lo mein is ridic. It's a fusion of asian and peruvian - althought it doesn't advertise itself that way. But having grown up on peruvian food I recognize the ingredients they're borrowing.

They also have some over-sized beer bottles that will make people do a double take when they see you walking around the casino with it.

I'm a fan. And since I took my wife there this year, I think she's one now, too.

Shawn was really awesome!! 

We got the baos, chicken chow mein, beef lo mein, and shrimp tempura roll. Food came out relatively fast and our server was prompt and always made sure we were taken care of. He knew the menu well and was prepared to help give recommendations. 

Atmosphere is really nice, it's not too loud or too quiet. Price isn't terrible for Vegas when you factor in that the meals can be split family-style or amongst two.

The moment I found out, I had to experience it. I had my reservations, but I knew deep down it was now or never. I made time in my schedule and I even cancelled on a few clients just for this. But let me tell you, it was worth every single second. Never in my live have I encountered anything this unique. The moments were not only enchanting, but they were unforgettable. We get so caught up in our busy daily lives that we forget to stop and smell the lovely aromas. Thank you so much for making time stand still even if it was for a brief few moments. Blessings, Oz

My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of having early morning buffet breakfast on our vacation stay at NYNY. Our experience was strongly defined by the personable service we received by Pedro. Pedro was professional and prompt in his service. He provided an exceptional experience in a carrying and knowledgable manner. Pedro's unique personable behavior and excellent customer service is what will make us repeat customers in the future.
The resturant was great! We got the sushi and Chinese food which was spectacular.. I'd recommend anyone come here if they want an upscale Chinese/Japanese dinner or lunch.
This place is great when you just need a nice quiet place to think and eat with your loved ones, chin chin has excellent service and well mannered servers.

Some of the worse Chinese food I've ever had, but the service was superb! I ate here on a Saturday night and had:
Chow mein with crispy egg noodles and pork: Actually had to send this dish back because it was so horrible. It's like they took the noodles straight out of the container (instead of frying it crispy) and put the pork/veggies/sauce on top. The staff took it off my bill, which I appreciated. 
Fried rice with pork: The darkest fried rice I've ever seen, with a lot of sauce! I've never had so much sauce in fried rice before. Also surprised that they didn't put any veggies in the rice...just pieces of pork and egg. Tasted okay. 
Mongolian beef: Again, so much sauce! The meat slices were too thick and chewy. The white crunchies underneath were a waste.  
Orange chicken: The most edible dish of the night. Good chunks of chicken and veggie 
pieces. But the dish was lukewarm, like all the other dishes I had that night. 

Prices were decent for a restaurant inside a hotel on the Strip ($15-$20 entrees), but I would rather spend the extra money for better food elsewhere.

Ellie was a terrific server. She took a personal interest in us and we enjoyed great conversation during the dining experience. The food choices in the breakfast buffet was over the top. The custom ordered omelets were outstanding. Along with the hostesses to seat you who were warm and friendly,  the entire breakfast experience was beyond expectation!

Just an average experience.

We ate at Chin Chin this past week with friends.  The decor is cute and the menu offerings promising.  They seemed a little understaffed when we were there on a Monday at lunch time because our waiter kept disappearing, but he was very nice and accomodating.

The food is just average...nothing amazing or overly tasty.  I ordered the chicken lo mein and literally had 3 pieces of chicken in my dish.  I was starving and was really wanting that chicken!!!  The noodles and veggies in the dish were bland...not seasoned well, if at all.  Others at our table had similar feelings about their dishes.

The portions are large...enough that two people could share and the prices are reasonable.  However, the food is just missing its mark.

I would not go out of my way to recommend Chin Chin to anyone and doubt I would return.

Went to this place for their breakfast buffet and it was pretty decent for the price. The eggs were okay and the chinese bbq pork was pretty good (maybe the best thing).  However, the bacon was flavorless and the homefries hunan chicken were pretty gross. They had a nice selection of pastry and all the drinks you want are included in the price. I would probably give it 2 stars if I had to pay any more than the price of 14.99 and compared to other buffets it was okay. I was surprised they didn't have dim sum or more of a selection. 
While it was okay, I probably wouldn't go back.

I thought Chin Chin was great.  After a weekend of all sorts of pub/bar food and Italian type fare, this sounded so good.

The portions were huge, the prices were really good (like $11-15 dishes) and the service was great - even with such a large group.

We shared the Chinese Chicken Salad which was nice and spicy and full of chicken.  We then shared the Peanut Noodles with Chicken which was also good, but I far preferred the salad.  I had order envy from literally everyone at the table - it all looked and smelled so good. 

This is a good spot in Vegas for something casual and different than the usual pizza or burgers.

You have to get the Chinese chicken salad! They have a chin chin in studio city, so when I found out they had it in vegas I had to go. I've been to this location a few times, sometimes the service is excellent, sometimes it's not very good honestly. It really depends on your server, but I've never had that problem in studio city.
Very good sushi rolls. Fun crew working. Like everything in Vegas it was a bit over priced.

Most vegetarian-friendly of all the restaurants in New York New York. 

The edamame was fresh and the veggie spring rolls were delish, especially with the accompanying  apricot dipping sauce. I was thrilled to see that they could substitute tofu in place of the meat in any dish on the menu. I ended up with the vegetable fried rice + tofu. Definitely hit the spot. 

Tip: The entree dishes don't come with rice - you'll have add it to your order. (My one order of veggie fried rice was more than enough for me and three others to share.)

Excellent.  Staff warm and friendly.  They only put a few items at a time out, so your food is always good quality.  Tasty drinks.  Made to order omelets in a lovely atmosphere without the cafeteria atmosphere of larger buffets.  They offered us coffee to go, made sure we were happy.

We sat down to eat during their buffet service. There were maybe 8 other people there at  noon which I guess should have been a sign. We ordered two sushi rolls which would have cost $50, and after waiting 15 minutes they were only just starting them. Needless to say, we walked out.

We ate here after watching Zoomanity.  We had: Tempura Roll, Mongolian beef, Rice, and Chow Mein Chicken.  They all tasted pretty good for NY NY.  But make sure to get the opinion of an Asian server so you know which dish will taste good.  Don't eat the Dim Sum.

I had a horrible sushi dinner a few nights back while staying in Vegas so I was bound and determined to get my ahi tuna fix before heading home in a few short hours. We walked by Chin Chin a few times and circled back and walked into a little slice of heaven. 

The hostess warmly greeted us and sat us quickly. Our waitress came right over and I promptly ordered a Bloody Mary. It was really good. I perked right up. 

The menu was extensive on the Chinese fusion food side, smaller on the sushi side.  But there, in the middle of the specials section were the words I was looking for - Spicy Ahi Tuna tartare on won tons topped with avocado! Yes! 

I immediately took a picture of my plate when it arrived, it was gorgeous and contained a huge portion of tuna. So much so that I had to save one piece for later. The tuna melted in my mouth and was the right amount of spicy paired with the crunch of the wonton, it totally won me over.  Now I'm sad I have to wait to return to Vegas for more. The side of cucumber salad was super good too, the vinegar dressing was perfect. 

The waitress was great, the decor nice, the space was quiet for a Sat afternoon and the price totally worth every inexpensive penny. Found the needle in the Vegas haystack!

Oh boy..... When it's a late night and you are desperate for food just prior to bedtime then you find yourself here!   Bad idea....   Should have read yelper reviews...  

Ordered sushi staple of California Roll, standard fried egg roll, Chinese Chicken salad and Mongolian beef adding the brown rice for $2.

Service was great, manager kept checking on us.

Food on the hand....yikes meh...  CA Roll was mushy, fell apart... Egg roll was burnt yet not cooked so not sure how that happened.   Chicken salad was disastrous, looked like it was thrown together with a scant of ginger dressing!   There was chicken breast which bumped this up to 2 stars...  Hubbie enjoyed his beef thus the star again!     I can't say anymore or else I'll drop it another star....

We ate here for breakfast two days in a row as we stayed at the New York New York. The buffet was good with a good variety of food. The omelettes were made fresh and you were given a choice of many add ins. I got crab meat, some veggies and cheese- really good. The coffee was good as well. The service was great as well.

Our consensus: Some of the best tasting sushi rolls and stir fry. We had the red dragon roll and the kung pao three treasures. We split these two dishes between two people and it left us feeling perfectly full and satisfied. The red dragon rolls are huge, beautiful and super tasty with fresh tuna on top. The king pao three treasures dish included shrimp, chicken and beef in a mandarin sauce, both spicy and mildly sweet. Our excellent waiter was Randall and he provided friendly customer service.

Fast & friendly service, gorgeous presentation & absolutely delicious! I got the yum yum scallop roll & my friend got the volcano roll, they were both very good so it's hard to pick a favorite. Would definitely eat here again the next time I visit Las Vegas!

I would say we are picky in regards to sushi.  All big cities and international restaurants.  Are there places in Las Vegas that have a fancier vibe and the sushi chefs are SUPER serious?? Sure.  This is our third time here in two trips; we love it. It is fun, the sushi chef is amazing, the service is good and we love the food!  I can't speak to the regular menu, but love the sushi. If you like rolls, the Hawaiian and Hokie Pokie rolls are great. Putting review on Trip Advisor as well.

Had a wonderful dinner while staying at New York New York.  Food was delicious we had the chicken salad and the mongolian beef.

David was the absolute best server!!!

Ordered the pepper tofu and was expecting it to be a nice pepper sauce!!! All we got was tofu in pepper with no salt !!! Could not eat it with rice. Had to ask for sauces and fix it on the table. Thanks but I can eat at home if I need to cook my own food !
Best Asian food I've had anywhere.  Very accommodating too and they have plum saki too.

Not sure why all the bad reviews.  I ate at Chin Chin yesterday for lunch and found it pretty damn good.  I think peoples expectations are way to high, this is hardly a restraunt, more like a very nice cafe.  Anyways, I ordered the tangerine beef (which does come with rice, I read a review that said it did'nt?) and my wife ordered chow mein with shrimp.  Both of our meals were very good, same quality as a P.F. Changs. Prices were very reasonable considering it is in a nice hotel, we paid $44 for our meal, that's with tax and tip. All in all, we will definately go here again if we are craving chinese on our next trip. Only reason for not giving five stars is because I only give 5 stars to a place that blows my mind.  4 stars for me is above average.

The Yellow tail Tuna Sashimi was ok. But the crab roll 'sushi' rice looked like rice from the previous night. It was dry and didn't taste fresh at all. It was edible and thankfully didn't taste stale at least!!!

The chicken fried rice barely had any flavour in it. The chow mein was the best of the lot but that wasn't saying much really. The sweet-corn chicken soup was ok but was really thick and a tad too starchy.

Overpriced and not worth it. Not going there again.

Not good at all. The service was awful. We got wrong drinks delivered. We had coupons that were not applied even after the manager approved them. I am hoping it was like this because of the construction. Manager stood in the corner the whole time.

Consider Chin Chin as a step up from P.F. Chang's, only with sushi. And that sushi was all right; I noticed lots of the spicier rolls included the ever-dreaded spicy mayo on them. Which, by the way, when did mayo on sushi become all the rage? It's gross!

The server, however, was very accommodating and a sweetheart for breaking up checks for a group of 13.

We stayed at the Tropicana, and after a six hour trip to get to Vegas, all I wanted was some awesome Chinese food. The girl at the front desk told us to try New York, New York, and man, I love her for suggesting it.

It was so delicious and the service was so wonderful, we ended up coming back a second time, before our flight home.

Everything on the menu was delicious, but I have to recommend most of all the Velvet Chicken soup (they put peas in it! so cool!) and the Hot Sour Soup. Both were authentic twists on old favorites, and so good we actually had to get seconds. Perfect for helping with a hangover.

Also on the list: Any of their lo mein. Delicious, chock-full of goodies, and never greasy. Mmm mm!

Was okay. Spicy tuna rolls were promising (we had it as an appetizer) but our main courses were overpriced for the quality. My husband had pepper steak and I had curry chicken. None of it was out and bad...it just wasn't that good. There are better sushi and Chinese places in LasVegas. I wouldn't recommend this spot.

Great sushi! The sushi bar is open later than the restaurant which made this the perfect place to grab a late dinner after our show. 

The service was excellent, which is pretty much expected on the strip. 

If you're getting sushi, be sure to order the Philly roll - it was delicious!

The buffet is clean and there are are a lot of different choices which is always a plus. The sushi bar is good but not the best sushi I've had but Ok for the convenience if you are staying at New York New York.

We have been to Chin Chin on several occasions while in Vegas and we are never disappointed. The variety of food is great and portions are huge. I normally always get sushi but this time hubby and I split some pork fried rice and it was great! Sure it's "gourmet" Asian food but hey it's Vegas. Defibrillator stop by. This time our server was Cesar and he was super nice, friendly, funny and helpful. He is the one that recommended the pain killer and it was really delicious.

Ordered the California rolls, beef chow fun and a teriyaki bowl togo and ate in our hotel room.  Chow fun was bland even thought it looked favorable. The beef tasted a lil sour. Teriyaki bowl was terrible. Chicken was way over cooked and dry...kind of hard. The sauce was did not taste like teriyaki sauce. It actually had a slight sour taste to it and kind of like the beef. Maybe they used the same marinate. My bf and I couldn't brig ourselves to take a second bite and we had to throw it out. The California rolls were pretty good though. Should have ordered more of those. :(

We had the best wonton soup ever. But as good as the soup was it didn't compare to the excellent service we received from Rodrigo!!!
Thanks for making it an even nicer experience then what we expected.

Wow!! Never am I disappointed by service, quality or price.. If you want custom sushi hand rolls or a low carb options the sushi chefs accommodate.  Much thanks to Koona... Every time I have special requests she knows just how to please.   I only wish it wasn't so far from DFW.  See you all in a few months.

Great service! Everything came out really quick. The food was cooked well, the meat was practically falling off the bone. The veggies were seasoned and my favorite thing was the fried rice. Everything was so good!

Food was decent.  Service was NOT.  Although the waiter was friendly, he totally forgot our first course.  Didn't realize it until we asked where our soups were.  Some at the table had sushi and asked for a second roll.  It never came.  And because we had a large party, he got his automatic tip anyway.  Bad service is becoming a theme at New York New York.  Used to be a great place to go, not so much anymore.

So this was my 2nd time eating here; it was delicious that first time. Their gluten free options make my boyfriend very happy! However, tonight, I was served wontons with RAW chicken inside. It was dark pink mush. The chef cooked a new batch for me, but unfortunately I had already eaten half of one. They were quite apologetic and comped our meal, but no amount of comped money is worth the risk of salmonella. It's a sadly inexcusable mistake and it's why I'm giving my rating 1 star. Here's to hoping I dodge the diarrhea bullet - my plane flight is in 48 hrs.

This was so disappointing!! It was our last night and we talked about Chin Chin for hours and slowly lost our faith over time while reading the menu but we were committed! It tasted like Americanized Chinese, heavy on the salt! 

But the service was great!

Pretty decent Chinese restaurant 
We loved their salt and pepper tofu and lo mein. 
Friendly servers and good place to dine in.
Very expensive breakfast buffet, but there were not a lot of choices. I didn't even find the milk.

I was staying at NY NY for a work event, travelling alone as usual. So I pulled up to the Chin Chin bar right after the trade show I was working for a quick dinner before going upstairs to my room to crash. 

The bartender was wicked friendly, and made me the most delicious ginger martini ever (I needed one!). There was another guy at the bar who had just received his meal, and it looked AMAZING. I just gestured over to his order and said I'd get exactly that!

Brown rice, tangerine beef, and steamed mixed veggies... YUM! I was only able to finish off maybe 1/4 of the rice and maybe only 1/2 of the beef, and it's too bad there's no fridge/microwave combo in the rooms or I would've totally gotten leftovers, but it was so worth it! And oh yeah... I had that for dinner at least 2 more times during my week there!

Not the best Chinese food I've had (the food came out waaaaaaaaaay too quickly to be made fresh - the "crispy" beef was soggy!), but still really good for a quick dinner. And the bartenders have always been really friendly!

And the breakfast buffet isn't bad - fried rice and bbqed pork for breakfast, yes please!

Stopped by here while on vacation and was blown away by the food and service.

I will definitely be coming back here. 

My personal favorite was the sushi which was not only delicious but a true work of art.

If you are in Vegas you must try out Chin Chin. You will not be disappointed.

We were staying at New York New York and while roaming around we saw this place. This seemed to most crowed so thought to try this one out. Let me tell you I'm not a fan to chinse food as such but this place is really really good. Orange chicken is amazing - not too sweet, exactly how I like. They have signature dishes on the be menu, you can order any I bet you can't go wrong with that. Eggplant was good too. Definitely I go to place if you like Chinese.
I needed a light meal after a week of food-pounding.  The summer rolls with shrimp at chin chin was perfect.  Light with fresh vegetables.
The peanut noodles is a must have!! Coupled with the yang chow rice.... Game over!! Wait staff was really nice and the food came out quick can't go wrong here.

Food was good.we ordered the miso soup,  rainbow roll and a couple different hand rolls and some fried wontons. The sushi was very tasty but we didnt care to much for the wontons.  The service was just ok, it could've been better. It was a bit laggy.

Okay.. so the food was good.. the drink was strong.. but then I got sick right before we boarded our plane.. not good... guess I shouldn't have eaten there before flying.  I thought  it was a little pricey ... but you do get pretty large portions.
The buffet was incredible. Jordan was the most thoughtful, hard working waiter I've seen in a long time. Keep up the good work!

Ech. Tso's chicken was semi warm and chewy and had some fishy flavor. We ate maybe 2 or 3 pieces and then asked the waitress not to pack it in a to-go. Chicken Salad was decent, not a $15 type of salad since it only consists of lettuce, chicken strips and peanuts topped with won ton strips. The dressing was alright. We checked in, so we got an entree for $15... But our bill came out to a lot still because considering we missed out on an entire dish, we still got ripped off from the freakin tea was $5 EACH! Total rip off. Not a place I would return to.

So bad service in my life. 
The plate was so dirty. We asked to change, but came same one, so we asked again.
Also, we was waiting 30min just for white rice.

Chin Chin = Worst Worst.
First dish was over-drenched tasteless chicken lettuce cups. I asked what was the steamed whole fish for the day and they said a "cod like fish", when I asked further they told me it was Tilapia!!! Which is worse for you than eating a Big Mac. What deceivers! My guest ordered some type of chicken dish she had to spit out, while I ordered sashimi and they delivered sushi. The manager was not very apologetic  and she didn't charge for these dishes but made sure we paid for the tasteless lettuce cups and iced tea. We went somewhere else for dinner.

I've never been disappointed by the breakfast at chin chin so we expected the lunch buffet to be just as good. Exceeded our expectations! The salad options and vegetarian selections were wonderful, for the meat eaters, you will not be let down either. This buffet unlike the others on the strip has a much more limited selection but not to be interpreted as "less" because everything is exceptional. You will not see sub-par pizza or other random cuisines but you will get tasty sushi, orange chicken, beef entrees, etc that are all delicious. More is not always better and chin chin is proof.

This review will be on the breakfast buffet ($14 per person).

I have to say that this breakfast buffet didn't have a lot of choices.  These were the things they had from what I could remember: mainland eggs, Cantonese eggs, bacon, french toast, pastries, and croissants.  All of those tasted okay and nothing special.  There was also BBQ pork or something but for breakfast?  Yeah... I thought it was weird.  They had fruit and yogurt which seemed like it was made.  I was surprised a lot of people were eating here for breakfast even though there wasn't a lot of choices.  I guess they were like me and didn't want to go somewhere else that's not in the New York New York Hotel. lol

This review is for the breakfast buffet, so no idea about the sushi or other stuff. So, keeping in mind that this is a buffet,  it was really good. So good that we went twice in 2 days. 4 different kinds of eggs Benedict (which were all really good - crab cakes Benedict was the best), chocolate covered strawberries, omelets to order, berry crepes, plus all the normal breakfast foods along with creative versions of those foods (like normal scrambled eggs and scrambled eggs with fresh herbs and goat cheese). Both days our waiters (Pedro and a guy whose name I wish I could remember) were fantastic - both with positive energy and fun that made our dining great without being overly present. Price was just under $20, which seems really reasonable  (for vegas )

Chin Chin is a small little sushi restaurant in New New York. It is, by far, the best sushi restaurant in Vegas. The staff is very personable and make you feel very welcome in their restaurant. It's like you're at a small town eatery and not a big city restaurant. If you come, ask for Cesar. The best server I've ever had!

The food was decent but I loved the service. They have such friendly hosts, bartenders, and servers that are so attentive and very helpful. This was the first place we stopped and ate at after landing. Jordan was our server and she was fantastic!!!

This place was horrible. Our waiter was very nice, but the food! The hot n sour soap came out cold and was way too salty. The roasted meats tasted like they had been sitting for days. The hunan sauce was inedible, and the yang chow rice flavorless. Avoid this place. 100.00 for crap!

Very lame. The pot sticker appetizers were lukewarm and undercooked, and served with some viscous orange-colored goo that managed to have almost no flavor at all. The kung pao chicken was LaChoy-ish - no heat, no sweet, and the peanuts tasted like they'd been recycled from a zoo cage. All in all a total disappointment. We will not be back.

Got a late start on breakfast.  So we just ate at the first buffet we passed.  This buffet had a very small selection of food but it was good.  My favorite was the Mimosa. The manager came around and greeted us and accommodated my request for the mimosa and it was the good champange too.  Yummy

THE FOOD IS AWFUL. 

Things ordered:
- fried pork wontons. Over fried and greasy. The pork was flavorful, but the grease kind of undercut it and made it not great. 
- tofu chow mein. To me, chow mein means fried noodles. I got lo mein. And the tofu was cold in the middle. I realize that working with soft tofu is difficult, but that shouldn't mean that you add it in last, leave it to cook for a minute and serve it when it's still cold.
- lemon chicken. Fiancé got this. Apparently it was typical fried lemon chicken. Can't really go wrong. 

They also charge you for rice. $1.50 for steamed rice, $5.50 for a small fried rice and $7.50 for a large fried rice. Maybe it's just because it's Vegas pricing, but it's a little ridiculous.
Terrible food.  Soggy pork dumplings, tasteless Asian chicken salad, and the Pad Thai had an odd burnt flavor.  STAY AWAY!

Coming for the very first time to Vegas with no idea what to expect but starving after driving all night breakfast and coffee we're the first thing in my mind.
We were looking to grab a quick breakfast and when we arrived to chin chins we were just seated, I thought we were going to get o offered a menu but right away a very friendly waiter arrived to our table and  explained to us how the buffet worked. 
So after asking the price which is 20$ per person I was kinda expecting something really delish and outta the norm.
Ummm...no, the only really delish thing there we're two small cranberry cheesecake muffin bites which those probably come from a bakery.
The eggs were either greasy or rubbery just like the hash brown patties, the granola was stale, the coffee was weak, the plates and utensils were still dirty with food stuck to them...the only good thing there was the ham and the service. This was not worth the price if you just want a quick meal, since it was my first time in vegas and had no idea where anything was, no one outta of the few staff workers I asked had told me there was a Dennys around the corner and other more economic choices than this place.
*sigh oh well you live and learn right?

So I decided to go here after it received a good review in one of the Vegas coupon books and a Chinese breakfast buffet sounded interesting.  I loved the New York/New York hotel and casino but Chin Chin was a dissappontment.  The buffet was small and the only Chinese offerings were fried rice with sausage (really?) and some sort of egg roll...still not sure what was inside.  The wait staff looked really unhappy.  It was just ok.

Well worth the price of admission. At 17.99, you have two buffet lines. Several varieties of eggs Benedict all perfectly cooked, an assortment of breakfast meats, fruit, fresh scrambles, waffles, pancakes, French toast, fruit and yogurt, chocolate covered strawberries, fresh fruit, cereal, granolas and breakfast fried rice. We were concerned it would be Asian since we were in the mood for traditional but it was American standard. They will also make eggs and omelette to order. We wished we had decided to try it earlier in the trip. They also offer you beverages to go with your bill when you're done. Very happy. Easily got our money's worth.

Went to Chin Chin inside New York New York where we were staying and food was bomb and Yvette, our server was very nice. Ordered Sweet & Sour Shrimp and shrimp tasted great and sauce was bomb. Some type of fried rice that was good too. Not super expensive like I would have thought so that was a plus of course. Great place and you can tell they get busy.

So gross. We just dropped $90 on a meal that Probably wasn't even as good as panda express. No wonder there wasn't a wait. Disgusting. Don't even waste your time. You'd be way better off grabbing a slice of pizza. So disappointing. Wish I could get my money and time back.

Came here with my husband based on Yelp! reviews. We were not disappointed with this restaurant. The customer service was outstanding. Our waiter was Scott B and he was very knowledgeable about the menu and drinks. He explained everything so well that we had a hard time deciding what to eat because everything sounded amazing. We decided to try the orange chicken w/ white rice and Mongolian beef w/ noodles. They were both extremely good. No soy sauce needed. I highly recommend this place and ask for Scott B!!!

It's no secret that I'm a huge fan of all types of Asian food. When I noticed that there was a breakfast buffet at this establishment I was instantly filled with all kinds of wild thoughts... what would a pan-asian breakfast buffet be like? This is something I wanted to have in my life, I was sure.

The next morning we found ourselves in the buffet line. The selection looked very interesting and delicious. Sezchuan-style eggs, Egg Foo Yung, five-spice toast, bbq pork, eggs, house potatoes, and more.

Oh mediocrity, how you tantalize with overwhelming promises and underwhelming deliveries. Everything was sub-par in my opinion. The Sezchuan eggs weren't that bad, actually,and the five-spice toast would've been better had I chosen to soak them in the ginger syrup instead of consuming dry.

I was so sure that I wanted this Asian breakfast buffet in my life, but after eating almost everything that was offered, I'm not so sure I want it again. Maybe we were there on an off day, but for now I'll probably shy away.

Quality of food not worth the price. Manager was walking around checking with guests but when we showed her that there is a strand hair in the chicken we ordered, she just took it and no apologies at all. It was my son's birthday and was expecting something special but nahhhh.

I'm reviewing only their breakfast buffet. Didn't partake of their regular menu. It's a small breakfast buffet -- obviously not your standard Vegas mega-buffet. That said, it didn't cost as much as your standard Vegas mega-buffet. Just $17 each. 

It was a decent selection of breakfast staples -- waffles, pancakes, eggs, french toast, biscuits & gravy, sausage, bacon, and even not so typical things like egg rolls, pot stickers, and fried rice.

Service was quick and on top of things, even with the Memorial Day crowd. So if you're wanting a buffet, but looking for a smaller, less crowded breakfast buffet, head over to NY NY and check out Chin Chin.

I was a bit leary of this place after reading the reviews but decided to give it a try anyway as we're going to see Zumanity and Chin Chin is right next door to it in the New York New York Hotel.  You don't have many options for quick sushi on the Strip as most sushi places are fancier places. The service was friendly and the salmon and ahi nigiri sushi was pretty good.  Sushi nigiri averages about $8.00 for two pieces.
We had a very good meal. Service was excellent. Orange chicken was chicken breast. Great quality and flavor. Very good fried rice. Big portions .

Hostess was inviting.
Once in for take out, service sucked.
Food for take out took way too long.
Expensive.
Food was decent. (Simple rice and noodles)

Saw that with check in on yelp you get a free lunch buffet. We called before to confirm this was the case and was told yes. After eating, once we were redeeming the offer with the manager we were told it's a buy one get one free, not just free. Still a good deal, but I object to tactics like this. Food was decent and staff was pleasant, but probably won't return because of the misleading tactic to get us in the door. Had they worded it BOGO lunch buffets, would still have gone and been happy.

The food is still good but the entire menu pricing is up at least 35% compare to my last visit a year ago! 1 order of rainbow sushi, 1 steak beef rice bowl, 1 Pepsi and 2 glass of wine(1 glass=1bottle@costco) the bill $68. I refer Todai instead!

One of my favorite restaurants. Really reasonable prices, fast service, fantastic specialty drinks. Great bloody Mary!

Haven't had anything bad here! I love the mushu chicken and orange chicken. It's typical high end chinese food, but pretty authentic, and not greasy.

Every time I bring people here they thank me.

Not impressed, nothing special.

Stopped in here for dinner after Cirque Du Sole since it looked like a nice place to sit down and eat, but this is one of those instances where you don't judge a book by it cover. The service was pretty bad i'm pretty sure our waiter forgot about us at one point. And as for the food, nothing special I actually would consider it below average Chinese food.

The verdict, don't bother unless its a last resort not worth your time!

We actually had the brunch buffet here which I was fairly pleased with.  There is a plenty to choose from and it is a good deal if you want to avoid the more expensive buffets that are found elsewhere around the Strip.  I enjoyed all that I got and my husband loved that fried rice was included on the menu.
Great buffet with a great price that includes the $5 drink. Gluten free options made to order. Friendly staff and knowledgeable about celiac diet.
Enjoyed our crab wontons, pineapple fried rice, and orange chicken. Great service from the hostess and Julianna.

I stopped by for the first time this past weekend and had the lunch buffet, which was very good.  There is a good mixture of Chinese food, sushi, and a few American comfort favorites, like fries and mac and cheese.  What really made my dining experience outstanding was the friendly staff.  I happened to sit at the bar so bartender Tawnya was very helpful and provided excellent service.  Manager Linda also stopped by to make sure I was ok.  There is a large screen TV where you can watch the game while enjoying your favorite beverage.  I'll definitely recommend to others.

Came in for the breakfast buffet and loved everything they have to offer. The waitress, Johanna was fantastic. She greeted us with a big smile and very cheerful. She offered us eggs and omelettes to order. The omelette we order was amazing. We will definitely be back.
The breakfast buffet was worth the stop. Just perfect after a long night on the town.

Staff was nice, didn't appreciate how they didn't give us the coupon like they did other guests. Mongolian beef was awesome. Sushi was so-so. Won't be going back here when we come to Vegas next year. Glad we tried it though.
Place and food are awesome!!! Ben, omg  his an amaZing person has great customer skills extremely professional!!

Service here was exceptional, our server was on top of everything and very accommodating. The maggolian beef was very tender and flavorful, I would order again the con pau chicken on the other hand was just ok, not my style and no kick to it at all. Other then that it's a nice little place tucked into NY NY that will provide great service and good Chinese food while in the area. I wish I could remember my servers name so I could give him his credit but unfortunately I've been eating out every night the last week and I've met great servers at each place and I'm drawing a blank.

This is the only buffet in NYNY.  It's only for breakfast and something of an odd combination.  

For starters it was $30 for two, not bad for a Vegas buffet.  That is until you see the offerings.  Strange pairings of eggs so firm they were more sliced than scooped, with BBQ pork loin for breakfast?  There were unusual items like pot-stickers and egg -fu-yung on the breakfast buffet.  

The strange and small assortment of items left us not wanting to return, and we didn't.

The 2 stars instead of 1 star was solely because the staff kept our cups full.

Our first night in Vegas we ate here. The waiter had serious attitude! We ordered miso soup and told the waiter it was really salty. His response: "yeah several other people have said that!" really? lol! Then came cold lettuce wraps and when we told him we just got a "sorry" no offer to replace! I ordered the curry chicken and the potatoes were raw and no sauce very dry! Then the manager came over and kindly offered to redo my plate. He whisked all my food away while I watched my husband and son ate. They brought my steamed rice about 10 mins before the replacement meal and then it was cold by the time the chicken curry came back! Potatoes still raw but no one even asked! Don't you think all the chicken and sauce gone and potatoes on the plate was a great clue lol! No offer to comp or reduce price. The next day I called Andrea (the I don't give a s.... manager) who basically said give us another try to screw u out of $100 and guess what I did! 3 days later breakfast buffet a lady waitress Kanae at least no attitude but she pours a 1/2 cup of water and says "I'll be back!" no refill of water, coffee or OJ! OMG lady what would you do if you had to bring food too! Why is it overpriced restaurants in resorts get to bring crappy food and bad service for very high prices and they don't care and we keep going?????

I really loved Chin Chin! Tucked away in NYNY, it had the latest-running breakfast buffet on the Strip I could find. Always worth it to charge to your room for Mlife points as well. 

Great food, artistic, trendy, clean, and delicious! Our server was incredibly kind as well. Coffee was what you would expect, but food was wonderful.

Just ok...nothing special.  We went here for lunch the other day and it took quite a while for someone to seat us even though the restaurant was mostly empty.  The service was ok, the atmosphere was nice, but the food really wasn't that good.

overrated Chinese food.  reminds me of upscale around the corner food.  very disappointing.  The fried rice was bland and my garlic chicken had alot of bok choy but hardly any chicken.  Forget the drinks my chocolate martini needed chocolate.
Great selection of food for the lunch buffet. Staff is really nice and makes sure all the customers' needs are met.

This place was amazing the service, the food and breakfast buffet 
The buffet was small but worth it delicious food, better than any place in the hotel!! I highly recommend it ! With the breakfast buffet you get a free mimosa or Bloody Mary so good !

You eat at one chin chin, you eat at all Chins. It is your typical chain restaurant quality- more expensive than you'd want to shell out, but the food isn't horrible so you don't stay away. 

The Vegas one is slightly different that it keeps up with the buffett theme of Las Vegas. This one offers breakfast/ brunch buffett for around $14/ person, from 7/7:30 to noon-ish. if you can get up that early while you are in vegas, or perhaps you haven't gone to bed yet, the buffet isn't bad. Very simple, not too exciting, and variety is rather limited, but you get your brunch staples- scrambled eggs, scrambled eggs with duck, bacon, sausage, duck, bbq pork (chinese style), some potatoes, noodles. I actually prefer this to the $25 brunch buffett at MGM or similar casino. It's cheaper and i can never my $25 worth of food at 10:30 or 11 in the morning. And the food here is actually good. I like their duck scrambled egg, and their spring rolls and dumplings are yum too.

The line can get long, and with limited seats/ space, you can wait a bit. But people eat and go- so you are maybe made to wait for 30 min at most. And my other complaint would be you have to be in line to get your food, and since there is only 1 line of buffett trays, once you are done, you have to go back to the end of the line for round 2. It reminds me of being in the school cafeteria a little. 

Solid 3.5 stars!

My husband and I went to Chin Chin on Friday night May 16 2014. I explained to the waitress I have an egg allergy and couldn't have any mayo or mayo based sauces. She seemed to understand. When she brought our sushi I thought the inside of the roll was cream cheese. I didn't think to ask. The first and only bite I took I realized it had mayo inside. We sat there for a long time waiting for the waitress to come back so I could ask her about the mayo. Her response was, "well there's only a little mayo to bind the crab inside." Too bad I don't have a little allergy. The manager came over to apologize but didn't even offer to take care of the bill. I had to find a place that sold Benadryl to counter act the allergic reaction. I have been sick since then. If you need or want your food made a certain way don't go to Chin Chin. I am incredibly disappointed in the experience we had.
We come here 3x a year and always have a few meals here. Haven't had one bad thing. These are great: veggie chow mein, string beans, steamed broccoli, eggplants, orange chicken, Kung pao shrimp.

Oscar was great. Super personable and friendly. He made great recommendations and was patient with us. Lettuce wraps were amazing. We also liked the orange chicken, pad Thai and broccoli beef! Yum yum

Their food is quite ok. I had the spare ribs, the potion size was alright and so was the taste. My gf had tomato garlic chicken which was quite good. The entrees do not come with rice and need to be ordered on the side. The food is expensive considering the potion size and quality. If you are living in New York New York, then it's one of the options to use up up your free dining credit, otherwise I am sure there are better options available for Chinese food.

I would first like to say that I woke up with my family at 8a.m to eat breakfast at Chin Chin's breakfast buffet. Lets just say I'm not the happiest camper.

First, I would like to say I am extremely disappointed at myself for not paying attention at the hints for an extremely horrible breakfast. 

TIP #1 Breakfast Buffet at a mediocre Chinese Restaurant
Tip #2 Fried Rice as part of their breakfast menu
Tip #3 pastries that i saw them un-package from a Costco type package.

No i didn't take any of those hints as a clue to what was in store for me. 

The Food- They serve the usual breakfast fare. Eggs, bacon, sausage, and french toast. To accompany those types of food they have fried rice, bbq pork, assorted fruits and potatoes. The breakfast was so sub-par, so unseasoned i couldn't eat more then one plate. I even asked for cheese for my scrambled eggs and they said they cant give me that... REALLY... REALLY?!

The Price- Everything they serve you can get at a Days-inn that is included with the price of the room. It is $12.95 a person. With that price you can go to Hash House a gogo and get quite honestly the best breakfast in Vegas for the same price. Hell you can go to Circus Circus breakfast buffet and get better. At least they have omelette's and  toast. THEY DIDN'T EVEN HAVE TOAST HERE! Silly me to think that a breakfast buffet would serve toast... silly me.

So I'm giving this place one star, If i could i would give it 1/2 but i can't. I honestly can't believe their are restaurants out here that have the audacity to serve such sub-par, and un-edible food at such a outrageous price.

1/2 A STAR OUT OF 5

p.s THEY DON'T SERVE TOAST!

We were staying in the NYNY and were walking around to find some food. Chin Chin wasn't that crowded and we were a larger group so we decided to eat here. The food was alright but you can get better elsewhere. We had a lot of leftovers when normally our group tends to finish everything. It is Vegas but I felt like prices were more expensive than they needed to be. 

The service was good though!

Expectations exceeded! Our party arrived not knowing anything about the restaurant and had an amazing b experience.  We were seated quickly for a large group arriving for breakfast buffet. With a name like Chin Chin I was expecting something different. Chinese food is served for lunch and dinner in both order from the menu or buffet style...choose wisely. 

We started with the featured omlets  that is included with buffet purchase.  The chefs prepare them fresh to order or you can create your own. Meat lovers, Cobb, Veggie, and the magnificent Seafood Omlette was my favorite with shrimp stuffed inside. Delicious! We the walked to the back of the restaurant where the buffet is located and we're amazed by the beautiful offerings like Salmon Eggs Bene, Stuffed Red Velvet pancakes, a variety of Egg Scrambles, and the very creative Breakfast Fried Rice.  All of the food was hot and fresh which sometimes can be a challenge at a buffet. Not here.  

I had to save room for the sweets section. My favorite was the strawberry shortcake inspired croissant sammy stuffed with stawberries, whip cream and chocolate drizzle. Splendid!

Overall great experience at Chin Chin. Our entire large party left satisfied and minds blown with the level of service we received from Pedro R.  Vote for Pedro when you venture to Chin Chin.
Newly renovated and I'm loving the new ambiance, as well as the food. It was great at first and it doesn't disappoint till now. The bloody mary is awesome here.

These guys rock 'n' roll diem sum please  try the mein mein salad, I have been going to Chin Chin's for over 15 years in Los Angeles, CA try them in the New York New York hotel & casino during your next  Las Vegas stop.
They finally have a mein mein salad with peanut sauce and shrimp toast apps which are way  fabulous as they have always been in studio city location ! 13.00 on salad is monster salad and super cheap great for 2 to split!

Great place! The hostess and waitress were both very nice and personable. I got the orange chicken which was very amazing. The only negative was that it was a bit overpriced, but this is expected with Las Vegas. I would definitely go here again if I visited.

I've stayed twice at NYNY and I went once with my hubby and sister in law and it was NOT authentic CHINESE food but watered down American style...  I mean hello have you guys ever heard of GINGER or GARLIC?!?!?

I went again with my parents this past Feb and my mom was craving rice ( go figure :p) and I took em there.   

* EGGPLANT
Hot and spicy blend of Japanese eggplant, purple onions,
scallions and garlic.  - The eggplant was pretty good, it had much flavor and I think they actually put garlic in this one.. 
.. TEMPURA SHRIMP / shrimp tempura / avocado / cucumber / burdock / radish /  = 
The sushi roll was delish.  In Canada, this is called Dynamite Roll but is the US Dynamite is always something different in every place I have been to.  Rice was nice and fresh, shrimp was a decent size piece and veggies were fresh. Nice sauce on it as well. 


SHRIMP WITH SWEET AND SOUR SAUCE - Plump deep fried shrimp, red bell peppers, onions and pineapple chunks with sweet and sour sauce.
This was normal and typical.. the sauce was bleh... just sour lol

Food is SubPar!! well below average!
When a "Resturant" has Pictures in the menu then you know the quality is not going to be great. We ordered War Wonton soup, and 45 minutes later received the wrong order, then waited again for correct order and both broths were reminiscent of what I would imagine fish tank water tastes like.
I ordered the Crab Wonton ""Appetizer"" and after a third time asking they showed up at our table after our entire party was done eating... that is Not Acceptable!
The Manager was notified by our waiter after complaining about the soups and refusing the appetizer but Never came over to apologize or offer any resolution ... again Not Acceptable!
The waiter took the one soup off and the appetizer while missing the wrong order deduction I had the manager come over. He began to argue with irritability that the correct amount was taken off. 
in the end I left  hungry and wasted 1hr45min of my time

After reading negative reviews I was a little nervous to try it here - however we had nothing but a great experience! Everyone we encountered was great! 

Even had a manager stop to see how our food was.

We ordered the Mongolian beef, chinese chicken salad and shrimp tempura roll sushi. Everything tasted awesome I recommend the beef - it was melt in your mouth and large portion!

Would visit here again!

Not sure why everyone on here is hating on Chin Chin.  I've been twice and both times it's been solid.  When eating in Vegas, I am always ready for the food to be pretty generic (unless I'm eating somewhere super fancy, which never happens!), and pretty overpriced.

That being said, our group of 4 ordered 2 entrees: the dynomite roll and veggie spring rolls.  We also ordered 2 entrees: peanut noodles, and sweet and sour tofu.

The 4 of us had plenty to eat and got out of there for $60 total.  Not too bad.

The sushi roll and peanut noodles are my favorite.  I've had the peanut noodles both times I've been.  They are filling, spicy, and full of peanut deliciousness.
Our food was amazing, but the service was even better! We came for the breakfast buffet and had an omelet prepared by the cook. Seriously. delicious.

Second time at chin chin for the  lunch buffet. The first time was okay, nothing special. The lobster fried rice was the most tasting thing on the buffet,while it lasted. They ran out and that was that,no more was put out. 

We decided to give it another shot but it was even more disappointing, with the quality of food. Just basic tasteless food. Not too much to choose from. The best thing there was the service from our waiter.

The food was ok overall.   The potstickers were delicious. I do not eat pork and both fried rice dishes contained pork, so that was a turn off for me. My husband liked the lettuce wraps and California Rolls.  We dined on buy one get one free deal, so I was satisfied. This place is not worth $20 per plate.  

The servers were friendly and the restaurant has a cool laud back vibe.

My friends and I went here on a Monday night and it was really nice.  Pretty mellow and it did not take long to get our food.  Service was kind of impersonal but it's not the worst I've ever had.  The sushi was really fresh and the prices were reasonable.  I'm not raving about this place but if I stay at NY NY again, I will definitely be visiting Chin Chin Cafe.  I recommend it for a sushi (or any Asian food) lover.

meals do not come with rice. way too expensive. get up and leave. wish I did

chicken tastes old. dirty dishes.

I would give it 1 star but the manager took off $5, what a joke.
Got the Kung pao chicken with white rice. In the mood for Chinese come check it out. Great atmosphere and look.

Best chinese food on the strip! My wife will only eat chinese food here...Best orange chicken anywhere. We also love the string beans and the rice choices. We always bring visiting friends and family here. Everyone has loved it. The decor is nice. The service is friendly  and prompt.

From 7/8/15 

We came here because it was in the hotel we were staying at, and I was in the mood for noodles. 

We started off with an awesome server, who took our drinks order. We got a bottle of sake and perused the menu for what we wanted. About 6 mins later a guy appears and said he would be our server because her shift had ended. 

I ordered the Pad Tai and was pretty disappointed- the flavors were to citrusy which is not what I am used to, it's generally a more savory or spicy kind of dish. The dish also lacked shrimp. However, there was an abundance of chicken which I could have done without. 
When I explained to my server that I was not happy he seemed very nonchalant about it then told me if I wanted more shrimp it would be extra. I did not add more shrimp since I felt a bit turned off by his attitude.  

When he came back and saw me taking the chicken off my plate, moving things around on the dish to try to make it better he offered to take the chicken away. I ended up giving my chicken to my boyfriend. I barely finished my Pad Tai; it was too intense for my palate. 

Normally, I hate writing a review like this, but this was one of those situations where my server could have changed things around by rectifying the situation. Plus a better attitude could have gone a long way. 

Maybe this isn't the norm for these guys as far as food and service, my boyfriend enjoyed his dish, but I don't think we will return. At least  I enjoyed the sake!

I am writing A review for the breakfast buffet only.

 They have a breakfast buffet with an array of items
that were promptly replenished and nicely displayed
showing great presentation and A very nice selection
of eggs and omelets made to order any way you like.


They are a little pricey but everything was fresh 
and tasty so it was worth it, plus it's Vegas on the 
strip so it's to be expected. 

We had a waiter named Jay who was very 
courteous and attentive.

In conclusion their breakfast buffet was excellent 
and I would definitely return.

I've been to Chin Chin on Sunset in LaLa lots of times.  Fun place to enjoy tasty dim sum and a great Asian salad.

Unfortunately, the Las Vegas version is not up to the same standards.  

Judging just the food - I ordered a steamed fish entree.  They insist the fish was fresh - not frozen but I don't believe them.  The fish appeared cooked on top but the undersides were grey and cold.  I can't imagine any way this could happen unless the fish was frozen.  I returned it and they removed the charge from my bill, but I lost my appetite after that.

Our one order of dim sum was the shui mai.  They were huge - cooked to order so we had to wait - but it was worth it. The lettuce wrapped chicken was typical of nearly every Chinese restaurant I've been in.  Nothing special.

Service was a bit unprofessional. I think they could cut out the socializing between the wait staff and concentrate on providing better service and a better product. Our tab was in the $135 range including tip - before the credit for the frozen fish - for two, so I think it's fair to compare Chin Chin's service to other restaurants in this price range. If you like being called "you guys" by the wait staff - this is your kind of place.

I left with a bad taste in my mouth - literally - and all other ways.
If you're thinking about getting Asian food... Don't eat here! Seriously one of the worst Chinese food ever!!!!

We had the Peanut Noodles which are spicey, but not enough to stop eating them!!! Yummy. Peanut flavor explodes with the very first bite and is delicious. We ordered a heat offset with Moo goo gai pan which had freshest celery ever eaten.we would go back again in a heart beat!!

WONDERFUL. The service & food were amazing. The way this restaurant is decorated is very nice as well. Our server was very nice and helpful and very attentive. The food was amazing, it's family sized plates so we ordered 3 plates: Beef & Broccoli, Orange Chicken, & Chicken Chowmein. All we're good and filling. Although I noticed they were a bit skimpy on the meat but still I enjoyed. I will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

OK, 5 stars...really?  YES!  The food here is wonderful.  Atmosphere was great, service (thanks Pedro) was unbelievable.  What a great, friendly guy.

We all had something different and it all was wonderful including the variety appetizer.

Prices were good for Vegas. 

Cant say enough for how nice the remodel turned out, service and all around great time.

Would highly recommend!!!!

I was staying at the NY NY and I headed straight for this restaurant after check in just because I love asian food, and none of the other food choices in the hotel really appealed to me (not that interested in italian, hot dogs, pizza or burgers -- boring).  As soon as I got there I asked for a booth -- they claimed they didnt have any although I'm pretty sure I saw some open in the back.  So I took a seat at the bar anyways, which I didnt really like because it's such a public area the way it's placed, with everyone walking by through the casino right next to me while I'm trying to eat.  

First thing I do is look at the drinks menu -- only  a handful of cocktails with even less that look appealing. I ordered the lychee martini, and as it turns out, they can't make it because they stopped making the lychee liquor.  Alright. Well somehow tons of other restaurants still manage to serve these,so whatever. I ordered another drink in which I could taste the vodka way too much.  

Then I ordered the cream cheese wontons.  The server comes back a few minutes later, and guess what, they don't have that either.  Alright, fine, I order gyoza instead.  Surprise surprise -- the server returns again and let's me know that they don't have gyoza either.  In fact they dont have any of the fried dim sum.  At an Asian restaurant. At 630 in the evening.  Seriously? They aren't apologetic about it at all.  I was pretty nice about it, albeit rightfully disappointing, which they didnt seem to appreciate for some reason.  

So I went ahead and just ordered the crispy honey shrimp. I order that a lot at Elephant Bar, and it was pretty good here but not comparable.  The quality/texture of the meat was weird.  It seemed...dry?  I'm not sure how to explain it.  It was a 

Not a particularly enjoyable experience, and maybe they should stock up better next time.  From here on out I'll just stick to Ra Sushi -- its on the other side of the strip but it's worth the trip!
Love to sit at the bar and see the people pass by in New York New York. The have great fresh rolls with a twist. Try the lemon crush it is a taste of heavenly freshness

So good and big portions! We had the Hawaiian roll, pad Thai and ahi poki. Poki was a little disappointing. Good flavor but mostly seaweed salad a a little poki. But the pad Thai & Hawaiian roll made up for it.

They offer sushi at this location, but I would not recommend it. The Chinese chicken salad is amazing, but I was not impressed with the hand rolls. 
Service was ok.

Extremely dirty. The hostess was friendly and courteous but the service was so off.

Bring my appetizer after we finish our meals and to top it off their spoon was so dirty, brought out another 3 after he noticed how dirty it was... but this was after he dipped that dirty spoon into my soup.

Food was good but me and my date were throwing up later that night and no it wasn't cuz we were drunk... go to Panda Express and save yourself some $ and time.

This place should be called Salt Salt instead! OMG! I ordered the hot and sour soup and the amount of salt in it was enough to feed a small ocean. I couldn't eat it!!!  They did take it back and took it off our bill.  I got the yellowtail sushi roll instead and those were the tiniest rolls I have ever gotten - and I consider myself a sushi fiend!  The rolls I get at Whole Foods are bigger than these were!  

Hubby ordered the pepper beef and it wasn't too bad.  Only reason we ate here was because we were hungry and the deli place we really wanted to go to was closed already :(  Server was friendly and the wait to get in wasn't too long, but we will never go here again.

Went to dinner here. Saw the reviews and gave it a shot. Food was delicious. We ordered California rolls, pork fried rice and or orange chicken. It was good. Service was good and food came out quick. Asahi beer on draft was not cold enough but overall the food and service was great.
Absolutely amazing service! I love the yang chow rice and Anthonys special noodles. Family style eating and generous portions.

One of the, if not, best sushi I have ever tried.  We shared the shrimp tampuri roll, red dragon and caterpillar.  All were fantastic.  A great place to try a good variety.  The service was good and the food was overall excellent.

We decided to give this place a try since its in New York New York and that's the hotel that we are staying at. As a Asian person I usually don't like to go out to eat overpriced Asian food especially a Chinese buffet. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The food was good. Certain items tasted better than others but the presentation was very nice. The dessert table is beautiful. Specific items that stuck out to me would be the chow mein, the barbecued pork and the sushi was pretty good as well. I had an offer for checking into Yelp and for some reason it wasn't redeeming but the girl that stopped by my table and asked if we needed anything else said it wasn't a problem and took care of it for me. That was very nice of her to do. I would definitely return. Service was good and so was the food.

We ordered the star won tons which were delicious! I got the volcano roll, which is probably the best sushi roll I've had yet! My husband got the honey siracha shrimp which is delicious but wasn't impressed by his vegetable lo mein... also the saketini was great! Recommend it for sure!

My wife and I had the ahi tuna roll and it was super good! The chef also gave us tons of little treats here and there! Great Yellow fin tuna, Edamame, some hot sake, and drinks! The staff was great, the food was amazing, my wife and I will defiantly be back! 10/10

The Las Vegas Strip has kneeled down to The Great Buddha and he's responded by granting  them Chin Chin's at The New York New York casino.

Wow, Chin Chins has been a favorite of mine since the 80's since I started dining at The West Hollywood location. Whether you get the dim-sum combo that gives you get 3 mini choices or should order off the menu I guarantee disappointment is not an option, just tasty bliss. The Chinese chicken salad is a must for any meal. Now some major items worth sampling are BBQ pork, potstickers, Szechwan dumplings ( in a  cilantro sauce ) or Gift Wrapped chicken then kick off your meal. Phase 2 of your Chin Chin journey offers you The honey prawns , King Pao Chicken or Mongolian Beef are excellent choices, so try one  and maybe the green bean dish to balance your veggies out from all flesh you'll eat.


Frank give this place a 10 Star double thumbs up review but Yelp only offers 5 so that's what you get!

We finally went to Chin Chin after passing by it a bunch of times. 

I am definitely glad we went in, because we had some great food for the price!

I have a gluten allergy, and they have an entire section of their menu without gluten! They have a chicken dish, gluten free, that wasn't that great. The spring rolls had a lot of basil in them which overpowered the flavor. So at first, I was a little worried about what was to come. 

However, their Mongolian beef made up for all of it! I swear it had crack in it. Perfectly cooked, not too sweet, not too many onions, just great. I could eat it any day! They also had gluten free crab and asparagus fried rice. Now, it comes without any real sauce, but they give you GF Soy sauce. Even without the sauce it was great! We couldn't stop eating it! Not greasy, totally hit the spot. They also had a noodle dish that was good too -  a little greasy, but slightly crispy noodles with a light sauce + beef. Yum. 

I gave it 4 stars because the food was pretty good, but the service was great too. We brought my 18 month old when we went, and the server was super friendly and kept giving him chopsticks and made him laugh. Friendly, knowledgeable, and all around good experience. We will definitely come here again!

P.S. They are able to do some sushi rolls gluten free too. I got their salmon cut roll, and even though at first I thought it was too pricey, the roll is huge! Tons of salmon, not too much rice, totally worth the price. The salmon was delicious too - not slimy or fishy. Fresh and tasty!

I had never been to Chin-Chin, which is strange because apparently it's a Los Angeles based restaurant, and I eat all over LA...
We had the lunch buffet... it was okay. Some of the offerings were weird... Mac and cheese with a side of sushi anyone? The broccoli beef was the outstanding dish, very tender meat, perfectly seasoned. All of the other items were okay, but nothing special. 
Our server was excellent! Very attentive, constantly refilling our drinks and removing our old plates.

After running around doing touristy things with family, we decided to give this place a try.
It has a bunch of great yelps, so why not? And if you check in on yelp, you can get a 2-4-1 priced lunch buffet. Sounds good.

I have had some of the best service ever while living in Las Vegas, and here was no exception. The hostess greeted us quickly and cheerfully, the waiter was great, we were off to a good start!

The lunch buffet was fine, nothing special to be honest. But what do you want for $19.95?
None of us were impressed. We worked our way though a few items, even though it was 12:30 in the afternoon, the selection felt a little picked over. It was fine for a quick and easy bite.

The "dessert" are was colorful, but almost everything we tried was hard or stale. With the exception off the "cookie sandwiches" they were really great, and fresh.

After reading the reviews, I am thinking that ordering off the menu might be a better way to go.
Next time, if there is one....I will try that.

Well waddaya know, a good breakfast, a good waiter, omelette was well cooked and the coffee cup was kept hot and full. I gave this waiter (no name tag) a good tip and yesterday's tip that should have been left at the South Beach Cafe (are you reading this South Beach Cafe) will probably re-visit during this trip...

Extremely slow service and under staffed. However, everyone was friendly and kind. 
We got sushi, beef and broccoli, and some friends rice and it was all delicious.
The price range was pretty good, anywhere from $10 - $25 and I like to think that is good for vegas!
Delicious food! Our service was great! Thanks to our server Ryan. The food came out really fast for a busy Saturday night. Would recommend to try this before a Zumanity show!!

Don't miss out on this place, you won't regret it!
Everyone is amazing from the wonderful bartender who took our "to go" order (didn't get his name) day before yesterday to our server last night Angel S., and Ian at breakfast this morning!! That's place runs like a well oiled machine. Everyone helps everyone else. We went there three times in the last three days. To us it looked like they truly care about their employees and their clientele. 

First day: Hawaiian roll was amazing (ordered with pineapple on the side). Pan fried pot stickers: yummy!!!

Second day: husband has the Pokie Roll and I had the Hawaiian (butt of course I stole a couple of pieces from the hubby).

Third day: We had the 2 for 1 breakfast...
Holy !! This is the way buffets should be run. All fresh and you could get made to order eggs, omelets, and a couple of other items. All included!!
I went for it. Omelette with asparagus, spinach, tomatoes, mushrooms, caramelized onions, goat cheese, and lump crab meat. Yes real crab meat!!
Husband had an omelette too but his was kinda boring. All his had was steak, hollandaise sauce, mushrooms, and cheddar cheese.

If we ever come back to Vegas (after recouping that is), this will be the first place we hit. Highly recommend!

Naisha was our server. She was new but what can I say amazing service and great addition to Chin Chin. They are very lucky to have her. Pedro her training officers was helpful and there to help her. Food was amazing and worth the price.

Worst food and service ever! If I'm paying between 17 to 18 dollars an entree plus pay an additional fee for rice, it better serve it's price. Took a really long time to get our food. Asked for water and no water served. Ice cream was not served when it's part of my children's meal. My food was also cold. 73 bucks later, Huge Disappointment!!! I do not recommend this place nor will I ever enter this place again. If I can give a no star, totally would.

I'm surprised to find a chinese restaurant in vegas that tastes pretty good and close to authentic chinese food.

We sat at the bar and the bar tender was great. She was attentive and friendly. We tried the singapore noodles which were pretty good. Of course I had better but it was pretty close. The portions were huge! We also ordered the curry chicken which was very tasty. The curry wasn't spicy, it was just the way I like it. We started with the foil wrapped chicken which had huge pieces of chicken but not too much flavor so it wasn't that  great. 

Overall, it was pretty comforting here. Had a great meal and food wasn't even pricey. Great place for some decent chinese food at a great price in vegas.

I came here to cure a hangover. To cure a hangover in Hawaii, I would eat pho or dim sum so I came here in search of some great dim sum. Well, you're definitely not going to find it here. The dim sum came in metal steamers which I thought was odd. I've only seen wooden ones before. I soon found out why most places use wooden ones... Because the dim sum sticks to the metal ones, causing all the fillings to come out of the unwrapped dumpling!

I ordered the wonton soup... The soup was so bland that I may have been drinking hot water and I wouldn't have known the difference. 

Our table shared some other "traditional" Chinese dishes and they all sucked. To top everything off, the service was one of the worst. He never refilled our water, never came by to check on us so we couldn't let him know how awful the food was and he took forever to bring out the check. 

The reason we chose this place? I overheard two separate strangers that Chin Chin had great Chinese food. They serve sushi here too. What kind of Chinese restaurant serves sushi? This kind! The sucky kind!

I had the lo mein and it was pretty darn good, but then again I was super hungry. We also go the plum sake and it was really good. We had a great server that was very attentive, because we were all chugging water. It was nice because they had a few gluten-free items (not many, maybe 5); we had 2 in our party that are gluten intolerant so it was nice to see. I was overall satisfied when we left. The atmosphere was nice and not too crazy but relaxing.
Alex G was a great server (and handsome) ... here in Vegas for a few days, grabbed an app and snow pea chicken it was delicious and his service was unbelievable. We will be back!!

Only had the breakfast buffet here. We visited 3x during our stay at NyNy. The price was very reasonable for all that they offered. The servers were excellent as well. One morning, we had cesar as our waiter and he went above and beyond. He deserves a kudos! Will definitely be back when we return to vegas.

Chin chin was hands down amazing. Our last night in Vegas we decided to here. The food was oooo sooooo good. Our waiter was a cool guy from queens ny. Me a brooklyn girl. Guess he heard our New York Accents lol 

He told us what some of his face on the menus where. But I knew exactly what I wanted. A cucumber avocado roll. And Chicken Fried wontons. They were the best I've had yet! Fried so crispy. With this delicious sweet and sour sauce on the side. Hands down my fav off the menu.

Stumbled into this gem on a Tuesday night after an hour of heavy mixed drinking/lottery playing at NYNY. Holy crap they had Dim Sum but even with a heavy buzz there's no way my cheap behind was going to throw $7.95 at a measly six pieces of Shiu Mai. That's a good ten minutes of play at the penny slots, my friend. 

I usually pick at food like an anorexic chipmunk but hot damn! Tonight I single-handedly murdered a whole plate of pineapple fried rice as my bf and cousin watched in amazement. Siriachi sauce and about ten watered-down amfs will do wonders for stomach expandment. That little switch that triggers you to stop eating 'cuz you're full? Never turned on. I was two bites from exploding like a retarded goldfish.

Yeah, you can get just-as-tasty chinese food in LA for a fraction of the price, but for the location and the portions, I'd most definitely stop by again if I'm staying at the NYNY. Word!

O-M-G

So they had a Chin Chin here in Lakewood a couple of years ago and unbeknownst to me it closed down...I still have dreams of my lovely Chin Chin.  The way I used to get my order to go and eat it all before I hit Lakewood Blvd.  Ahh, Chin Chin, I used to feel as though you loved me just as much as I loved you...

So on my recent trip to Las Vegas (The Meadows for all you newcomers) I stayed in a fun filled hotel called New York New York.  There are three separate tower elevators to get up to the rooms.  You are assigned an elevator based on your room.  I think I cried and wet myself all at once to see that right before our elevator was CHIN CHIN!

I stayed in Vegas for four nights and probably ate every other meal here.  It is cheap, good Chinese food.  The best Chicken Fried Rice I have had in a long long time...

Two thumbs way up!

This is a very nice place for breakfast or brunch. If you come in before 9am, it is $40 for 2, with all drinks, and first cocktails is free too. The orange drink is very good, very fresh and coffee is good too. It is all you can eat buffet, you can have the items are ready on the food counter or you can order from the brunch menu. I love the brunch menu, you can create your own dish, you pick any items you want to. My first "eggs your way" was so good - sunny side up with asparagus, mushrooms, shrimps, crabs meat and steak. It was a perfect dish for me. Because I was getting full but I want more the shrimps and asparagus so I asked the waitress if I skip the eggs but just shrimps and asparagus is okay. She said," sure, you can order any way you want." Love the shrimps and asparagus, very healthy and make me feel good. 
The customer service is excellent and our waitress is very sweet and lovely. 
Definitely recommend it and we will be back.

It was nice to have half price deal before 9am for breakfast buffet. The food was good, so the customer service. The nice thing here that they give you unlimited refilled coffee and juice, also they have the options for you to select for your meal, you order whatever on the menu and build your own breakfast plate. 
We definitely want to come back.

Thank you for saving our anniversary dinner!!! After leaving a nearby sushi place because of horrible service, my husband and I were famished and decided to just give this place a try since we were staying at NYNY anyway and didn't feel like going anywhere else to eat. Immediately, we were greeted by this very friendly hostess who showed us the menu, which is a mix of Chinese and Japanese. At that point I was "Hangry" and was about to eat whatever so we decided to get a table. We waited about 2-3 minutes and we're seated at a corner booth. In less than a minute, our server Robb came up to greet us right away. He was very friendly and asked us if we were celebrating anything. We ordered and I was surprised how big the rolls were! They both tasted good and was satisfied. After dinner they came up and gave us a very cute plate that had congratulations written in chocolate and a cheesecake to share. Looking around though, everyone looked very happy with their food and their portions are good on either menu. It's a great value for strip pricing and I cannot say enough praises for Robb and his trainee Natalie who were exceptionally amazing at what they do! The manager even took time to go around the tables asking everyone how everything is going! I am seriously impressed with this place and the staff they have here!
