Was a little skeptical at first, but was pleasantly surprised! The service is pretty good. The hostess and our waitress were very nice and made sure that we were enjoying our food and asked us about how our trip was going, etc.

I ordered the crispy honey shrimp with a side of brown rice. And my boy friend ordered a noodle dish. Both were really good! A little on the pricier side (they charge $9 for 2 spring rolls!! Lol)

But for our entrees, the portions are pretty big. we had to take boxes to go. So the price was worth it

The food was very good. Still craving for more of that shrimp!
Great breakfast buffet, clean restaurant  and friendly staff . Our waiter Pedro was awesome this morning
Great breakfast buffet just 13$ with a drink. Huge variety eggs pastries meats. Must try it's a great deal!

I was slightly underwhelmed by this place. I had mistakenly ordered their Monkey Brain, which turned out to be a hollowed out avocado stuffed with who-knows-what... When I informed the waitress that I anticipated an actual roll, she gladly provided me with the menu so I could make a selection of something I'd eat but neglected to remove the Monkey Brain from my receipt, which I did not eat any of. It would have been nice if she would have informed me that I was ordering something other than a roll, obviously not being from around Vegas.. SO that was $9 wasted. 
On a positive note, my cup of hot and sour soup was pretty delicious and the second item that I ordered was the NY Roll.. It was okay - I was only able to eat half of it by the time I finally got it to the table. 
Drink prices were insane, so we skipped on those. 
Overall I feel like this place is way overpriced for mediocre food. It'd be a hard sell getting me back in here again.
It was our first time here. These guys rock! We were a group of 16 people on Christmas day, and everything was great. I definitely recommend it! Our waiter was Andres. He was very nice.

Just great 

Try Anthony's Noodles and Chinese Chicken Salad.  But here's a secret - order 1/2 order chicken salad -- It's plenty!

Always hit this place up while in LV. Food was good and the server was nice.
No complaints.

My meal at Chin Chin was better than I expected.  The menu is full of the food that you'd find in any local Americanized Chinese take out place along with various other Asian foods like Sushi and Pad Thai.  I didn't see any Pho or Bulgogi and I was almost expecting them.

I hadn't eaten all day and because the underwhelming size of a previous meal at the nearby Gonzales y Gonzales, I may have ordered too much.  I got a Spicy Rainbow Roll and the Peanut Noodles.  They were both good, larger than I expected, and not under-spiced. Even better, I didn't wake up thirsty in the middle of the night because of too much salt or MSG.

I would have liked to see more sushi and sashimi options, but to complain about it at a Chinese restaurant seems weird.  I would have also have liked to try something that I couldn't get at home and sadly, the Peanut Noodles were about as close as I could get.

Absolutely great customer service at this place! 
The staff will go above and beyond to create a pleasant experience. Thumbs up to the management as they lead by example. Breakfast all American buffet isn't very good but the sushi is Delish!

Had dinner, I ordered the dumplings with a cilantro sauce and they were good. My friend ordered the sweet and sour pork. The pork was so chewy had to spit it out. To use poor quality meat at the prices they charge, disappointed. Dexter was our server and he was great, fast, efficient and very pleasant.

Im a big fan of sushi so I ordered the Vegas sushi roll and let's just say I've had better lol it was okay....the customer service was great and it was quick. But I honestly wouldn't recommend the Vegas roll at least. My friend ordered the orange chicken with white rice meal and that was good

Way too salty and nasty.  Imagine a normally tasty Mongolian beef, then at the last minute the chef accidently pours in an entire bottle of soy sauce.  Add to that lots  of MSG and you've reproduced the Chin Chin secret recipe.  This is the Asian restaurant at New York New York, and I say you are better off with Panda Express / Manchu Wok at Excalibur.

During our weekend rendezvous here in Vegas, New York New York was the hotel we were staying at. We actually had a breakfast buffet here. For only $14 for each person from 7-1pm, that wasn't bad at all. The food was very good. I actually liked their triangular hash browns-reminded me of the ones that were given when I was back in  grade school. The wait wasn't long at all-we were sat in one minute after arriving. It was a very peaceful time we had here. The staff were very courteous and always refilling our drinks for us. I have yet to try their lunch menu, but for my next trip here,I will be sure to.......

Certain clues indicate that a business is on the brink of failure or beaming with success. Chin chin at NYNY hotel casino is forging toward the former and a far cry from that latter.  In the past, I found the restaurant decent, but my most recent experiences tell me that it may be replaced or the existing operations management should be fired.

The place has no identity, it's not a great Chinese restaurant, mediocre sushi bar, and a poor attempt at recovering revenue by acting as a morning breakfast buffet with bland continental offerings with a splash of " Asian" flavor to concur with the theme.

Notice that there are more bad Yelp reviews of this place than good... Not a a good sign.

Food presented as large portions, but its a "smoke and mirrors" tactic. Mostly fillers and lacking in authentic flavor. Tastes like they took a wok and splashed the kitchen in there with an extreme amount of soy sauce without paying close attention to wok temp, and amount of the authentic spices, or lack thereof.

If you like Panda Express and want to overpay 3x its value then Chin Chin at NYNY will suit your tastes.

By far the worst sushi I have ever had.

It took the waiter a full ten minutes to notice we were there even though we were in the very front and there was hardly anyone in the place.
I was excited to get some tasty, tasty sushi but I was sorely disappointed when I got the menu and there were literally six items on the sushi menu. I should have cut my losses right then. 
I ordered a Rainbow Roll and some Yellowtail. The yellowtail was alright but I was disappointed there was no roe. The Rainbow Roll was terrible!!! I'm used to getting at least eight decent sized peices out of a roll and for there to be healthy chunks of albacore inside the roll. Not here. This $16 roll was five peaces and was filled with Krab and enough mayo to clog my arterties.
I ended up eating most of the rolls because I was hungry but toward the end, I picked the actually fish off the top.
When the waiter returned, he commented that I hadn't finished everything and asked if I was too full. I told him no I wasn't too full, I was just really disappointed in the dish. He laughed and said he would finish my food for me, dropped the check and was never seen again. 
Yuck.

He gets one star for tracking us down when my boyfriend forgot his credit card.
Food was just so-so. Seriously, have to pay extra for rice in  a Chinese restaurant. First time for everything I guess.

This was right underneath our hotel room and it was delicious!!! Way better than a lot of Chinese restaurants, and New York New York has some gross places. Or people that just don't care. So this was a great refresher!

This is my favorite place to eat when i stay at NyNy in Vegas!!  Now they offer breakfast and lunch buffet!!  Had both this weekend and for $20 u cant go wrong!!  I love their sushi!!  Big portions and always so fresh and good!!  Service is always the best!!  Always look forward to coming here for dinner but now can come for every meal

Maybe it was the evening but the food was mediocre and service was slow.

The drinks took 15 minutes.   We ordered appetizers.   The appetizers were uninspiring.    The appetizers did not taste as if they were made on site but purchased thru a service company (ex. Sysco ).

My friends ordered the sushi and ment I need it was pleasant but nothing to write home about. I ordered the General Tso Chicken.  My sauce was bitter (thinking it was mixed with something or not prepared correctly.

The wait staff was pleasant but slow.   I would skip this place and find something more appealing.

Please note that you can see the kitchen staff.   They too seem uninspired which is probably reflective of the food.

Honestly, it's your average over-priced hotel restaurant joint. Rolls are expensive, and they kind of suck but the chicken potstickers were good. Our bartender Louis was very accommodating and provided excellent service. These three stars are for him!

Service: At first we were seated fairly quickly. Then we had a coupon that was for free dim sum and the server was happy to take that with no issues. She then took our regular order for our entrees, quick and polite! After our dinner we ordered dessert which was also quick to come out. Overall fast and friendly!

Food: the seamed chicken dumplings was out choice for our free dim sum, they were so good they didn't need any sauce! The orange chicken was what my husband and I SHARED for dinner with 2 bowls of steamed rice. Just delicious!!!! They made our daughters chicken without sauce so she was very happy. Lastly we ordered mochi for dessert, it was not like the mochi we had eaten before but was good. We only tried the raspberry flavor but it was pretty good, it was a good small sharing dessert. Overall this was our second visit and On my way! one be our last!
Yes the service was slow, and the hostess acted like she didn't want to seat us.  Within 12 hours of eating here, I got sick to my stomach.

This is honestly a hidden gem in Vegas. I'm always skeptical of Chinese restaurants (being Chinese myself), but the food here is top-notch quality and mirrors what I typically eat with my fam.

We had the AYCE lunch buffet during my visit. We sat at the bar and was served by Kayli. She was very friendly and knowledgable -- she knew exactly what the dishes were (ppl beside us kept asking what sushi dishes they had). Kayli also knew her drinks and was able to whip up a dragon fruit mojito for me, which was not on the drink menu and was very well balanced and not too strong.

Food wise, I highly recommend the DIY lettuce wraps, and the BBQ Pork (SOOO GOOD). The fried rice was also amazing but a bit salty. Since they only had a small selection, I was able to try a bit of everything and it was amazing. They had all of the staples like shrimp and celery, 3x fried rice, chow mein, mango chicken, etc. Epic place and I'm glad I found it! 

(Note - the one missing star is because of the small selection, and it was actually quite difficult to find in NY NY)
The worst wait staff I have experienced in a long time. Felt compelled to write a review. Need new management!  Hurry!  Not worth visiting. A shame - my experience with this chain had been good...
My favorite Chinese restaurant in Vegas. The service is super good. Especially Emmanuel. Handsome and nice. Food is awesome! Fried rice is delicious!

Yummy!

Inside the fun New York New York casino, Chin Chin is the same restaurant which I dined at in Los Angeles on Sunset Boulevard a few months ago. 

Sophie, our server, was amazing, which made the meal even better. Arrived before seeing Zumanity, and tried their dim sum, chicken in lettuce cups and a bowl of the hot and sour soup. Fresh and filling, and not too pricey. 

Wasn't too crowded either, as it was around 5:30 when I arrived, but got more and more crowded during the meal. Not gourmet Chinese food, but not bad either.

The coffee is terrible. It's like brown water, but the service is great. Pedro is the best server, very attentive and funny. The breakfast buffet has something for everyone. The chocolate covered strawberries and fresh whipped cream are delicious. They even include a make your own omelet in the price. I highly recommend.

We stayed at NYNY and our elevator was right behind Chin Chin so we constantly kept walking past it and decided to try their 2x1 breakfast special after talking to the girls when you walk in. What they DON'T tell you is that you can't use the complimentary bloody mary and mamosa special at the same time. My wife and I don't even like those drinks, but we thought since it was a comp of their breakfast specials we gave them a shot but only took two sips and left them.

Our waiter was straight horrible and even lied to us when my wife had asked for more orange juice... after 15 minutes of walking past us he finally came back and said they were "out of orange juice" and then 2 minutes later a waitress at another table was FUCKING SERVING ORANGE JUICE!!!! I couldn't believe it. 

Once I finally got our check of course was when I realized and finally found out that I was charged for two breakfasts and had the shitty drinks comped. Ultimately, he let me do the 2x1 since it was cheaper and I ended up paying for the drinks just to get out of there. 

Maybe the lunch/dinner vibe is better but I definitely wouldn't recommend this place for breakfast. All in all, we spent 2 hours to eat something we could've finished at Denny's in 30 minutes. Never again, dude.
Absolutely fabulous breakfast buffet. Made to order omelettes are out of this world, Take a look!

Wow, went to Chin Chin Thursday night and was very happy with the food and the service. The staff was friendly and service was fast. The prices were very fair. I Look forward to going back again shortly !

5 stars for the dinner menu,  but only 3 stars for the breakfast buffet.  

The breakfast buffet is just so-so. Nothing special and the taste was just okay.  

Onto the dinner menu: excellent! 
Our waiter was super nice and completely on top of his game so we didn't wait long for anything.  And the food was delicious.  The sushi rolls were perfectly made (and quickly too). We also ordered walnut chicken,  pad thai, mu Gu guy pan,  seafood noodles,  and wanton soup to share around the table.  Everything came in large portions and was cooked to perfection.  Definitely recommend for a group meal.

This place is overrated and overpriced. Came for a breakfast buffet. We were seated a few minutes past nine, so we didn't receive the 2-for-1 discount. Paid $23.95 per person. The food choices were very limited and there was no sushi. The waitress told us sushi would only be available for lunch buffet starting at noon. Cookies and cakes were too sweet for our taste. We left the place with empty stomach and great regrets.

Walking down to get a bottle of wine and also sushi- my Riesling - which is a cheap bottle of wine- was overpriced - like everything else - the bottle was 40- this sushi was over 100 dollars- they do roll it up on front of you-like every other sushi restaurant I have been 2- there is no bathroom here- this place is kinda like an expensive food court- you pay 100 dollars for sushi- get up an it's left then left again  for the restroom - not sure if that's the directions - but keep walking through the smoke you will find it -

Just ordere fried rice (panda express has almost same quality and taste) and some noodle dish---anything but authentic and just wasnt memorable at all. Skip the waste of time, not even worth the one trip there.

The food was so so. None of our sushi rolls were impressive; had the crab salad, and soft shell crab rolls. My pineapple fried rice was way too salty. The General Tso's chicken was pretty good, however. The prices are kinda high, too. I wouldn't recommend this place at all. Make the drive to Chinatown for the real deal instead.

Horrible service by the manager REBECCA .. She made a mistake on my refund and then when i confronted her about t she chooses to argue with me about it instead of apologize .. This place is over priced and Panda Express tastes better .. $70 for 2 people .. Def not worth it .. Save your money if your craving Chinese go somewhere else

Next time someone says to go to Chin Chin, I'm probably gonna have to say No No, unless I'm adamant on having something resembling Chinese food and am physically unable to go elsewhere.

I had eaten here for dinner a couple years ago and would have said it was A-OK.  You're looking for Chinese food on The Strip at a restaurant and it's not like there's lots to choose from. There's the chain PF Chang's (which is better than Chin Chin actually) at Planet Hollywood, and Pearl at MGM (which is a lot more expensive and you get less food), but not a whole lot else. 

On my recent visit, I was trying for a lunch under $20 and it's possible here.  Many of the dishes are about $13, like the Chicken Chow Fun with Black Bean Sauce.  It was ok, I've experienced better, but it's not like I struggled to eat it. I'm a critic of noodles these days, so accepted them for what they were.

As for the har gow I ordered for $8.25 (you get 5 of them) it was the worst dim sum I've ever had.  I don't think I've used such terminology in a review before.  I know I was spoiled in SF Chinatown the other week, but this tasted nothing like dim sum.  I couldn't believe it, it was pretty terrible to the point it's hard to describe it.  It almost had a sweet taste to it, and not in a good way.  Major regret, I would've been better off just getting the noodles (and would have managed to get out for less than $20) but when I see dim sum on the menu it's hard to resist.

After having that, there's nothing I could do now but resist it.  I'd tape my mouth shut to prevent it from ever getting into my mouth again.

This is the best part of visiting New York New York!  We are able to get a decent vegan meal by ordering the chinese chicken salad w/ tofu & had both the steamed veggie and pan fried veggie dumplings.  Good service too!  Nice retreat from the noisy casino floor.

Really good sushi happy hour and regular priced hand rolls. It was so easy to walk down stairs, order and take it back to the room while we got ready to go out. prices decent but they do need to update their on-line menu

If you've never had Chinese food or sushi before then you may find this place acceptable. The spring roles are frozen and partially defrosted before being served. They are truly awful. The sushi you get from Safeway is higher quality. The only reasonable item was the bok choy with mushrooms because you only have to heat them up and serve them with a bit of sauce on top. Skip this place and save the money.

Good place for reasonably priced Chinese food in a sit down restaurant in Vegas, with a very good service. General Sao chicken & Eggplant dish are a must try. 
One star less for a long wait, been there twice and everytime we stoof in line for about 20mins :D......I believe it is for most of the good restaurants on Saturday nights.
Food was awesome, fresh and lots of great selections. Scott was a great waiter, will be dining here every trip to Vegas! Don't forget to tip on the price of the meal before the discount!

Decent "Westernized" Chinese restaurant. It's not real Chinese food but it's close enough. Great place to eat after you're done with the tables. Soups are decent. Food is a bit salty thought. Probably one of your better options @ NY-NY.

Yum. If you're in las Vegas, you gotta try this place. Eating here will leave you wishing there was one in your hometown. The service is great and the food is even better. I call this upscale Chinese food. Kinda like PF Changs. I would recommed everything on the menu. My favorites are the wonton soup and the gift wrap chicken. Don't deprive yourself. Eat here.

I wanted something on the lighter side - and chin chin sounded good since I remember the sunset location was pretty good in LA.  This one is not the same!  The recipes are pretty off- so I think they contracted the name but the chefs are off.  I would never go back.

Would've rate it 2.5 stars. The food was edible. Didn't get any stomach issue. The food is not authentic Chinese cuisine. But we were able to ask our server if the cook/chef will be able to change some of the ingredients in what we ordered, and they were able to cater to our specifications, hence the 3 stars. Soup was a bit on the salty side. Noodles & Fried Rice were good.

I wasn't sure about this place but it was agreed upon by the group for a convenient place to grab a quick bit after we saw Zumanity.  The sushi rolls were pretty good, but my mushu was way too salty and wet!  what cook doesn't drain the filling before wrapping it?!  It was sitting in so much sauce I had to eat it with my fork.  Just imagine eating your burrito that way because it was swimming in sauce!  Too bad.  Our server was awesome tho, man I can't remember his name!  But he was a cutie and gave us very good service.  The only reason I didn't send my food back!

We had the sweetest most attentive waitress here but unfortunately everything she brought us was horrible. The BF and I ordered the orange beef and Singapore noodles. The orange sauce was too tangy and got tiring really quickly. My noodles were so incredibly dry and had very little meat. It was incredibly bland. The portions are large here but what's the point of having a ton of food if it's gross?
Ahhhh I love this place!!! I ate here 3 days in a row! The Sushi is amazing here. It's right by the elevators that go to my room so it's perfect.

This is a knock off of a PF Chang, just ok , the hostess was the best, she was sweet and held our table for us , the waitress was not good, I had to ask 3 times for my baby girl to just get plain white rice, we had been traveling, checked into the hotel and  we were hungry and tired, the food was nothing to write home about , I have had better. I will not go back here as this is Vegas and SO many other GREAT places to eat, and with great customer service. By the way the rice finally came, after she fell asleep in my arms.

Came here for a quick dinner.  I wasn't expecting much, but they far exceeded my expectations based on the yelp reviews.  Between the two of us we ordered the 1) chicken mushu - flavorful and chicken wasn't dry, 2) sliced bbq pork - i love slice bbq pork and this did not disappoint!, 3) wonton stars - it's not just artificial crab, I could really taste the real crab, 4) shrimp with snowpeas - i love snowpeas and they tasted fresh, shrimp were a decent size too and not scrawny like some places i've been, 5) spicy garlic eggplant - nice kick to the dish, very flavorful, my favorite 6) combination fried rice - nice big pieces of chicken, beef, and more shrimp!...Sometimes I just really crave fried rice and this really hit the spot!

Service was good enough.  Water was always filled.  No complaints!  Left happy and full...bill was a tad high but...that's to be expected in Vegas.

Food was ok--service was terrible. Waiter was nonexistent; he forgot my wife's tea, then made some lame excuse about it steeping. He forgot the condiments for our food, was not available to bring us the check and provide a to go bag. We then called the manager over and asked for the to go bag, and HE FORGOT TOO.  There's just too many choices in LV to put up with neglect. We go to the chin chins in studio city all the time and have never had this kind of experience.
Bok Choy  and mushroom entree with the spicy eggplant sauce. The nice man working at the bar recommended it and said it was his favorite. What a great recommendation! Thank you, Sir!

Came here before seeing Zumanity. Chose the location based on proximity to the show. Portions were large but quality was so-so. Our group sampled many things and there wasn't anything absolutely outstanding, either good or bad. With so many incredible restaurants in Vegas, we will likely will not eat here again.

Randomly came across this place & enjoyed the atmosphere, service & food. I had a chicken dumpling which was really good & the chicken chow mien which I devoured it was so good, also a huge portion. Little pricey but that's expected from any restaurant inside a casino. I'd like to go back to try some of their sushi.
Great welcoming staff & friendly service.  The sushi was just average.  It need some improving.  Also, there was a mess up on the order that shouldn't of be missed.

I like this place...its like a poor mans PF Chang's. Its good food if your at The New York New York Casino. 

I typically only eat here and at Starbucks when I am at this hotel...

The blonde haired asian hostess is really hot and that is my standard reason for eating here. She can walk me to my table...ANYTIME! lol

This place is bad.
Breakfast is very similar to what you would get at a Mexican Resort, except much less.  The food quality is fine except it is limited to a few items. The service is awful.

We had sushi, 2 entrees.  California roll, spicy tuna roll, shrimp tempura.  Pad Thai and Honey shrimp.$75 total bill. It was definitely a poor man's PF Changs. Sushi was very low rated. Pad Thai was terrible. Honey shrimp was ok. Spend your money on a good piece of pizza across the way.
A solid meh for their breakfast buffet. Compared to other buffets the price was okay, but also compared to other buffets their selections was really limited. Ah well. Lesson learned.

We came in for dinner on a Wednesday night and this place was empty.  We were seated right away and we got a waitress that must have been new because she kept messing up.  We ordered pot stickers...curry chicken RICE...and peanut noodles.  Yeah it's kind of a strange combination but so what...we were on vacation.

After about 15 minutes of placing our order we get out pot stickers and as we were finishing them our waitress comes back and asks us what else we ordered besides the peanut noodles.  Why didn't she ask sooner...why should she even have to ask at all...I could have sworn I saw her write it down.  So anyways, I told her chicken curry...and then she says oh yeah I remember...so I mistakenly thought she remembered that I said chicken curry RICE!

Another 15 minutes later our order comes out and guess what...we didn't get the chicken curry rice...it was just their chicken curry dish...but we decided not send it back because we didn't want to wait another 15 minutes.  My friend didn't like the pot stickers or the peanut noodles.  I personally thought everything was O.K.  If you order their noodles they are VERY generous on the portions...too generous actually.

Our waitress came back only once and then I had to flag her down for more refills.  It was just an O.K. experience.  If I were really craving Chinese food I would come back.
The breakfast buffet is delicious and if you sit at the bar, your first mimosa or Bloody Mary is only $1. Plus the bartender April is a total sweetie and can make a mean Bloody Mary.

This is a great Chinese restaurant in the New York - New York Hotel & Casino. My husband and I grabbed a quick dinner here before a show and it was a great choice. 

The service was really friendly and incredibly fast. We ordered the chicken won tons with apricot dip, pineapple fried rice, and hot and sour soup. All were great. 

I would definitely go back there!

The restaurant is inside New York New York. The service was attentive and friendly. The menu is extensive with family style Chinese entrees and sushi. We didn't try any of the Chinese dishes but the sushi rolls were surprisingly pretty big and good. Overall I was fairly pleased by the menu and the dishes. Not the best I've had but not bad at all.

We first visited Chin Chin during our last trip to Vegas in 2009. Loved the service and the food, so we returned for dinner during this trip. Dexter was our waiter, and he was amazing. Great drink suggestion for my husband, who happened to really enjoy it. Dinner (sushi) was fantastic as well.

Highly disappointed! This place is located in the NY Hotel. We were tired and placed a "pick up" order. When we got to our room, we realized they didn't give us any spoons to eat our soup with. I called them up and asked if they could please send some up to our room since we had already settled in - the receptionist told me that they "are not allowed to leave the restaurant". The eggplant was super greasy and the lo mein noodles were dry. For being inside a hotel and casino, and having an ultramodern store front, I was expecting much better than your standard  "Chinese food".....if you're looking for a quality meal, you will be disappointed! If you're just looking to fill your stomach after hours of boozing and gambling, you'll be happy.

What a wonderful buffet with a great price! Oh, and there was no wait at all!

There are a lot of different Chinese dishes. We got orange chicken, spring rolls, vegetable rice, noodles, beef with broccoli, shrimps and maybe something else ( I don't remember:)) Everything was pretty good but I think beef was over-salted. 

I loved their desserts! Fruit tart was the best dessert I had in a looong time. That custard was just magical! I enjoyed cheesecake as well. Chocolate covered strawberries are basically always the same for me. 

And now the best part: we paid only for one lunch buffet from two with Yelp coupon. We spent 21 on buffet plus taxes and a good tip = 38$. Not bad for Vegas, right?;)

I'm definitely planning to come back here on my next Vegas trip. The only thing that I didn't like was out waitress. She was good but as soon as she heard about our coupon she changed her attitude. No, she wasn't rude but just less attentive and kinda cold. My husband gave her a good tip so she would feel better about us having a coupon (lol). I'd do the opposite thing! Anyway, don't judge book by it's cover. Btw manager was very nice when she came to confirm our coupon

Definitely, would give 5 stars to this place but service should be improved.

Had the pleasure of dining at Chin Chin 3/24/16. The service was great. Everyone was polite from the hostess to the bus person. The sushi was presented beautifully  and tasted great. The entrees were large portions, and exactly as described. This is not a real Chinese/Thai restaurant. it's an American Chinese/Thai Restaurant. - very much like PF Changs. Good food, but no WOW.

As with ALL Chinese buffets, you have to home in on the items that they do best & keep going back for more...
That being said, I was a bit disappointed that the buffet is rather modest & had a few items that were not very good, especially given that the buffet is $19.95 (plus tax) per person & is located in Vegas, where a restaurant has to compete with all the other restaurants & buffets that are here...
On the plus side, while I am very wary of the sushi served at Chinese buffets, my wife found the sushi here to be good & freshly prepared...

I am writing this review because of our great server, Sean.  He was informative, efficient, solicitous and funny.  The food was good and served promptly.  The rest of the staff we encountered was very nice, but Sean was outstanding!  Thank you for making our night so much better!

Ordered the Basked Alaskan and Yum Yum Scallop. So delicious and perfectly prepared by Chef Koong. The place has a nice setup. We sat at the sushi bar. Koong totally vibed with our whole meal. Im a sushi lover, and its one of the best. Ask for Koong she'll tell you what's best in Vegas.

Reasonably priced Americanized "Chinese" fare....nothing special but our server was cool as hell and made sure to give good recommendations. I had a vegetable tofu dish that was tasty and one of the few healthier items on the menu.  The sauce had a nice taste and wasn't overly salty.  The Grey Goose cosmo was served as it should be...ice cold.

Best thing about Chin Chin - SERVICE BABY!  These people know the true meaning of it!  When you pass by the restaurant while walking through NYNY you will usually find the hostess at Chin Chin standing out in front with a big, welcoming smile!

We sat at the bar and chose the Deluxe Wanton Soup and Pork Potstickers.  Both were really good.

I had two glasses of a Malbec wine which was very tasty (the only Malbec on the menu - forgot the name).

We have eaten at Chin Chin both times being in Vegas!  They've gotta be doin something right to keep us coming back!
Worst sushi I had in my life and the rolls were $25 each. Each member of my group ate one piece and had to leave  the rest because it was so bad. 0/10 would recommend.

Service was great, food was delicious.  Spring rolls to start followed by Mongolian beef, chicken and broccoli, peanut noodles and pepper steak.  Everything was great and we appreciated the fast service.

we went for the lunch buffet, only because of the BOGO deal we found on yelp.  Otherwise, we won't have gone there, esp. given all the good choices on the Strip.  Food was OK, but the service was very good (which was rewarded by a generous tip, thanks Oscar).

It seems like everything cost twice as much in Vegas and the menu items at Chin Chin are no exception. We went with the lunch buffet at $23 pp (soda and tea are extra starting at $5). Although this cost is on par with most all you can eat buffets in Vegas, the sushi starts at $25 for just a few pieces with a cup of rice being $8.00 extra. The variety of food was good and the quality is on par with Panda Express. The entrees included Kung Pow Chicken, Beef & Broccoli, General Taos Chicken with soup, rice, egg rolls, salad, 4 types of sushi rolls and a variety of dessert items. The service was very friendly and attentive. We stayed away from ordering sushi as it was too expensive for what little you were offered.

we stayed at NY NY Hotel and we're too tired from walking all day to go somewhere for dinner so we decided to give this place a try. we were pleasantly surprised!  we had sweet and sour chicken  with fried rice,cashews prawns, salad and "sex on the beach" cocktail . Everything was simply delicious  and beautifully served!  we didn't  leave a crumb on a plate :). The service was wonderful!  They exceeded our expectations!  the price is also reasonable.
I want to add,because we had lunch buffet in this restaurant next day,and it was amazing!  We got the discount coupon 20%,so again it very responsibly priced and we had high quality tasty food! We enjoyed every bit! The service was exceptional. Every staff member is very nice and courteous!  Thank you guys!!!We will be back next time we in Vegas!  :)

It's pricey but everything is in a touristy place like Vegas. It is so good. I had the Assorted Pleasures and a Miso soup. It was plenty of food for me. I don't know what's in that gift wrap chicken but it was amazing!! And the miso soup was just right for a late night dinner is Vegas. I recommend this place in a sea of pizza places. I ordered take out and it was ready in 15-20 minutes. I recommend the assorted pleasures. It's a 8-piece appetizer, so you can get a little taste of different things. Like their egg roll, wontons, and the gift wrap chicken - which was soo tasty. Enjoy!
Had the lunch buffet and it was awesome! Great service and great selection. I would definitely go back.
Went there today, and enjoyed a great lunch. The service was excellent and the food was quite good!! I recommend this place to those looking for affordable Asian cuisine.

Came here for a quick late dinner. I ordered a spicy tuna roll and it was great!! Can't go wrong there! My mom ordered the teriyaki chicken bowl, she didnt like it that much, said the sauce tasted funny, I tasted it and thought it was fine. Oh well! My sister had the broccoli beef, so good!!! Probably our favorite dish!!! Service was nice and the restaurant was clean!! Would come back!!

Two stars only because the staff was great. The food was stale and over cooked. The buffet is microscopic and the msg is ladled on. The wait staff could not have been friendlier. Too bad about the food.

I have ate here 4 others times. I only eat fish and tofu , so I eat tofu a lot . Tofu here sucked , no flavor. But worse was the waiter. He never asked how my food was , never gave me a refill. I didn't eat any of the tofu or the rice, when I told him how bad it was , he said it's tofu. So I paid $46 for a soda and sushi.

Had lunch and sushi at Chin Chin while on a recent trip to Vegas. The sushi was good, we had the 2 for 1 lunch special.  California roll and spicy tuna, the crab in the California roll was fresh, taste was great. I'd have to say the California roll was better than the tuna.

We also ordered General Tso's chicken and a noodle bowl.

The General Tso's had a dark brown sauce with a unique taste. I'm not sure I can say I like that flavor compared to the other General Tso's I've had in the past. As for the noodle bowl, it was tasty, chicken, shrimp, and beef with veggies and thick noodles. I asked for mine a little spicy so it had a bite to it but nothing over the top.

The price was a bit on the high side for lunch, it was 50+ dollars with the food mentioned above and a Coke.

I'd eat at Chin Chin again but it wouldn't be something that is a must have

Yang Chow Fried rice was REALLY good, but they use the cheap small shrimps instead of the jumbo shrimps. We also got the chicken egg rolls, which I didn't care for and the Mongolian Beef was just OK. It tasted more like Teriyaki to me. We asked for the calamari and ended up not getting it because the server didn't know they no longer served it. The manager offered to comp our food but it's not a big deal. The guy at the bar could be a little more friendly though, he didn't seem like he enjoyed working there.

Chin Chin has redeemed itself in my book.  After a disappointing visit a few months ago, we gave it another chance and were treated to a tasty dinner and great service.  Rodrigo was a very attentive and friendly waiter. The Chinese Chicken Salad (which has kept me coming back to various Chin Chin locations over the years) was as great as it always has been. My husband enjoyed the Dim Sum and a bowl of Sushi rice. I highly recommend giving Chin Chin a try if you are in the mood for Chinese food and a fun atmosphere.

It was not the experience I thought it would be when we first arrived. I haven't been so disappointed in a very long time. The service was good and friendly but I think it was to hide the fact that you were going pay way too much for nasty food. I had the  some kinda Pho seafood soup which I normally am nuts for but it was FOWL must of been fish frozen medly from a old grocery store! My hubby had sushi and I had a piece and it was good except the very fishy seaweed wrap. We are really into fresh yummy seafood and sushi and that by far was YUCK.
   Then the bill came holy S&%$!!!! $75 for two barely meals WTF! OK its Vegas... I get it but Really we just took it! It will never happen again here or ever!!! Ruined the magic of our evening and Vegas experience for that evening! Thanks CHIN Nasty Chin!

Probably one of the best meals we had this trip.
We were staying here at New York New York, and
were on our way to breakfast, when we passed by here. 

They had a breakfast buffet going on, and the friendly hostess suggested we go take a look. We did, and immediately decided to check it out.

The buffet was way nicer then any buffet we had on this trip. Everything was presented very tasteful and upscale. Very fresh, and nicely presented. 

They have over 50 items including - red velvet pancakes, lychee fruit, sushi, French toast ect. A combination of both traditional brunch items and Asian food. If you come just as breakfast turns to lunch, you can experience both. You can also order a la carte off the menu if you prefer. 

We liked it so much, that we ate here three times during our stay at NyNy. The service always was stellar ! Very friendly, courteous servers and cheery upbeat hostesses. 

And if you check in on Yelp, it was buy one get one free lunch buffet ! It was an amazing deal. 

Highly recommend! 
Enjoy !

I like Chin Chin. It's always been by the elevator at New York, NY... I love that I can wake up and eat close by. I usually show up to have the end of the breakfast and then it goes into lunch, so you get the best of both worlds. They have great drinks and good service. There are usually people handing out coupons too. For the 3 of us, plus 2 alcoholic drinks, 2 regular drinks... it was around $100 but was worth it.

The food was so delicious! The portions are huge too. My dad and I could have shared an entree instead of getting two separate ones. I am upset that New York New York doesn't have fridges in the rooms so I can't take all my leftovers for later. Oscar was our server and his service was phenomenal! I'm glad I am from LA so I can go to the other locations back home.

I sat at the bar during for a late lunch and told the sushi chef to make me "something spicy." He started to respond when the the bartender/waiter totally interrupted him and told him what to make, to which the sushi chef replied "I got this." Then, in a completely rude tone (all in front of me, mind you) this waiter snaps at the chef "Do you want to take the whole bar then, Andrew?" If I am ordering off-the-menu sushi, I want to talk to the shushi chef. It was very rude and the waiter (The name on my receipt was Erin, but I am not sure that was the waiter's name) kept being a smart-ass to the shushi chef the whole time I was there, even making me wait for my check so he could ask the shushi chef if I was ready for it. So immature!

That being said, the roll the chef made for me was pretty fantastic, he would have gotten five stars easily. The fish was fresh and there was just the right amount of spice. The presentation was also pretty with curls of celery and carrots decorating the plate. The prices were on par with LA/Orange County sushi prices.
After making this place my first stop in Vegas every year for 10 years this will be my last. Service and good was way off tonight. I could get better at a Panda Express
The sushi wasn't amazing but the waiter Pedro was so nice. I wasn't impressed by the food at all didn't like the flavors in the sushi ordered as well got soup wasn't that great.

My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo next door to New New York and were looking for breakfast buffets for a big meal to hold us the rest of the day till dinner time.  The Monte Carlo breakfast buffet was OK but we found Chin Chin when we decided to try a different place, and Boy, are we glad we did!  The food was fantastic and the servers were top rate and super friendly. 

You can get a custom made huge omelet with just about anything you can think of inside if you want.  My favorite was the Meat Lovers omelet with juicy tender steak, bacon, sausage and ham inside.  I also asked them to put cheddar cheese inside and it was fantastic!
They have everything else including regular french toast, french toast stuffed with cream cheese, pancakes, real sliced ham roast, great crispy has browns and tons of sweet breakfast type deserts.

We loved it so much we ate breakfast there for three mornings straight!  For about $22 a person you can't beat it.  Much better than a hotel buffet where the food has been sitting for so long, they made everything new as the food got low, so everything was super fresh!

We will be back there the next time we are in Vegas for sure!

Decided to try this spot out with a friend. We both got half order of chicken fried rice a half order of Chinese chicken salad and half order bbq pork. Rice was delicious along with the salad but the bbq pork was gross it had lots of fat on it. I would avoid this item ... Our server was good when he was around he took a bit of time to bring water. The manager came over and removed the bbq pork from our check. She was very friendly and had a nice smile. You kinda felt like she was your friend once you left this place. Great job manger person. Over all the place is clean and has a cool vibe.
Oscar was great and the entire staff worked as a team. Great food had the wot wonton soup and the crab with asparagus fried rice, both were excellent.

So we visit this location during our stay and the service was pretty good but save your money because the food was subpar and waaayy over priced! Many other choices to select within New York New York and on the strip!
Pedro was a great server. Very polite  definitely would ask for Pedro on the next trip. The food was amazing. All-around a great experience.

The service and food deliver was quick. We ordered the fried rice,  rainbow roll and walnut shrimp.  The best dish was the rainbow roll,  very fresh fish.  The fried rice was a little too salty for our liking it could be the soy sauce they use,  kikkoman (I'm used to Aloha shoyu). The walnut shrimp had way too much sauce on it,  if there was less sauce it would have been so much better. I doubt we will be eating here again.  The waiter never cane back after delivering our order to see how we we're doing..... That's not good.
Place was not good. Food taste bland and it is way over priced for what you get. Orange chicken was nasty and so was the fried rice. Won't be coming back here.

Food was great we ate here twice Sunday and Tuesday Pedro our server was really nice he takes pride on his  job we really enjoy Vegas and we love New York casino but we really eanjoy this restaurant 
Great job Pedro

We were a party of three ladies that were out celebrating my friend Suzy's 60th birthday.  We called and spoke to Tres (actually, we called 3x's) to make a reservation and ask questions.  Tres was so welcoming and helpful to us and came over to introduce himself when we got there!  What a great manager you have!!

We all had a truly fabulous meal and our server Shanna was beyond the best!

I would highly recommend this fine establishment to anyone looking for great food and the best service ever!!

When I think of Vegas, I think of good dining. This place does not belong there. The atmosphere felt like a cafeteria/food court. The staff was a joke. No one told us we had to pay gratuity on a group of 6. In the end our server had added his tip for lousy service, had I not complained, he would have gotten away with over $60 for a job NOT well done. 
A few hours later, as all of us made our way through the night, we all fell ill. We ended the night by going back to our rooms, sick. I am not saying that Chin Chin was the cause, however it was the only thing we had in common. 
Dine or Dash? Dash... Just the thought of dining, makes me ill.

AMAZING! I came in for my birthday and was a bit reluctant at first but WOW I am so glad we came in. Food was great, customer service was excellent. Our server, Dexter, was very attentive and knew the menu and had great suggestions. Will definitely come again and refer to friends and family.
Very friendly staff (Maegan). Food was pretty good. We tried eggs Benedict with crab cake, vegetarian eggs Benedict & salmon eggs Benedict. Will definitely recommend.

First time having the breakfast buffet and was extremely pleased!! Great food, excellent service and priced well!!! Very much suggested for everyone to try at least once! Definitely eating here again!
Its a decent asian buffet style at NYNY hotel, staff are very attentive, friendly as well as their manager. Will come back and try their buffer breakfast.

This place has a nice ambiance. My husband I had the buffet, and boy was it filling! I do wish they had more sushi options in the buffet, and especially the menu. Oddly enough, out of the sushi they did have available, the California Roll was the best one. Prices are a bit high for the quality, but when one is in Las Vegas it's expected that you'll be spending money anywhere you go. The staff is really nice, and are very attentive when it comes to taking empty plates and rubbish off to make space.

Very DISAPPOINTED! Went with my wife a two kids. Lettuce wraps were delicious. After that all down hill. Orange chicken was good. Noodles, fried rice and Mongolian beef was cold. Not warm. COLD! The server was working multiple stations and could not provide adequate service. This was a Wednesday night with no crowd. Manager came by and after I expressed my disappointment she took $7.00 fried rice off the check and offered a free desert. Check came $106.00 but no desert. So exasperate we left and did not even wait for my daughters free ice cream. Only reason I gave one star is they can't go any lower. Lost my business for a lifetime. Not one aspect of our visit was enough to ever go back. If your in Vegas there are many other Chinese restaurants that have to be better in every aspect. Not only thumbs down but a whole hand, arm and entire body DOWN.

I ate here the other night with three dining companions.  We decided on this place after deciding to meet up at New York New York.

My dining companions split both the edamame and star wontons for appetizers.  Since I had eaten recently, I personally did not partake in either of them but my friends raved about both appetizers.  For my entree I decided upon the Mongolian beef.  Having ordered it the waiter informed me that I would not get rice with it and would I like to order a side of it. I politely declined. My Mongolian beef consisted of steak and chives in a sauce with crispy noodles, cucumber and carrots on the side.  The cut of meat was a little better than I was used to in such dishes and the sauce was good.  However I found the dish to be weird, especially the cucumber pieces.  The only other thing of note is that my friends ordered three sushi rolls.  They were disappointed with the size of them but raved about the flavors.

The bottom line for me is that I would probably not eat here again.  The food was just ok and I feel like better food could be found for the price.

Celebrated Valentine's day lunch here. Food was delicious and the establishment wasn't really busy for a Saturday lunch which was surprising. My husband and I ordered sushi, the Red Dragon and the Lucky Seven along with a side dish of Sweet and Sour Shrimp. We also ordered Mochi Ice Cream which they decorated very cute in celebration of Valentine's day.

The only complaint was that we got our appetizer after our meal which was the Assorted Pleasures.

Great tasting food! The thing that put this to 5 stars is definitely the awesome service. Hostess was pleasant and very friendly. Our waiter Oscar M did everything to make sure our visit was the best possible! Thank you very much!

I was at this restaurant while on my birthday weekend with my boyfriend. We ate here on 6/21/15. The place was mostly empty with very slow service. The chocolate cake was good, but the sushi tasted like it was prepared in the morning and had been sitting out all day. Not fresh at all. The spicy tuna was so over the top spicy, we sent it back.

The reason for my review now though is the most frustrating of all: my credit card was just charged on 7/9/15. Two and a half weeks later! I was about to call my bank for fraud when I realized what the charge was. I've never had a charge take that long to show up on my card! Just seems so ridiculous to wait that long and my statement says it was authorized 7/8/15. Not sure what is going on here, but I would avoid it due to old sushi, slow service, and now, apparently, lack of processing cards in a timely fashion!
i give this place 4 stars cause i eat alot of sushi and i live in seattle. but it prob is a 5 star sushi in vegas. the fried rice is real good as well.

What a great find! We split a rainbow roll of sushi, then split the Singapore noodles. The curry was perfect & there was just the right amount of heat. We were seated quickly, had a great waitress & overall awesome visit. Plan to visit here again next time we travel to Las Vegas.

Every casino on the strip has a chinese/noodle place of varying quality, Chin Chin at the New York New York is actually one of the better ones in my opinion. My wife and I went here after a concert at T Mobile arena on a Saturday night and managed to get in before it got packed. We shared an appetizer plate with some really good standard Chinese items and then split a plate of the beef low mein. The noodles were really good and so was the beef, would definitely order it again.  Also cool atmosphere inside and decent wait staff, you could certainly do worse at some of the other Asian places on the strip. Prices for food weren't awful but in typical strip fashion the drinks were way overpriced.

Ate here 2 days in a row for breakfast.   The buffet was great,  plenty of selection.  The French Toast was delicious and eggs Benedict 3 ways. .what's not to like about that.   Would've been the same price as eating off the menu next door and I'm sure it's the same food.  Very clean and well kept.  The service was excellent.

Prima plek voor een snelle, voedzame maaltijd in NYNY. Geen romantische spot, luidruchtig, wisselende service. Veelal vluchtig en niet echt geïnteresseerd. 

Wij hadden een appetizer platter. Fors qua omvang, allemaal met kip en redelijk van smaak. Beetje flauw. Frituur smaak overheerste. 

Lief had een eend op rode curry en ik een noodle gerecht met kip. Wat opviel waren de grote porties bijtgare groenten die bij beide gerechten zat. Dikke plus. Eend zag er droog en onappetijtelijk uit. Grijs. Maar was onverwacht smaakvol en zacht. Curry was goed op smaak. Noodles waren prima. Kip was wat klein en ver te zoeken. Zeker gelet op de grote brokken groenten, maar voor mij geen probleem. 

Vanwege de ambiance (gebrek er aan), de toch nog redelijke stevige prijs en de volstrekt ongeïnteresseerd service 3 sterren. Terwijl er oo zich voor hen meer in zit op basis van het eten.
This place is awesome, the food is very fresh and good compare to what you pay for! It worth the try and the serves rock ! Andres did an amazing job to take care of our loud family
Excellent buffet breakfast, great selection of hot  and cold and wonderful array of fresh fruits served by a delightful waiter by the name of alex

I was in here for dinner while on vacation.  Having stayed at NY NY at least two times a year for the last 15 years, I know the restaurant well.  For a Friday night, I was amazed how empty this place was.  I agree with many of the posts here that Chin Chin has "lost its way" over the years. The menu is insanely large.  I had the crab cakes as an appetizer and had a sweet and sour chicken along with a large plate of fried rice.  My guest had a chopped chicken salad.  While the food was O.K., it just wasn't worth the final tab (including two cocktails) that was over $78.00.  For that kind of price there are simply better options while in Vegas.

Probably the best General Sao's chicken ever, would definitely return.  Next time I am trying the Mongolian beef, that looked great too.  Sitting at the bar watching make sushi was great, I gotta try that too!  Very friendly staff, very attentive.

Experienced both the breakfast and lunch buffet. Breakfast was good but the lunch was even better. Took advantage of the Yelp offer for 1 free lunch buffet. Although it's a smaller size buffet than most in Vegas, the food is all delicious and fresh. A few basic types of sushi rolls and Chinese noodles at lunch and then a few types of eggs benedict and some fresh fruits and other things to choose from including free mimosas!

Excellent service, average food. Restaurant prices are very high on the Strip. This Chinese restaurant in New York New York, has more reasonable prices. We had dinner there twice. Nothing was outstanding but nothing was subpar. I would have driven to Chinatown but driving in and out of the Strip is onerous.

Great customer service. Our 3 year old ate for free from the buffet. Manager Alex was very helpful and professional. Great food every time we come here. It's a must every Vegas trip. Great tradition!!!!!!
Great service thank you Angel for the great experience.  Food as just as good as it is in Beverly Hills

We had the lunch buffet after a long night in Vegas it was a great deal! Jordan was our server he was super chill and made our experience even better! Overall great service for a great price, they even let u stick around for the lunch buffet! Will definitely come back when we are in Las Vegas again :)

We just went there because some people in our group didn't want to pay $55 for a steak in the nearby steak place. But we regretted every penny we paid for this Chinese joint. Soup was cold. The skin on the "braised" duck was almost alive and everything else was probably even worse than Panda Express. I can't believe they are surviving in a city that there are so many great places to eat.

Chin Chin was so much better than expected.  A man on a flight to Vegas over heard us talking about places to eat and recommended Chin Chin. Coming from a person who lives in Vegas you know it's got to be good.  The staff was very attentive. Food better than Panda Express!

Spent this weekend in good ol' Vegas. My friend and I wanted to stop in and get our sushi fix. I have never been to this restaurant and was already expecting it to be on the pricey side since it's Vegas. Everything is overpriced. Anyways, they had a deal going on buy 2 sushi rolls, get the 3rd free. We figured that would be good so we ordered a dragon roll, rainbow roll and a lucky seven roll along with a dim sum appetizer called the assorted pleasures dish.

The appetizer came with 2 chicken pot stickers, 2 fried chicken wontons, 2 gift wrapped chicken pieces (chicken wrapped in foil w/cilantro) and a spring roll cut in half. The waitress brought out some dipping sauces. One of them was an apricot sauce that was similar to duck sauce which tasted amazing. I dunked the spring roll and pot sticker in that. The chicken pot stickers and wontons were both pink on the inside. I don't think the pot stickers were thoroughly cooked.

When our sushi came, all 3 rolls were on one plate. That only meant one thing: the rolls were tiny. And they were itty bitty. Don't get me wrong, the sushi was delicious but these rolls are priced out between $12-18 dollars. They were almost the size of a quarter. I hate to sound like a sushi snob, but I've had bigger rolls for less than $15 and of awesome quality. Well, what do you expect? It IS Vegas after all.

I'd say nay to the sushi next time and would probably try some of their other dishes.
The service was fine, the staff were pleasant, but the food was not. Came here for the lunch buffet, the food was below average and not worth $22/person for lunch at all.

Went with a big group. Our service was very good. I had the vegetable pot stickers and veggie lettuce wraps. Both were better than I expected. The lettuce wraps came with this fantastic fried tofu with so much flavor I thought I was eating teriyaki chicken. Overall this place is pretty casual, a combination of all types of "american" asian food from Chinese to sushi. Overall, the food was not very authentic but, for the price, pretty good.

I just stopped by for a couple drinks before a show and the bartender Vanessa was very welcoming & recommended a specialty drink that was delicious! I was impressed with her skill and now it's one of my favorite hidden gems

The wife and I had about an hour to kill before Zumanity. We were hungry, and didn't want to eat pizza or a sandwich. We saw Chin Chin and the sushi menu. Before we took the time to look at the menu, we sat down and then realized they didn't have any veggie only rolls on the menu. Instead of moving along, we decided to go with entrées instead. 

I had the veggie lo mein, my wife had the peanut noodle dish. Both dishes were very fresh, not heavy on the sauce, and the noodles were the freshest I've ever had at any Chinese place. The veggies in the lo mein were perfect. Not overcooked, not undercooked. I could have just had broccoli in it. The peanut dish was "spicy" and had a great sweet tangy flavor. The food is very Americanized, so don't expect authentic...buts its on the Strip, what can you expect. 

Our dishes were $14 and $13 respectively. The portion size of each would have been good for us to split. This would have been nice to know, and will be helpful if we go back. Since we were seeing a show after dinner, we didn't want to get a doggy bag. 

My wife also had two cocktails - malibu and pineapple. They were $8 each. I had a Tsingtao bomber which was $8 which was actually not a bad deal. 

The service was really good, and both the bartenders were very friendly. We had a nice chat with both of them. 

As we don't eat on the Strip often, it is good to know we can get a semi reasonable and delicious meal.

Are we really putting soy beans on our soy beans when we dip our edamame in soy sauce?  Our waitress seemed to have answers to all of our questions, including how soy sauce is made.  Her friendly attitude, professionalism, knowledge and service bumped up this 3 star food review to a 4 star overall review.  The extra fortune cookie for my daughter certainly helped!  

I would much rather eat somewhere with 3 star food and 4 star service than the reverse.

The happy hour for lunch is a good bet if you are on a budget, with an extra hand roll if you buy two.

Really sub-par Asian food, the dumplings had a bad taste like canned beef stew, I sent back my "signature" Chinese chicken salad which was very bland, with lots of iceberg lettuce and over cooked chicken. My husband ordered a vegetable dish, which was super salty and not tasty at all. I am half Chinese, and have eaten lots of Chinese and various Asian cuisines in my day, and this was NOT GOOD. Service was ok, my friend said that the wonton soup was good. My advice: STAY AWAY! There are many other better choices in Vegas.

We enjoyed coming here right after a Lakers game to eat. We ordered the shumai, the wonton stars, chow mein and the Mongolian beef. It was all very good. The two sauces that came with the shumai was a very spicy mustard and a chili paste sauce that we weren't the biggest fans of but you really didn't need the sauce anyways

I've been here two different times and both visits were great. Good service and great food. The food took a little bit long but Chris, our server made sure we are taken care of. He's great and we had a great time. We had the Chicken and Rib with rice combo. I forgot whats it's called but it was very delicious. We also had the Yang chow rice, hot and sour soup and the Vietnamese spring vegetables. 

Whenever I'm in the area, I'm sure to put Chin chin on my places to eat.

Great service great people great food. I always come here for the same meal. Bbq pork, Chinese chicken salad, zechuan dumplings, & shrimp fried rice. If your looking for good Chinese food this is the #1 place to come. It's alil funny how they keep changing the restaurant inside.

I was feeling hungry and it was pretty late, but Chin Chin was still open. The hostess was super sweet and seated us right away. Our waiter was great. He was genuine and very attentive. I got the bok choy and black mushrooms. It was seasoned well, however the mushrooms were a little tough. The SO got the Chinese chicken salad which was delicious. The dressing has a lot of ginger in it, so if you're not a ginger person you may want to choose something else. They have so much other yummy options I want to try.

Chin Chin is an excellent Chinese restaurant with large shareable portions and always excellent service.  Our waiter this time was Pedro and he was outstanding!  He offered suggestions without being pushy and he was incredibly accommodating. We never had to ask for something twice.  The food was also excellent!

We have been to this restaurant twice and both times was great. Sushi is wonderful, just stay away from the saki. It is awful. 

Service is great but is a but pricey, but you are in Vegas.

Chin Chin was a place when you do not want to go to another vegas buffet. 
What we hoped for is authentic Chinese/Sushi bar, but what we got is another Americanized Chinese place.
We ordered quite a few items from here, because we went in a big group. And the big group is mix of vegetarians and non-vegetarians and that caused the mix up with the order.
Every item was just OK, nothing stood out other than few. 
Pork belly inside bun was great, Sliced BBG pork was great too, tofu chow Mein was decent. Other than that, nothing is impressive. One Item which I will order again, "if I go there again" is  KUNG PAO THREE TREASURES, Yumm. 

Location is very convenient, its right in NY/NY and close to the strip entrance. 

Downz:
No restroom within the restaurant
Not authentic Chinese, its American Chinese

The food was good and the manager Ester was very nice. We ordered Mongolian beef, chicken fried rice and Szechuan green beans. The Mongolia was very good and the fried rice was good but slightly to greasy and the green beans were good as well. We also ordered the chicken pot stickers which were ok but the apricot sauce made it delicious!

After looking up all the other, more unique, Chinese food restaurant reviews in Vegas, we decided to go to Chin Chin.  I didn't feel like paying 3 times as much for food that got worse reviews than this chain.  I'd been to the one here in Southern California and knew we'd have a good meal.

And we did!  The reservation we made was necessary on a Saturday night, but I think we called an hour before hand.  We both got drinks off their signature list.  They were strong, like we like em'.  I got the orange soda one and loved it!  They also have a full bar, naturally, Vegas...as well as a pretty good Sake list.  

The hot and sour soup was a perfect starter.  I hadn't had it since my favorite, family owned, place down the street from me closed, probably because of their C rating, but that didn't stop me...they had a B when I started going there.  Anywho...it was good if not better than the homemade stuff they made.

Our dishes came out fast, which normally isn't a problem, but we were trying to kill time.  Again, it's a Chinese food place, food usually doesn't take that long to cook.  Both our dishes were delicious.  I got the 3 meat kung pao.  It wasn't as spicy as I normally like it but the chicken, beef, and shrimp mix was excellent.  

My girlfriend got the orange chicken and I was kind of upset I didn't either. I'm a sucker for it, and they did an excellent job.  Perfect amount of crispy, it's breaded, but not soggy.  Gah! I hate soggy Chinese food.  The peppers were fresh and tasty as well.

Vegas has many options for food, almost too many, but if your craving consistent quality Chinese at a good price, you can't beat Chin Chin.  They also have a good selection of Japanese dishes along with Sushi and Noodles.  So you've got options.

The food here is not exactly authentic and quality. But I too think the Asian hostess (manager?) with the long highlighted is really hot! Her being there, makes the food tastes like a five-star restaurant.

We were smashed.  So, take this with a grain of salt.  The food was very very good.  Service was very very good.   I don't know how much the alcohol played into all of this.   I know we were obnoxious, we showed up before they closed, we were loud and demanding.

But the food was very good.   I'd go back next time I'm in Vegas - sober - and see if this review still holds true

The restaurant is completely renovated. I've been to all of their locations and this one is such a beaut! Upon entrance the lovely hostess greeted me with a smile and with no hesitation offered me to take a look at the menu. The selection was perfect and they work with everyone's diets! I'm a pescatarian so often it's very difficult for me to find a place that can easily modify and accommodate something for me.

Their sushi menu was long, however not too overwhelming. When I saw that and their wine and sake selection, I was IN! The hostess walked me to my table. And you know how most hosts try to walk way in front of you and you almost have to sprint? They were actually mindful of me and walked beside me. I felt like they made an excellent first impression and my service began memorable. She even pulled out my seat. (Whaaaat) lol I know! 

The server was top notch! His name was Pedro and he was on top of it. Very very energetic! My glass was never halfway empty, my table was manicured the entire time, and he sold me on desserts! I am on a diet! 

The manager named Magy came by to visit my table. I typically don't like to be interrupted while I'm eating, but her approach was very friendly and she actually took the time to see what I thought about my food. I wanted to go to some nice wine bars and she pointed me towards some great wine spots.

The last time I was there I ordered Szechuan string beans, ordered it spicy and wowwww was it delicious. I ordered the Ma Po Tofu and the sauce was incredible. I tasted some black bean and authentic Chinese seasoning in it. It had a little spice to it just the way I like it and ordered a side of brown rice. Yes.. brown rice for those healthy people out there!

All in all, this place will give you a great experience upon entry, to food delivery, quality of food, and memorable service. 

*check out the tips, they have a quality breakfast buffet, a FULL bar, brown rice, make riceless sushi (upon request), and DO NOT have MSG! :)*

Best Chinese food and service I have ever had.  The staff made us feel special and were spot on with their service.  The food was amazing.  We shared the chicken fried rice, peppered steak and dumplings.  Highly recommend these dishes and sharing.  They give you large portions.

I've been to Chin Chin a couple of times and I've yet to be disappointed. The drinks are always strong, the wine is never old.

This time we ordered the Wonton Soup and Anthony's Special Noodles. The wonton soup broth was amazing, light and complex I could taste a lot of white pepper which was great. The wontons were flavorful and tender. Anthony's Noodles were also very delicious, the flavor was lightly spicy and heavy with the taste of cilantro. 

Far from traditional, but that's not what you're here for (traditional can be found on Spring Mountain, the chinatown plaza). Portions are huge, the grease is great for building up the required barrier in your stomach required for heavy drinking! Will definitely be back for more when we're back in town in November.

We accidentally walked into this place recently because we were mildly intoxicated and hungry.  In short this place is trying to be upscale but it should be noted that it is affordable and they serve you huge portions thus the prior reviewers reference to PFChang's.  

We ordered two entrees, a rice dish, and an appetizer but really we should have only ordered the two entrees since we only finished about 1/4 of all the food we had.  We were sad the food was going to waste because normally we would've love to take a doggie bag home but were starting our night out and did'nt want to lug our food all the way back to our room at Planet Hollywood.

Anyways, the server was great and was'nt too hovering or distant.  All in all we had a wonderful dinner here but we were sad to see 3/4 of the food at the table since were stuffed !

Chin chin did not have many options for the buffet. They had two bars of food. The salty fried rice and chow mein only had chicken in it & they were found on both bars. Not really asian food. Chicken strips, mac n cheese, french fries, and an "asian" salad that is shredded lettuce + chips is authentic? 

They offered sushi but each of the 2-3 trays had very few pieces left to pick from. I'd say the items that were good were the desserts. The cut fruits were fresh and ripe. 

The spring rolls had been sitting out for a while because the spring roll wrapping was hardened when my mom ate it. 

Everyone was very polite and welcoming but the service was kinda slow. Our waitress disappeared for a while and we were waiting for our check. 

It was about $24 per person for lunch and our bill for 3 people + tax + tip came out to be $87. 

They also have a regular menu that you can order from but i don't think we'd be back to try it.

My visit here was okay, if you ask me if I would go back I think I would but I'm sure there's better Chinese/sushi places in Vegas. The food was very good actually, we didn't do the buffet since it was almost over so we did the a la carte menu, I was with 5 other people. The workers are very kind, but they said the portions were large but they were not enough, especially for the price. But overall, I was satisfied! If you ever visit, I loved the salmon crunch roll:)

Went here for dinner and drinks one night while on vacation ... amazing !!!  I am a super picky eater and i don't have a single complaint.   Sat at the bar and the bartender Dana is the best.  Makes great drinks (and recommends good food) ... she has a great personality ... outstanding customer service all around !!!  I wish there were more people in the service industry like this !!!

I actually have to say that we liked it so much that we went back for a second meal before we left to come home because there isn't a Chin Chin in Seattle !!!

Second time the charm, had dinner here last night, and what a difference.  First, the waitstaff Oscar and Craig were friendly and professional and made the dining experience even better. The restaurant itself has an extremely friendly vibe, and everyone goes out of their way making sure you are satisfied.  The meal itself from appetizer to desert was delicious and well presented.  The portions are also plentiful. I am very happy that I gave Chin Chin a second chance!  As a Las Vegas local, I would be happy to bring out of town guests here for dinner.

In terms of quality of food I have better.   Not saying it bad but for the price they charge the food should've been better.  But then again this is Las Vegas.  If you are going there for a fast bit to eat and with a group then you're good to go.   If you are doing the solo thing or a couple thing I would look for another spot.  I'm sure your money will buy you much more someplace else.
The service was great. The food was absolutely wonderful. I got the dumplings with cilantro sauce and we also had the Alaskan roll.

I guess this is "Chinatown" for "New York".  We found this place out of hunger and lazyness and decided to give it a shot.  This is the first Chinese restaurant I've been to that also has a Sushi bar.  I guess Asian cusine is all getting globalized now a days.  

We were lucky to get a great server and their food was pretty good.  Defenitely not authentic enough for me but very tasty for American/Asian food.  Among the dishes we ordered the curry rice was the best.  The seafood won ton soup was pretty good too and the sushi tasted just like any sushi place.  

Funny name.... Chin Chin

Classy. Like, notably even more so than I thought it would be. The staff there was so friendly. They had a hostess from Hawaii that had great conversation etiquette and was very entertaining, the servers were extremely hospitable, and the food was delicious. Between the soup and that lemon chicken I had to leave with leftovers because it was soooo filling. 

I would say the Lemon Chicken took the win. It was placed on a bed of cabbage (which I'm not personally a fan of, but I get the hype). The lemon sauce that came with it was to die for. I literally DRENCHED my chicken in it after a test taste. No regrets. 

They were really up front that the sides are a la carte which I appreciated, but I do with it AT LEAST came with rice. I get buying alternative sides, but rice is a staple. It should be included in a $17 plate of glorified lettuce and a single breaded chicken breast. I'm just saying. 

Other than that small little detail, perfect experience, highly recommend.
The waiters are all very nice and welcoming; the place is lovely. Unfortunately the Chinese food (tonight?) is overcooked and not good at all. Pity!

I would not recommend eating here. There are many other better choices for Asian food close by, such as in the MGM where we were staying.  But this place looked good, so we tried it.  First of all, we ordered some hot tea only to be served in dirty glasses.  Our waiter did not seem to care (he seemed to really not care about his job in general).   We placed our order, and then a few minutes later he came back to tell us they do not have any Pad Thai.  He asked us if we wanted something else instead, but how would we know if we no longer had menus in front of us?
SO,  we asked to see menus again.  He totally forgot and we had to remind him twice to bring us menus.  (We did order one sushi roll which was pretty decent).  We picked a seafood noodle dish which was EXTREMELY spicy to our surprise.  Like the hot pepper shaker just totally spilled out all over the noodles.  
Try to avoid this place at NY NY if possible. There are much better Asian options elsewhere.

Let me preface this review by saying I hate to leave this review bc the service was exceptional, Jordan, our server and the manager on duty ( 3/29 1:38 p) were both fantastic :) Went in with the Yelp check in offer of BOGO lunch buffet, after tax we ended up paying about $11 pp. Had I paid full price, I would have been fairly upset as the choices were very limited and not that tasty to boot. Again, I'm sorry CC staff, you guys are awesome, but I'd hate to steer a fellow Yelper wrong and out of his/her hard earned money. The sole redeeming item was the cheesecake crust. Pretty decent variety of desserts overall. I can't speak for the menu items, this is strictly a review of The lunch buffet, which I'd give a solid 1 star to, considering the price, but Jordan & her mgr brought it up two stars .Thank you both for redeeming what would have otherwise been a 1 star experience!

I'm a huge fan of Chin Chin for almost 30 years. I support every location...Brentwood, Studio City, Beverly Hills, Sunset Strip, and this one in Vegas. I miss the one in Marina del Rey so much, as it was an enormous favorite of my Mom's.

Vegas is great and the pot stickers are double the size of the ones at the LA locations. I was a little surprised at the quality of the shimp they used in the Kung Pao dish, as they were much smaller in size than I have ever had at the LA locations. Food tasted great though and the service was excellent.

No, this isn't the highest end of Asian cuisine, but somehow, hubby and I always find ourselves here for a quick bite midst gambling.

The bar area is perfect for something quick as well as a GREAT people watching post... because let's admit it - Vegas has a huge cast of crazy characters! The menu is basically "Asian" with offerings from a few countries. We went for a couple pieces of hamachi, a spicy tuna roll and then the assorted satay. 

The bar also seconds as a sushi bar and I love to watch the chefs do their thing. The bartenders are friendly. It's a nice vibe. No pretense here! 

I'd give their sushi a solid 8/10. As for the satay - it comes with two each of beef, chicken and shrimp with assorted sauces, I'd give a 6.5/10. I think the flavors could have been a little more "pow". 

Overall, I'd recommend as a quick bite or break from the casino floor. I've never eaten in the actual restaurant but the bar has the same menu. Since we've been here quite a few times before and never been disappointed, I know we'll be back!

My husband and I ate here after a show and really enjoyed our meal. I haven't had the buffet as the pictures show, but we really enjoyed the menu.
