There were lots of options for both meat lovers and vegetarians alike. The cocktail list was also amazing and we enjoyed trying a few new things. As Joanna K. said, the ginger martini was amazing! 

As for the food itself, the prices were very reasonable ($10-15) and the portions were plenty big. I would certainly recommend to anyone wanting Chinese food that isn't greasy and won't kill your wallet!
Andrea our hostess was amazing.   She convinced us to come in and the food was amazing and the service was great.   She deserves a raise!!!

Nice place for a moderately priced meal.  Shrimp spring rolls and peanut sauce were really good.  Sushi rolls are good.   They care a lot about guest perception and check on your satisfaction several times.

Update: chin chin gets another star for a quick response to my review.   They care!

We were welcomed by our cute waitress Beca! She's very dynamic and has a great smile.. The food is good. We love sushis so we mostly order that.. Chef Soong  from the sushi bar is the best.. very professional and great to talk to.. she knows her stuff and does it with her love of making food for others..
Highly recommend this place!!

Solid food, excellent service and decor doable  :) Would I come back here if I was in Vegas again...probably......ok maybe not, the food is solid but it's also pretty forgettable. However, I will give them 5 stars for service. The servers there were incredibly accommodating and made sure to take extra care of the people in our group who had certain food allergies. 

We ordered the sampler appetizer platter, which had some good things like the egg rolls, but the other chicken dishes and dumplings were pretty boring...not bad...but not exciting either. The entrees of garlic eggplant and sweet crispy chicken...again good...buuuuttttt not "oooo I want to come back and eat more of this" good. 

All in all, solid Chinese food, service excellent and atmosphere like a PF Changs, BUT when you're in a city like Vegas and there are so many other food options to explore, I would give Chin Chin a miss. The food just isn't that special for you to miss out on all the other great culinary experiences the city has to offer :)

After 10 years of being loyal to this Las Vegas restaurant, I think I am breaking up with it. The hot and sour soup that I dream about wasn't "fresh" any more. It tasted like Prefab gelatinous boringness. The sweet and sour shrimp were so over battered and not stir fried with the vegetables. Came out super dry with cold veg and sauce on the side. So different than every other meal we have had. The new format is not working, and I won't be back.

Prices were decent, portions are HUGE. We got a soup and it was enough for 8 people. It came in a mixing bowl not a soup bowl. Sushi left much to be desired. I ordered the volcano roll and it just had way to much going on, too much sauce, too much cream cheese in the roll and too much junk piled on top. It was overwhelming. My boyfriend ordered the noodle dish with pork and it was very good probably my favorite thing at the table. Service was very friendly and funny but it was also hard to find him. Drinks constantly empty. Waited a long time to receive our ticket. Food came out uncoordinated, because half comes from the kitchen and the other half from the sushi area so by the time we got our rolls the other side of the table was done eating

Good sushi at a decent price. To clarify I'd have to say this is this best sushi I've had on the strip, at a very decent price. Service wasn't bad considering we came around lunch time. We ordered several rolls and some crab cakes. The crab cakes were different than i have had before but enjoyable. The sushi was far better than two other locations I have been to on the Las Vegas strip. All in all a good experience.

This restaurant is located right by the elevator to our room.  We stopped by here numerous times before heading up to our room for drinks only.  Here's what I remember....

In Vegas and needed a couple drinks to take back to the room to enjoy the hot tub.  12 oz Bud=$7.00
22 oz Sapparo=$9.00
Vodka soda=$11.00
"Strong"Vodka soda=$11.00

I didn't eat here but got drinks numerous times.  I strongly suggest using the word "strong" when ordering mixed drinks instead of using the word "double."  The breakfast buffet looked average, although we didn't try it.

Will I again?.. No because I won't be staying at New York New York again.  Tootles

Came here looking for a nice Chinese restaurant, and happened to choose this place in the sea of Chinese places on the Strip. Our first warning should have been that this Chinese restaurant carries Sushi....thinking it would still be good, but slightly un authentic, I took my family here.

i If you want unauthentic, overpriced, and cold chinese food, come to Chin Chin. I watched our entrees sit by the kitchen for about 15 minutes before finally being prepared and taken to us...they were needless to say, cold. Our bill was refunded, however the server insisted on having us pay for the drinks. The manager came over and let us leave...still being hungry we went to a fast food chinese place, better than this garbage at Chin Chin!

I truly feel bad writing all these bad reviews in Las Vegas, having only lived here for a month and a half, and I don't mean to be comparing my experiencing with restaurants from back home, but hey, Yelp is all about honesty. And as I start exploring Vegas, my new home more and more, I will discover new gems, and I promise I will find great new places to write great reviews about. Until then, there's Chin Chin. 
I love walking the strip, as I have many medical problems, and it's like physical therapy for me, but I hate paying "strip prices". My husband had already just had pizza, but having an allergy, we had to find a bite for me, and it being late, we had little choices. We walked up to Chin Chin, and the hostess with the mostest greeted us and struck up conversation. I explained that we moved here, and being that we were now locals, were were not looking to spend a whole lot, and were looking to avoid the tourist pricing. Well, she did some voodoo on us, and we found ourselves sitting down. Seeing that the restaurant was pretty established, having locations in Beverly Hills, Studio City, Bentwood, and West Hollywood, CA, I felt pretty comfortable with that. I looked over the menu, and couldn't find anything that was in the price-range of someone taking a stroll and wanting a bite- maybe she didn't get the point of the 5 minute conversation we had before she seated up. I went ahead and ordered the Spicy Seafood Noodles, and truly hoped for the best. While I waited, the party next to me seemed to be enjoying their food, but they were pretty pissed drunk, and ordered what I wanted to order, but went against my better judgement,and went with the servers recommendation. 
When the food arrived, I was shocked the my $18 meal was just splashed into it's bowl, as there were 4 pieces of veggies stuck to the upper part to the rim. I'm not picky...okay, yes I am. How hard is it to take pride in what you put out of your kitchen, because it looked like crap. Now onto the food. It was okay. It reminded me of the Chinese/Korean dish, you find in many authentic Chinese restaurants (I reviewed one restaurant that served it that made their own noodles and charged $7 less called Chef Ping) called Jjampong. Yes, they were not the same dishes. The dish I ordered was a spicy black bean sauce, while jjampong is a fragrant red sauce, but they are very similar in other ingredients. The dish by Chin Chin was one note, and salty, and by the end of the dish, I was craving something more, and a glass of water. I was left very unsatisfied, and while there were an ample enough seafood in the dish, there was not enough calamari, maybe 2 pieces, and they didn't seem very fresh. All and all, I will not recommend, and will NOT spend my $18 on a dish that I could potentially get for half the price in Chinatown for half the price with twice the flavor. I thought I would get something of decent quality from a place that is established off the strip. Plus like I said, it was late, and I didn't have many choices. One, and one last thing. I know it was late, but the place was not closed, but was coming close to closing time, but it was not excuse for the lacking service we received, that just added to the disappointment.
Food is terrible, service is slow! Soggy nudges, cold baked shrimp, chewy rubbery chicken.

Okay, so part of the one star rating is my own fault.  It was the first morning on my first trip to Vegas.  We were staying at NY NY and got off the elevators at 930am after a long night and saw "Chinese Buffet Brunch!"  Now, why on earth did I think Chinese buffet - for breakfast - would be a good idea?  I'll never know.  The place was packed though, so I followed the leader.

5 minutes after eating, I had to run back up to my hotel room and then  spend the next hour on the bed clutching my stomach.  Yeah.  And don't blame it on the booze the night before... I wasn't even hungover when I woke up.  Lesson learned.

Ugh. My wife and I had been here for diner in 2015 and it was actually really good. Decided to come back for lunch this trip. 

What a mistake!  Got talked into the lunch buffet. We should have checked it out first. Absolutely pitiful. Dishes had zero flavor and most were lukewarm at best. Selection was terrible. And most items were pretty close to empty the entire time. Keep in mind this was at noon!

Gave 2 stars due to fine service. Other than that stay away!!!

I came in with no expectations, and I ended up finding the food very good. Nice sized-portions as well.

We started with a large bowl of Hot and Sour soup, which was enough to feed four people. I found the taste above-average and very enjoyable.

We also had the pork steamed dumplings with sauce. This dish was pretty much like any steamed dumpling I've had (not bad). The garlic soy sauce was very good.

For my meal I had the peanut noodles without chicken. They were delicious! I've always like peanut flavors in Asian food, but this was the first dish I've tried that was centered around it. It's a simple-looking dish and the flavor just stands out. There was enough for me to save as leftovers.

I was impressed with the food here. I really didn't know what to expect at a Chinese-fusion restaurant on the strip, but it was delicious and I expect to go there again next time I'm in town.

I loathe you, Chin Chin. I loathe that you were the closest breakfast option to my hotel room on a work trip to Vegas. I loathe that I ate at the horrendous breakfast buffet for 4 days straight. 

I hate that it takes forever to get a check considering that everyone orders everything they can possibly order within 30 seconds of being seated. I've ordered coffee and your 16 dollar plates of dry eggs, fatty bbq pork and undercooked fried rice, what the hell else can you possibly charge me for? Just bring the check and get rid of the pretense that I'm somehow sitting down for a real meal in an actual restaurant. 

Oh yeah, and about the breakfast buffet fried rice? I'm onto you. Fried rice is traditionally made with cold day old rice that's had a chance to let the starch set up so it doesn't turn to mush when fried. You're trying to get around this by undercooking fresh rice, but it doesn't work. It just comes out a little crunchy and unpleasant in the center. I couldn't tell if the lump in my throat was barely edible fried rice, or tears welling up because I was forced to eat here again after working until 2am the previous night.

After trying the other breakfast options I ended up getting this bacon fried rice for 4 days. That says all I need to say about the other breakfast options. 

If, for whatever reason you end up here for breakfast just pile a bunch of scrambled eggs on your plate, cover liberally with ketchup and call it a meal. It's really the only sane way out.

Fortunately I expensed the eightygodddamnedollars I spent here or I'd be really pissed. Oh, and the fruit is sour.

Maybe it was a bad night. Maybe it's because as New Yorkers, we eat some of the best Chinese food in the U.S. 

First the positives. The manager on duty was very nice, empathetic and quite good at his job. Our server was also very thoughtful, professional and empathetic. The place is bustling, exciting and abuzz with activity. And by the looks of things, it's very popular.

For my family and me, we found the food was WAY TOO SALTY. That killed it for us. My wife ordered pot stickers that arrived hot - as they should, but were served with some sort of apricot dipping sauce served very very cold. That was a head scratcher. Back home, pot stickers are served with a soy-based sauce with ginger and green onions at room temperature.  I had vegetables in a curry sauce and my son had pork lo mein, all of which would have been delicious were it not for the high sodium content. 

The manager on duty took our concerns very seriously and took appropriate action. 

I do hope they take a look at their recipes and consider using considerably less salt. I'm sure they've got some talented folks working in the kitchen. Eliminating much of the salt used in the recipes and allowing the natural flavors of the ingredients to come through would be a great service to the skills their kitchen staff bring to the job. I'm sure Chin Chin's patrons would appreciate it too.

We had the lunch buffet on a Tuesday.  Our server, Oscar, was prompt and attentive.  The buffet was a good bargain for the money. Nothing too fancy, but it was all prepared well, tasty, and the presentation was tidy and neat. The desserts were fantastic and pretty.  Would recommend for a nice casual bite to eat.

I absolutely totally love this place they have the best dumplings you will ever have in your entire life I was with my girlfriend from Brooklyn and she ordered the spicy tuna roll with yellowtail and we got a whole bunch of different things
I remember ordering a more traditional Chinese dish but I will tell you their steamed dumplings are absolutely incredible my mouth is watering right now just thinking about them and we had a waiter who coincidentally was from North Bergen New Jersey which is my hometown it was completely freaking me out. 

If you are staying at New York New York this is a definite I also love the Chinchin in Los Angeles

Spent the weekend in Vegas (Yeah Baby!), and after taking in Zumanity, we went to eat at Chin Chin. What a really great little Chinese restaurant that is located inside the New York New York Hotel and Casio. Started off with Pot Stickers that were very good and continued with a bowl of Won Ton soup with a nice piece of pork in it. Main Entree' was Kung Pao Chicken. It had the right amount of bang to make it enjoyable. The service was so-so. It wasn't very busy for 9 p.m., so the waitress could have been a little more available, but overall, we really enjoyed it.

Great Price. Good Food.  Incredible Service.

Came in for breakfast buffet and left with lunch and a very happy heart.

The American breakfast selection was sufficient.  Made to order omelets with shrimp and crab was delicious. Coffee and juices included for $18.

But the best thing about this place is the synergy amongst the team members. We were serviced with endless smiles and happy attitudes from start to finish. A shout out to Oscar and Angel for an outstanding service.

Thank you, Chin Chin, for restoring my faith in good service.

I enjoyed the breakfast quite well. The veggie eggs with goat cheese was refreshing to find in a buffet. Fried rice breakfast style was different but tasty. I like that they also have plain yogurt instead of vanilla or strawberry but they have quite a variety of sinful yuminess too for the eater that is not so health conscious. Staff was pleasant. Smiled and checked on us periodically.

Great food and fast service!! I sat at the bar I wanted to grab a quick bite before i hit the slot machine again. The sushi was great, the fried rice not so good but wonton soup was awesome. It hit the spot. Overall great food and pricy:/

Nice clean place!

food is good and the only issue I had is that they serve more veggies than meat.
Not bad. Just a little bit pricey, like $25 ish for a Sushi roll. The Shumai and Asian signature salad were yummy and also came with a big portion.

Such a great place to have a drink and hang out at the bar with their staff . Sat at the bar and had a few rolls made by an awesome chef name Koong . She knows her stuff I tell you at . She ask what I like or don't like and just made some of the best tasting rolls I've ever had . Next time I come back and visit I sure will be back her sushi again and again. They really do take care of their guest . Also l the bartender name Victoria was such a sweet heart. She serves the best cocktails . 
Thank you chin chin for wonderful time !
The app sampler was good and the wanton soup was great . But the drinks are not cheap so watch it .

Had a urge for some good Sushi and friend of mine recommended this place.  CHIN CHIN is an asian fusion restaurant that has some really great food options that remind you of actually really good asian restaurants from my hometown Toronto. #WETHENORTH - back to the restaurnt its a well designed place with some great staff service thats very attentive to yours needs.  I went more with the sushi selection as they look really Yummy.  One item that really was tasty was the NEO roll it was sooo good it was like something put of the Matrix!!! Probably named after Keanu Reeves character lol. Good portions of food and bang for your buck meals cant go wrong.  Definitely will be coming for some eating repeats.  Definitely worth stopping by if youre looking for that asian style cuisine.  Keep up the good work

We had the lunch buffet which was delicious. They had a wide variety of Asian food including sushi! As well as a yummy dessert bar. The service was great and our server Jay was very friendly. I would definitely go back and recommend them highly!
The food was good and the service was excellent! Also the yelp deal is a real bargain! We paid $85 for 7 people AYCE buffet for lunch with the deal. Super nice staff and very accommodating!

Two and a half star American zed mostly Chinese restaurant in New York New York Hotel and Casino.

The good: affordable (mostly under $20 for entrees), edible (if you like a lot of soy sauce) for the most part

The bad: expensive appetizers and weak cocktails

Without the appetizer and my husband's drink, our tab for 2 satisfying meals and a pot of tea would have come to a little over $50 with tax and tips, which is pretty good for the Strip.

Would we go back? Maybe if we're in the vicinity and if we can't find more affordable dining options.

We did the buffet brunch. For what you get, it's really well priced in my opinion. 
I wasn't impressed with our waitress, we sat at the bar and she didn't offer to refill my coffee until we were finished eating and had me pass stuff over the sushi counter to her instead of coming around (the bar glass  is fairly high & the sushi chef was preparing food in front of me, so this wasn't convenient nor good service). We didn't get asked about the custom omelettes until after we ate the food from a trip through the buffet. About the time we were asked if we wanted drinks (like water & coffee). If that's typical of the bar service here, I'd recommend getting a table. 
If it hadn't been for the lackluster service, it would be a 4. 
A few items on the buffet seemed like they were under heaters there for too long (stuffed French toast & crab cake Benedict). The biscuit & gravy was good. Eggs were good (scrambled). Rosemary potatoes were yummy.

We stayed at Ny Ny and tried all the restaurants and Chin Chin by far was the best in terms of value and service. Manny was our server and my spouse ordered lettuce wraps not realizing it had peppers in it. She mentioned it to Manny and he had a whole new order made and back to the table within minutes. He was very attentive and very willing to please. 
The portions are huge so make sure you go hunger, we had appetizers and couldn't come close to finishing it. Excellent value will definitely return.

Never mind all those big name celb chef restaurants, always try the little places they work hard for your business. The food here was outstanding and the service was just as outstanding. Robb Harrison was on top of it all and made you feek welcomed. And Cory the manager made sure our visit was good.
My family and I greatly enjoyed the breakfast buffet.  Amazing cooked to order omelet. Our server,  Jordan,  was very friendly and attentive.

Closed for construction 11/19/16. Thanks for the walk.
Beware if your wanting any of the raved about dumplings...

Went there with my girlfriend last night,
The services is great and our waitress was awesome, but the food was so average! really  nothing special about it, I had steamed vegetables, I nevertheless have  tasted mushrooms that bad, the sushi was Ok I enjoyed it.

The buffet was not that good for a Las Vegas buffet. The passion fruit mojito was good but the service was not. Friendly people but our waiter seemed to of gotten lost to our table or in the restaurant.

We went here for the breakfast buffet, which was really good.  They have design-your-own omelettes like you'd expect, but you order through your server - so you don't have to wait around in a line.  The meat lover's omelette was particularly good, and not overly gigantic so you can still try other stuff from the well-varied buffet.  We got here early enough for the early-bird-special, so it was a great deal and barely any line to get in.  The service was super friendly and just the right amount of attention.  So really everything I was looking for in a Vegas breakfast buffet!

Very efficient and friendly staff. Great value for money! A selection of fresh food and salad and great for somewhere if you're trying to be healthy. We got the buffet but it's not tacky and restaurant is very nice inside. I would definitely recommend it!

Their food is pretty average..We ordered california roll and although it tasted fresh, it was just plain average.Their vegetable dumplings were good.Also their Singapore noodles were tad bland and not enough meat or vegetables.Their Flat noodles were the only thing I raved about at that meal.Service is great.There are better places around.

Maybe NYE was just a bad day for this restaurant.   They were quite busy, but I don't think the food would have been much better on a different day.  We ordered seaweed salad and the pork bun appetizer.  The seaweed salad was probably the best part of the meal.  We also ordered a Salmon Lover sushi roll and a Wor Wonton Soup.  The waitress brought the wrong sushi roll to the table and the replacement took longer than we had waited for the first one.  The Wor Wonton Soup was just ok.  I've had instant noodles that I would choose over this item on the menu though.  We were told and and were ok with the fact that the pork buns would take 15 minutes to prepare.   When they arrived at the table, the bread was soggy on the outside and undercooked on the inside.   At first I thought they did some fusion thing and added cheese in the filling but it was just uncooked dough.  I have not tried the breakfast buffet but would be willing to give it a shot the next visit.

There are some friends you can put your complete food trust in and there are others, for the sake of the relationship, you should ignore. I should have known better than to listen to this particular friend about going here for breakfast but we went anyway. I was like "Breakfast? At a Chinese restaurant?" 

Still, he insisted and we all went, regrettably. It was a buffet for starters, which I am not a fan of, ever. The idea of paying to walk around never made sense to me. Plus the general public breathing and maybe touching or sneezing on my food doesn't appeal. Then you have the food that's just sitting there dying under heat lamps for God knows how long.

Anyway, yea, sorry. It was just not good.

Food took forever even though the place was empty. The menu has multiple typos, including the description of the spicy tuna roll is apparently the same as the rainbow roll. We ordered it without realizing it and instead of honoring the price the only option they gave us was to take it or pay for the rainbow roll price. We asked for the rainbow roll and she trashed that roll. When we finally got our food, the rainbow roll was really tasty but the ribs/chicken was salty too. Too bad...

Chin Chin, which mostly has locations in Los Angeles, is one of my favorite restaurants because they carry one dish I love: their Chinese Chicken Salad (with no chicken).  This is California Chinese food, not authentic Chinese food, and some dishes are hit or miss.  Favorites of my friends include: paper wrapped chicken, orange chicken, lettuce wraps, and spring rolls with delicious apricot dipping sauce.  They have low fat versions of several of their dishes.  I'm guessing this isn't a popular dining destination within the New York-New York, as it wasn't crowded at dinner time.

Other eateries within the hotel/casino include:
* Nine Fine Irishmen
* America (http://www.yelp.com/biz/2exIfLCFNVhC7alBeMi2Lw)
* Coney Island Pavillion
* ESPN Zone (http://www.yelp.com/biz/cyV6Y8eOgpDTtdJQnB6FaA)
* Gallagher's Steakhouse (http://www.yelp.com/biz/nnDLapJk1z2NJE0-XzwMlQ)
* Gonzalez Y Gonzalez (http://www.yelp.com/biz/JsCKeWHA8n_5mFQ3F6t4UA)
* Il Fornaio (http://www.yelp.com/biz/Lau3N654yNyWdIIybea1uA)
* Il Fornaio Panetteria
* Village Eateries
* Schraff's Ice Cream
Just average.   Good service buy the sushi rolls were nothing special and prices high for what they were.

Ok so with the name you wouldn't think breakfast, but that is where you will be making a huge mistake. M-F 7-9am they have a bogo breakfast Buffett that is really good. The Buffett isn't as large as the main buffets in the casinos, but they have really good freshly prepared options including a made to order eggs/omelet option. Non-alcoholic drinks come with your meal and the OJ is fresh squeezed! Make sure to get here by 8 or 8:30 that's when the line starts. The service is over the top great
Just checked in to NY NY for SEMA 2015, and first bar stop is Chin Chin! Matt and Koong are the BEST  bartenders ever!!!  Everyone needs to have a drink at Chin Chin!

Great food. Reasonably priced. Comfortable dining area. Penny was a very friendly and attentive waitperson. Linda is a terrific manager. Both on top of things. I've worked in food & beverage, so I know a little about what distinguishes one eatery from another. This place does it right.

I just had lunch here with 6 other friends on New Years Eve. The Yelp Check-In deal was perfect and very well accommodated. We essentially had 50% off our entire bill!

The food was tasty and varied. But most impressive and appreciated of all, the service was fantastic! Our party was constantly checked up on and the staff was extremely polite to us. Thank you very much!
This place is amazing! Great food great drinks and great service. The Manager Jason was awesome! I highly recommend this place!
Amazing Sushi!!!  Really enjoyed our meal. Staff is VERY FRIENDLY and knowledgeable. Sushi is very fresh and tasty.  Wish I could eat here everyday!!!!

Come to this Breakfast Buffet in NYNY.  One of my favorites in all LV.  Omelets made to order, but given to your waiter and brought to you. Thank you Cesar, our great waiter. No need to stand in line and wait.  Eggs Benedict made three ways, traditional, salmon, crab cake. Fruit was incredibly fresh. Over 50 items and just great.

Maybe I had to much to drink...We were in Vegas after all..but, I was so disappointed on my last visit to Chin Chin. We usually come here for their breakfast buffet because they have a great selection of breakfast munchies. We swung by for dinner and I wish, wish wish I would've just trekked over to another place. But, seeing that I usually enjoy their breakfast buffet, I figured that I would like their dinner selection and service. We ordered 4 pieces of sashimi, chow fun, shu mai and pork dumplings. The sashimi was ok, comparable to grocery store grade. the chow fun was bland and I had to kill it with hot sauce to make it edible. The pork dumplings were a weird , tough gelatinous blob that I couldn't stomach. The only enjoyable part of the meal was the shu mai which was decent. The service was good and I have always been fond of this place for breakfast so I'll come back for that. But, pass on the dinner service-the food sucks!!!

The sushi was the best I've ever had! The rolls are very large- one roll is entree size. The orange chicken was very good and crispy. The peanut noodles were the best! The shrimp are humongous! Very good and fresh food!

My husband and I had a great time and experience here. The food was amazing. We started off with the chicken lettuce wraps. Next we had the Inferno Roll and Yellowtail Shashimi which were all so fresh and yummy. The Wasabi is real Wasabi, not the horseradish kind that clears your sinuses. For our entrees we selected the tangerine beef, and the spicy seafood noodles with black bean sauce. Everything was exquisite and the presentation was perfection. To top it off, our amazing server Robb was not only charming, but very attentive and professional. We will definitely be back to visit and recommend this place highly.

We went here for Breakfast Buffet on a Monday morning because we wanted to ride the roller coaster and I knew this restaurant would not be busy.  It wasn't and we were seated right away.

The buffet is a blend of American breakfast items and a few Chinese items.  I was disappointed there weren't more Chinese items on the buffet but it was still pretty darned good.

American:  Fruit, waffles, scrambled eggs, bacon (good), link sausage (good, large, delicious).

Chinese:  Egg rolls, Fried rice, and BBQ Pork that was REALLY good.

Service was fairly good.  Food was hot.  A tad spendy but not bad for Vegas.

Not a destination but good if you're nearby.
Fantastic!!! Koong, Garry, and Stephen where awesome, the hostess were so friendly and the waitresses were very attentive. Paola and Mica dragged us in and we come back everyday!

The selection is limited but it is TASTY! The lettuce bowls with minced chicken was very yummy! Also the desserts were really good ( cake pops, cookies and mini muffins).

The service was great! Our waiter was very cool and he didn't hover!

I will return to Chin Chin!

We decided to go here for my birthday dinner and were not disappointed! We stayed at the Excalibur, so the short walk to New York New York was worth it for this delicious meal.

When we arrived, there were not many seating options available and we were placed at a tall table with chairs that did not have a back. Typically, I would've asked to be seated at a booth or lower table, as I find the tall tables and chair with no backs uncomfortable; however, I did not want to be difficult since they didn't have other seating options available. 

Our waiter came up to our table promptly to give us menus and take our drink orders. He was friendly and patient with us as we waded through their huge menu. Their food menu is very extensive, which made it a difficult decision for us! The drink menu has good selection as well. 

We decided to start off with their shrimp tempura roll. It was a good size and tasty as well. For our entree, we chose to split the crab and asparagus fried rice. First of all, I thought this was such a creative take on fried rice and one that I never would've thought of. Second, omg! Thank goodness we decided to split it because the portion was absolutely HUGE! My boyfriend and I each ate quite a bit of it and still had at least another good serving of it left. 

Another cool feature of this place is that they have the sushi chefs working right at the bar so you can sit right in front of them and watch your sushi being rolled. 

Our experience here was really great. We left feeling very full of delicious food and drinks. Our waiter was attentive but not annoying. Definitely recommend this place for a delicious meal.
We wanted some good old fashioned Chinese food and we got fried rice and general Tso. We were pleased with our choice .
4/7/2018 Went there for the breakfast buffet. Not impressed at all. Don't waste your money, for the 2 of us it came to $54.00. Ian our waiter was super nice though. Props to Ian!

Everything about our recent visit to Chin Chin's was great. Very friendly service, and all four items - Chinese chicken salad, shumai, cilantro dumplings, and Yang Chow fried rice - were great. The salad was dressed perfectly and had lots of chicken. The shumai might have been the best item. The fried rice was prepared without soy sauce (as the menu indicated) so it could have been bland but we liked it a lot. Last visit might have been ten years ago and I remember thinking the salad and dumplings were not as good as my first experience decades ago in Studio City. This time it rocked. We will definitely stop by next time we're in Vegas.

Bad sushi, do not try the coconut nigori, it's not that good. Everything is overpriced for the poor quality fish. Avoid this place, or just order the Kung Pao Chicken. You can never go wrong with that. But at this price, you'd be better off at Panda Express.
This place sucks! Everything is soaking in sauce and whatever is suppose to be spicy is sweet. The peanut lo mein us awful!! Just like eating a jar of peanut butter!
The food was good. The staff was very attentive. Ate here twice on my trip to Vegas.  Had the seafood noodles which were excellent and the sushi was great too.
Decent place, nothing special, nothing terrible.  Average food, with above average service.

The management staff with Andrea at the helm is fantastic.   She is striving to take an already popular restaurant and make it even better inch by inch.  That appears to be her mantra.   The food served at the bar was great served by baby girl and the breakfast buffet was off the chain!!!  The nigiri sake complimented the atmosphere and was the highlight of my night.  But I can't forget the hosts and were so professional and pleasant, especially Sara.   You should visit the place just to receive their great service.  No doubt I will be visiting this joint in the future. 

New York New York is where the foodies come to party.

After writing the first review I was immediately contacted by the Corporate Management and offered to revisit them, so the stuff at the Las Vegas location could show us a better experience in line with the experiences my family had for more than a decade in all the Los Angeles branches.

I took the chance this past weekend to celebrate my wife's Birthday together with the birthday of one of my oldest friend who was visiting from the UK for the first Las Vegas together with his family.

I want to say that the experience we had was great, the branch's management and stuff (Cory, Erick & Chris) were very attentive and the food got to our table at the right time tasting great.

Now I'll always visit them in Las Vegas to have a great meal!!!

The previous comment is absolutely accurate. This place has the most terrible foods that I have eaten in my entire life. The prices are way higher than the values provided, and sad to say but Panda Express do taste better than this place.

Best Chinese food ever! 
So good so tasty so fresh!! I love to go there every time I'm in Las Vegas! Awesome staff very friendly!! 
Love to go there!!

My Parents had a comp here and we ordered seven things.  They were all yummy.  We ordered Almond chicken, tangerine beef, sesame chicken salads, pineapple fried rice, wor wonton, eggplant garlic, and sweet and sour shrimp.   All great with less oil.  Next time, maybe I will check out their lettuce wrap.

Hubby and I went to chin chin and it was incredible! We had fantastic sushi rolls and some outstanding cocktails. I drank a dragon fruit mojito that was delicious. Our server was named Dawn. Dawn was outgoing, personable and she was always smiling. She really made the experience 5 stars. This place is great. We will be back
We had breakfast. Omelet is good and the bacon. Coffee is not, water down. The coffee mugs are not clean. Server is great.

We were looking for a place to eat before the show and since we stayed in NY NY, it was easier to just eat in the hotel. 

Chin Chin is an asian fusion restaurant with pretty big serving sizes. They station pretty girls outside of their restaurant to lure the men in (no joke) and it seems to work pretty well lol.

The food itself its alright. We ordered the beef Chow fun and mongolian beef. Definitely not your traditional chinese versions of these dishes you would find in a hole in the wall, but not bad for a casino chinese restaurant.

I'd say if you have a hankering for chinese and don't want to venture far if you're staying in NY NY, then Chin Chin is a good choice. Otherwise, venture further out to get your chinese fix. The prices aren't exactly cheap either..

Amazing service! Peanut noodles are my favorite, but that Yang Chow fried rice and those giant chunks of bbq pork. Can't finish all the food in one sitting but they are definitely worth taking home for later
Great meal after George Strait concert. Highlight was our server, Dexter. He made great suggestions which made the delicious meal more enjoyable!
I loved their breakfast buffet. Everything was fresh or either made to order. Hostess and cooks very professional, and restaurant very clean. I would really recommend this buffet.

I received probably the best service ever from Chin Chin when my group of five came here last Monday. Our server was beyond courteous and made some awesome recomendations for both food and beverages! 

Service on the strip is normally pretty good.. but this was beyond that.. and to top it all off, the food exceed our expectations as well.

Defintely make your way here if you're in the mood for delicious Chinese food / sushi. I highly recomend this one!

I really shouldn't expect so much from Asian restaurants that are at tourist locations. I usually love Chinese food pretty much anywhere besides theme parks and tourist locations where the dishes are subpar and overpriced. 

Since it was pretty late, we decided to share an entree. We ordered the moo goo gai pan. It had chicken breast, water chestnuts (my fave!), celery, and mushrooms. This was so disappointing. There was barely any flavor and our total came out to $27 for the entree and two scoops of rice. I would have rather have had Panda Express.

Oh...and there was some sort of problem going on in the back of the hotel which caused a disgusting aroma that smelled like sewer/poop to sweep through the restaurant and throughout the casino. It was pretty gross and most customers, like us, ended up taking the food to go. It wasn't their fault for the smell...but yikes...it made it very hard to enjoy the food if you sat down to eat it.

This is a must in Vegas!!!! We have been coming here for years and always had great service but Cory is the man! His service was amazing and they were super busy yet he stayed calm. He checked on us periodically to see if everything was good and needed anything else. Also my fiancé got a sushi roll and he let us know we could deep fry ANY of their rolls! Nobody ever told us that in the past. 
We ordered our favorites the Mongolian beef and sweet and sour chicken for dinner.  It was amazing and generous portions too.  I always sub out the Crissy noodles for lo mein noodles it is out of this world!!! 
Maria the manager came over to the table and checked on us too. She was very nice and made her rounds to everyone!! Also my fiancé spotted her carrying out food to tables a few times too. They remembered us from the night before too!! 
Don't let the 3 stars fool you! This place is delicious!!!!

Walked into Chin Chin in New York and was immediately greeted by friendly hostesses ready to seat us. Karina was our server and was friendly attentive and offered wonderful suggestions that made our mouth water. The omelette was truly one of the best I have had. Coffee was great and could not have been better. Make sure you stop here and ask for Karina!

For Americanized Chinese food it was really good the general chicken was one of the best I've had. The hot and sour soup was just okay though. The service was very attentive and the management was very active in backing up their servers. The prices were pretty good for the strip. If I stay at the hotel again or a near by one even I'm coming back.
You are really hungry and you suddenly happen of a chinese/sushi restaurant. Nothing to write home about maybe apart from that tuna tartar appetizer.

This restaurant is located in New York New York. I ate here for the breakfast buffet. 

For some reason, I thought it was going to be breakfast buffet of Asian food. The only Asian thing they really had was the fried rice. The fried rice has eggs, peas, bacon and sausage in if. It was really good. The other food available was your typical breakfast foods. There were waffles, French toast, scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon. They had red velvet pancakes which were really good because they weren't too sweet. You also have the option of ordering an egg or omelette anyway you want it. 

Overall, I thought it was a good breakfast buffet. I would come back here.

First of all we were staying at the Monte Carlo... We first encountered Chin Chin looking for something healthy.  We had. The general tsos chicken and sweet and sour shrimp plus the crab Rangoon were absolutely the best I ever had and I'm 46!  The manager , Linda, was very very attentive and personable. She gave us a coupon for a free mimosa with buffet. We came back the next day and  Linda was there and greeted us ! Our server Anita was an excellent server with a high emotional intelligence and kept our table clean and glasses full. The buffet was fresh, expansive and reasonably priced. Linda gave us a coupon for a free app on our next visit which will be tomorrow !

Had their breakfast buffet. It was a mix of standard American and Asian breakfast. Good was good and the service was excellent. Our waitress was awesome. Wish I could remember her name. The price was fair for the strip.

Legit!!

Good value, excellent tasting food with large portions. 

We've been here 4 days in Vegas, wish we would have found this earlier in our trip. We would have been back for a second meal.

I have been here two different times and each time I had a great experience, great food and great service. My more recent visit I was eating solo and ordered the Chicken Pad Thai which was delicious. It wasn't too sweet and not too tart. Noodles cooked to perfection and a large portion. 

I had a drink but don't remember the name and couldn't find it on the online menu but it was something about a dragon. Made with Absolute Apple vodka, cucumber soda and ginger beer. It was delicious. 

The service was fast and it was great. I had no complaints about the service at all!  

I'll be back.

Our last day in Vegas ended with a GREAT breakfast buffet here. We luckily saw the sign for it as we exited the yorker elevators after checking out of our room. 

Glad we decided to eat there because the breakfast menu was excellent. From 2 types of eggs Benedict (salmon and crab) to different styles of potatoes and everything in between, this was a million times better than the crappy free brunch buffet at the Monte Carlo.

What made it even better was our waiter, Jordan. Not only did he take it upon himself to water down my son's lemonade for him (because it tends to be too sweet), he also took a few minutes to stop and chit chat with us. He gave us suggestions for things to do suitable for my 6 year old. So cute! :)

The manager even offered us to stay and try out their lunch menu (at no extra cost) because we arrived late for breakfast. I was pretty full from what I had already eaten, but did try a bit of their Chinese food lunch buffet. I tried the orange chicken, sweet and sour soup, and egg roll which was also yum yum yummy! 

Great service + great food = 5 stars!

I wasn't sure what to expect since it's in the middle of the NYNY casino but I really enjoyed this place. Service was very friendly and wasn't rushed at all. They even brought us to go cups with hot tea so we could finish our tea. The ginger dressing on the house salad is top notch and the salad is huge. The spicy garlic tomato beef is unlike anything I've had an a Chinese restaurant anywhere and it's almost like a cross between an Italian and Chinese dish. It was unique and enjoyable. Portions are large here, you won't leave hungry. This place is worth a try if you're on the strip and want Chinese food.

Chin chin is the place to kill the hunger cravings with some healthy food before hitting the tables again ! 

Jesus is the MAN !!! If you want best service and genuine attention ask for him. He will give you the best advise to accommodate your taste.

After reading reviews about the buffet, I was skeptical. The menu looked good though. When I got there, I scoped out the buffet. It looked pretty good. It's $19.95 for lunch. Entrees run about the same so I thought I would try it. It was pretty good, decent variety and not overwhelming. Our server, Oscar M was quite pleasant and polite as well. I used the buy one get one coupon from Yelp for the lunch buffet, which helped significantly.
Sushi was very tasty. Mongolian beef was cold and not flavorful. Hibiscus tea was great, as well as the silver sake.

This was my first stop in vegas and will be my last. I understand Japanese cuisine can be pricey due to quality but this establishment took it too far especially when it's not a fine dining restaurant. As I was looking over the menu for possible sushi ordering, I was blown away by the prices. For example: 1 order (2 pcs) of a tuna nigiri was $12.50! That would've been like 2 orders (4 pcs) for me if I were to dine in at a casual restaurant like this one in Sacramento, CA. I just ended up getting a small entree instead since I rather pay that same price to fill up my stomach. Service was ok but not so great - it took them a while to greet me and ask for drinks and then it took a while to place my order in.

Service was good, group of four were seated immediately. Actual food itself was not really all that impressive. I'm a sushi "freak" quality of the fish seemed decent, the rolls themselves were just not the quality that I have become accustomed to having from my favorite spots in Denver. My girlfriend ordered the Mongolian beef, and in my opinion it wasn't bad but the steak was really thick, and was only served on the crispy white rice noodles, with nothing else.  Overall, maybe not bad for a pop-in type situation, but I'd personally probably find someplace else if you wanted a better experience.

I'm staying at NY/NY  for a game. I stopped by Chin Chin for lunch and breakfast. The staff (Andres) and mangers gave top notch customer service.

My breakfast highlights: red velvet pancakes, French toast, carved ham and salmon-caper eggs Benedict. 2 for 1 before 9am.

Lunch Highlights: mostly everything, I love Chinese food. Although, for  $30 (including tax and tip) price I probably should have tried a place with an upscale ambiance.

I just can't remember the last place of business I have visited when absolutely everyone is friendly. Everyone at Chin Chin is just so pleasant. 
Plenty of warm smiles, gentle conversation, and lots of attention. 
Menu is reasonably prices with tasty selections. 
Service was great. 
Food temperature was perfect.
Food was delicious.
Our server was spectacular!
I am coming back with my family.
Chin Chin, see you soon!

We ate here twice during our stay at NYNY. The food was good and the service was excellent. Our server Ben really make sure we were happy and attentive. The restaurant manager (I don't know his name) also stopped by to make sure everything was great. Overall a good experience! We ordered a dim sum and then sum deal which has half orders of dim sum, soup, meat, and rice dishes. You get to pick 3 among those. Believe me the portion size was really good. It was half order but fill us two up. We tried hot and sour soup, BBQ pork, yang chow fried rice and wonton soup. All were good and the price is great ($23 for 3 dishes). Overall this restaurant exceeded my expectation

The average of three stars for Chin Chin seems about right, as we had a party of four here and we were split with two of us loving our meals, and the other two a bit unimpressed, so your experience here might be a little bit of a roulette that depends on what you go for. (Those that didn't love it complained their selections were over-salty and pretty greasy.)

We all found the staff really friendly and on top of their game though, and loved that (like most anywhere in Vegas) we could bring in outside booze we were consuming at the time and finish it with our dinner. Food came out quick too, which was great as we were time sensitive about to shoot off to see a show.
Awesome sushi. Ask for crispy flakes and spicy mayo...my favorites. April was awesome and got us in and out quick. Thank you!
Chin Chin can also mean "penis" in Japanese.  Great marketing staff over there!

We stopped by here while we were in town for CES. Our waitress/bus-boy were very friendly and fun, but the food took forever to arrive and it arrived cold. However, the food itself was pretty good - I had the beef and broccoli (the white rice tasted weird though... Uncle Ben's? LOL) and my husband had soup. Overall a perfectly A-OK place to get lunch/dinner!

Chin Chin is located inside New York New York. had walked past by Chin Chin during my last couple of trips to Vegas, and I've always been curious. 

Hubby and I decided to try this place out for a late night dinner on Sunday (thank you hunger and alcohol!), and I was impressed. I decided to try and keep things healthy since I had stuffed myself the night before at a buffet, so I opted for the California roll with brown rice (kudos for having brown rice available) and hubby got the broccoli beef.

The portions here are definitely huge, both the roll and entree. I thought the roll was good, nothing amazing, but good. Hubby thought the broccoli beef was also good, just wished there was less sauce. That's on us though, we should have asked for light sauce. 

Our server was nice and attentive.

Of course this place is a little pricey for the quality of food, but what in Vegas isn't overpriced. 

I would come back if I'm hungry and in the Casino.
Awesome buffet with great service..!! Totally worth it if using the coupon on yelp (2 for 1). Food is descent even for this hardcore Chinco.. ! ;)

We came here at about nine at night after seeing Louie Anderson. The food was good and relatively inexpensive for Vegas.  We both ordered tea (which was complimentary with our meal), I ordered mu shu shrimp and my husband ordered beef with broccoli.  We had fast service and paid $28 for the two entrees.  Our only complaint was there wasn't a whole lot of meat in the beef and broccoli dish (in fact, my husband said it should have been retitled "broccoli and beef").

This place was so good. We are vegetarian/vegan and they had a great menu for our dietary needs. The service was excellent. 
The staff was very friendly and on top of it all. 

The peanut noodles... OOOOOOOOO MYYYYYYY! Best I have ever had. The avocado roll I had was so large too. I wasn't expecting them to be so big. They were fresh, and mouth watering. 

A must try in Vegas.

They woulda gotten only one star if it wasn't for the locale. 
Salty, greasy and overall pseudo Panda Express. Yes even panda is more authentic and that speaks volumes. 
Service was slow and servers lack knowledge of food on their manual. 

Yang chow fried rice was somewhat eatable.
The food and service was great. We had Dexter as our waiter and he did a terrific job. The food portions was more than sufficient and the prices was very reasonable. highly recommended!!

In NYNY Casino. I ordered a dirty martini with the money brain (spicy tuna stuffed inside avocado "shell" with eel sauce on top) and salmon sashimi. The drink and food was pretty good. Not the best but good standard sushi. Service was fine and prices were fair. Casual setting. I would return if I happened to be in that casino and was in the mood for sushi but wouldn't seek out a visit to this restaurant specifically.

I was excited to eat here since I loved the Chinese chicken salad from the Chin Chin on Sunset Plaza in L.A. And had not had it in years. I ordered a half order of the salad, and a bowl of soup, I believe it was called Max's soup, or something along those lines. My husband ordered the peanut noodles. Well, the salad was just as I remembered it...delicious! The soup, on the other hand was not. It had an odd taste...like boiled cabbage. I knew I made the wrong choice after I had just one spoonful. My husband's peanut noodles tasted like peanut butter overpowered by garlic! Not good. Price was okay, service was mediocre, and with the exception of my beloved chinese chicken salad, the food was yucky. Too bad. We should have known this wasn't going to be good by the way the girls working there bordered on begging us to eat there every time we walked by there on our way to and from the elevators.
Dana was the best server. She makes a mean bloody Mary. We love you! You're our favorite!!!
Robb Harrison served us and his recommendations were completely perfect!  Insane appetizers and the BEST General Tso I have ever eaten in my life!!

Avoid if you have tastebuds!!!

We ordered 3 things on the menu and all were disappointing. 

Eat at shake shack around the corner instead.

Superb customer service!!! The food is good but the customer service took it over the top! I will definitely be going back! 
Accommodated a food allergy with out eye rolls or exasperated sighs. That's A+ in my book!

Love this place from Sunset Plaza in LA.  Not so much the Vegas location.  We stopped in after the U2 concert.  We should have walked to another restaurant.  Everything was over cooked and lifeless.  The waiter was great, but the food sucked.

It was a well welcomed find after being disappointed around the area for breakfast almost every morning.   For the price that SB's was charging for a large coffee and a bagel, you can go to Chin Chin and get a fantastic breakfast buffet.

If you make sure to grab a ticket, you can get one free bloody mary or mimosa when you get the buffet.   

The breakfast selection did not disappoint.   Well, except for the fact that I wish I would have found it a few days earlier.  

Fresh fruit, oatmeal, eggs, made to order omelet, baked goods galore, and then very nice helpings of sausage, bacon, and ham.  

Bottomless coffee and juice... it was well worth it, after being treated to the normal craziness that Las Vegas had to offer by nickel and diming you everywhere you go.  

I will be back next year!

For being a restaurant in one of the biggest hotels in Vegas, this restaurant falls below the quality of cheap Chinese restaurants. It's expensive yet nothing special about the food. The service is slow. I wouldn't choose to go back there again for sure.

How ironic that as we are walking around trying to decide where to eat I mention my craving for PF Chang's.  We go into New York New York and just so happen to stumble upon Chin Chin, the closest thing to a PF Chang knock off as I ever did see.  I'm not hatin'.  I liked it.  It was fast, delicious, and came with good service and lots of free Coke refills.

If you like PF Chang's, you'll like Chin Chin. 

P.S. Whoever said it is a little pricey is a little crazy.  Compared to almost any other sit-down place, it's very affordable.

We visited her recently. I ordered the Orange chicken which was pretty good. My husband ordered Cashew chicken as he usually does when we visit Chinese restaurants, and he said it was tasteless. I tried it to see if it really was that bad and it was dreadful. This was probably the most tasteless meal we've ever had. It was that bad, he didn't eat it all, he finished mine instead. I can't believe the chefs put that food out. It was like they missed ingredients from the recipe to make it so tasteless. To top it off, the menu is completely over priced. This was such a disappointing experience.

Let's be honest - nothing in Sin City is cheap. For Vegas travelers on a budget, finding an inexpensive place to eat can be tough. 

During a trip to Las Vegas for the 2008 CES, my parents and I had dinner at Chin Chin at the New York-New York Hotel & Casino one night. The three of us agreed on this place as we had been looking for some Chinese food for some time. The prices were generally lower than those of other eateries in the area, so it seemed like an attractive place to eat. 

Unfortunately, the low prices were just about the only good thing about the restaurant. For starters, many of the dishes were over-seasoned. Case in point, the fried rice was extremely salty as it was literally drenched in soy sauce. The other items we ordered also had similar problems, and it was rather hard for us to eat the food as we prefer lighter tastes.

The three of us also ordered some raspberry mousse cake for dessert. This, too, turned out to be a mistake as the cake seemed to be extremely heavy in fat and sugar. It was actually so greasy that it caused me to lose my appetite the following morning. I had split the slice with my parents, but even that didn't seem to help.

The quality of service was not impressive either. It took the waitress five minutes to bring us the dessert menu, even though there were few other guests. After we ordered the cake, it took another five minutes for her to bring it to us despite it being a pre-made item.

On the whole, I would not recommend this place. I understand one can't really judge a restaurant with a single dining experience, but my impressions are telling me to stay away from Chin Chin in the future.

-- TL;DR version --

Highs: Prices are relatively low
Lows: Slow service; food is over-seasoned and greasy
Bottom line: You get what you pay for in Vegas. Low prices aside, there are better options.
Final verdict: 2.5 stars (rounded up to three)

Great customer service I ordered the volcano sushi and my daughter had their noodles with vegetables our meals were really great. Ask for Ben to be your server he was super nice and gave us a lot of info on food and las vegas

We had a shrimp tempura appetizer in a lettuce cup.  Interesting but don't get this as you get 2 pieces of lettuce off of a head of iceberg lettuce filled with some funky crunchy noodle things 1 piece of tempura shrimp and some avocado (you get 2 of these) and eating it is a bitch!!!  A big waste of money.  Everything else we had was good especially the pineapple fried rice!!  The price was about what you will see at all of the other restaurants in Las Vegas.  

The server was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.  Overall a very good experience.

This restaurant is located in the New York New York Hotel/Casino. The food came hot and fresh in pretty big portions. Very good stuff :] Made me so full. The bartenders were cool too. My friend had a really good Margarita and I had a yummy Cosmo. We liked this place because of the atmosphere, people and food. Nice, relaxing decorations. And our waiter was very friendly and helpful. I'd go here again to try some of their other dishes.

This is our first time here and the service was horrible. Never really saw the server, when he brought the food out without silverware or plates we had to ask. Then didn't bring all our food out. When we told him don't bring now as we were done with the rest of our food he just blew it off. Not sure we will return here. The worst part the food was good.

Came here for the breakfast buffet and it was delicious. I have a gluten sensitivity and dairy allergy and the servers and kitchen were incredibly accommodating! I was able to order an omelet and even eat a couple of things off the buffet. Very helpful and friendly staff, great food.

Nothing very exciting.  We were hoping to get in on the lunch buffet, but at 2:20, we were told it was closing down.  Service was good, our waitress was attentive and pleasant.  Food was average.  Wontons were burned. Pork buns  were fine.

The food here is pretty much inedible. We tried a number of different things and the only thing ok was a California roll from the sushi bar. The low point was the peanut noodles with chicken. It was a mushy pile of goo that tasted like rancid peanut butter. Two bites, pushed it away. Waiter noted that most of the items were not touched and actually asked if we wanted it to go. Really? How about asking "Did the food really suck? Or did you just order a bunch of stuff to throw away cuz your not hungry?" Seriously, I don't think they even realize it's bad. Only good news is that by Vegas standards it is relatively inexpensive, we only flushed about 50 bucks down the toilet....

For the buffet, there appeared to be limited options, but there were just the right amount of options. Food was actually very fresh and great tasting. I highly enjoyed everything from this buffet including desert. Our server Andres was great, too!

We showed up hungover as a cliff with one thing in mind. Eggs Benedict. We were told that the breakfast was until 12 noon but as we arrived at 1135, they were already transitioning to lunch. Bummed. However, our server, Jordan, and the manager, Linda sensed our disappointment and despair that no benedicts were available and made it right for us by having the chefs prepare 6 of some of the most delicious and satisfying bennies I have eaten in a long time. The smoked salmon and crab cakes were fantastic!  Very content.

Visited this restaurant with my husband after my last night at a trade show in Vegas, where we had a few drinks and a bunch of appetizers, and the experience was fantastic. Service was great, and food was amazing. I especially loved the bau buns, pot stickers (the sweet sauce they're served with is sooo good!), and the tuna tartare. A colleague joined us after and had a couple of sushi rolls. And the price was reasonable and portions large. I was expecting mainly standard Chinese food, but there are a lot of good more upscale options as well. I would definitely visit again the next time I'm in Vegas.

This is one of the best general tso dishes I have had so far. The right level of spicy and crispy. 
Would absolutely recommend stopping by here!

I don't write many reviews but I felt compelled to write one for this place. I tried it last night because I was craving some sushi. It's the strip in Vegas, so be prepared to pay strip prices. That said, the Salmon sashimi was some of the best and largest portions I've ever had. Sushi Chef Huynh was very friendly and approachable, he was available for recommendations as he received and cut all the fish himself so he knew what was freshest.  I also ordered the General Tso's chicken, which was good, but in retrospect I should've just had 2 more orders of sashimi.  I'll be back next time I'm in town, maybe for a happy hour next time so that I can afford more sushi.

The food was OK. It's not very good but not bad either. The best part of this place is the price. Pretty much every restaurant in Las Vegas are expensive so this is a cheap place with a lot of food in your plate.

My husband and I decided to explore Chinese food in Vegas.... we were pleased to come across Chin Chin @ NY NY. We were seated promptly by our very nice hostess are server was Cory he was prompt friendly and very attentive to our needs.. the manager came and asked us how our dinner was and we had the amazing tangerine beef! Ask for Cory he is a great server and very helpful...
Love this restaurant! It is on our "Must Visit" list! Wide variety of food, fresh, delicious!! Their lettuce wraps are delish!!

Chin Chin Café is located at the New York New York Casino. The staff there are extremely friendly. I came here on two occasions. The first time I came here, I had the assorted rolls specials. The assorted rolls were cucumber, philly rolls, spicy tuna rolls, and crab roll. I could already tell by biting into the rolls that they were not fresh. However, my waiter was very efficient and attentive which made the eating experience pleasurable. Then, the next morning, I had their breakfast buffet which was also okay. The selection of their buffet was quite limited including the traditional fare of eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns. These items were okay. As for appearances, the breakfast was not too appetizing. Also, they had two choices of cereal but there was only actually one available. Also, they only had whole milk. Again, at least my waitress was quite friendly and attentive.
The service was excellent. Really nice waiter and staff. The God was okay. The flavor was decent on one dish where it was lacking in the other dish. Kinda pricey for Chinese food.

This review is more for the bar in the front. I don't really care for the food. If you are feeling adventurous and you love fruity drinks as much as I do, then this is the place for you. They have all sort of exotic fruit drinks. My favorite came with mango. They even have some with pomegranate. SUPER YUMMY! Also, the bartender was super cool about making you a new one if you didn't like it, BUT I LOVED THEM ALL!!!
It's decent its cold taste like microwave but the service was excellent the waitress was excellent but the quality was not

After walking around New York New York  and only seeing steak, pizza, and pasta, we were happy to find Chin Chin. Pineapple rice was delicious and the the sushi roll was fresh.  It was exactly what we were looking for.
Pedro was the best waiter! Understood our time schedule/ offered to replace the sweet/ (slightly too) sour soup.

Sunday Brunch = Runny eggs, oddly seasoned breakfast potatoes, and a slew of underwhelming dishes; however, decent sausage, bacon, pot stickers, and above average table service kept my dining experience above water. A fair amount of steam tray options, and the cooks seemed on top of keeping everything fresh and refilled.

For me it was NOT worth the $15. I guess it's more the convenience of dining in (if you're staying at NYNY) than walking to Denny's or elsewhere.

I was disappointed in my last outing to Chin Chin.  A large Hot & Sour Soup with shredded pork, carrots, green onions, tofu, jalapenos, and egg that I consumed myself was very good, and slightly crisp Chicken Spring Roll wrappers were good, but the insides were just okay and not very flavorful.  I had to keep dipping the deep-fried morsels in Sweet & Sour Sauce to enjoy some taste.  From now on I will stick to Vegetable or Shrimp Spring Rolls.  

Shrimp with Garlic & Snow Peas featured good-sized, succulent shrimp, tasty snow peas, and small mushroom pieces, but I could have done without the carrots, and would have enjoyed a delicate crystal White Sauce better than the dark Brown Sauce with which the dish was immersed.  Cashew Shrimp was prepared with a much lighter Brown Sauce that I liked a whole lot better.

I can only describe the Orange Chicken as weird.  It consisted of large chunks of chicken, peppers, and onions glazed with an Orange Sauce but not at all typical for this breed of Cantonese fare.  Szechuan String Beans were okay but unremarkable.  Most disappointing of all was Small Egg-Fried Rice with scallions.  The rice was richly bathed in soy-based Brown Sauce, and at first sighting had no visible egg in it.  I pointed this out to my server, and he volunteered to take back the dish and have more egg added, which I let him do.  Although improved, even upon its return the rice did not sport much egg.

Hot Tea was good, and our pot lasted quite awhile.  But by the end of our dinner, even an unusual Chocolate Dome, consisting of Dark Chocolate Ganache that exposed Chocolate Mousse and white cake inside that was possibly honey-soaked after being cracked open, could not save the day for this rather ordinary meal.

Our server was very good and accommodating.  And our surroundings that featured dark woods and white-linen tablecloths were comfortable and pleasant.  But there are just too many other better Chinese restaurants in Las Vegas that I have now experienced for me to go out of my way to return here.

This is just for the breakfast buffet and service.  They charged my 7 year full price.  Why would they not have a kid's price?  Service was awful.  The girl was somewhat nice, but was so artificial?  What is the word?  I don't even know.  Food was a 2 1/2 stars.  All the females there were so trashy.  Nice, but trashy.  Service was sooooo slow.  Didn't come by and when she did, it appeared to be a major chore for her.  Too bad.

3.0 Stars

I was walking through New York New York and noticed they had a Chinese eatery option. I'm in Vegas for a conference so I figured I'd gives this place a try to get some variety from the typical conference food.

To layout my expectations, I grew up in San Francisco where I was actually spoiled with Chinese food that was big portioned, cheap, and tasty.

I decided to order the Singapore Noodles for $12.95.  I noticed this noodle dish didn't have the Hot & Spicy symbol so I decided to ask them to make it a little more spicy for me.  My dish consisted of:

*Shrimp
*BBQ Pork
*Bean Sprouts
*Onions
*Bell Peppers
*Rice Noodles
*Curry Sauce

When the plate came out I noticed it was HUGE. I saw one giant mound of noodles and I was ready to tackle it!  

The noodles themselves were done nicely where they still had a little springiness.  It was stir fried in a curry sauce, but I wasn't able to taste much of the curry flavor.  Even though I asked them to make it spicy they actually just added some roasted chili peppers into my dish. My server was nice enough though to bring me some extra chili sauce. 

I poked around my noodles and noticed they were really sparing with the ingredients. I found myself actually eating a lot of noodles before I got to any of the shrimp or BBQ pork.

Chin Chin does a decent job of providing traditional Chinese food in a casual café setting. My server was overall really nice and attentive.  The price was reasonable for Las Vegas, but in terms of flavor and taste it still made me long for some cooking back at home.

We went here for their breakfast buffet.  Wow this place gets mixed reviews from me.  First, he price is reasonable, $18 for a breakfast buffet is not too bad.  The food was actually pretty good, the problem is the buffet is not stocked very well at all, the first time we went up three quarters of the food was empty.  The server was funny and nice but he was very slow and they were busy but the place was not packed.  But when the food was stocked it was pretty good and I left happy.

Food: B
Price: B
Location: A
Authenticity: D
Customer Service: C

Chin Chin is located in the New York New York Hotel and it's not by any means an authentic Chinese restaurant.  They serve "Americanized" Chinese food which isn't a bad thing but when it comes with poor service, the experience just isn't that great.

We were lucky enough not to have to wait for a table.  It was a Friday night and the restaurant wasn't that busy so that should have been my first inclination that maybe we should have dined elsewhere.  The hostess was pretty friendly and welcoming.  However, our server was a different story.  She had an attitude and it was apparent that she hates her job.  She kind of rushed us while ordering and basically threw something on there that we really didn't ask for.  She took the liberty of ordering the sampler of appetizers for us.  Even though we knew what she did, we didn't decline as we were unsure of what appetizers to get anyway.  

The food was good, not great, and like I said, it is definitely not authentic Chinese food.  Their fried rice was very similar to Panda Express (Chinese fast food chain), so really nothing special there.  The Mongolian Beef was pretty tasty but they overloaded it with green onions.  I'd say the Sweet and Sour Pork and the appetizer sampler were the winners of our meal.  What I thought was strange was that they have sushi on the menu.  I didn't care to give it a try because I don't go to Chinese restaurants for Japanese food.  They have some pretty good cocktails but be prepared to spend some money on them.  What do you expect; this is a restaurant in a hotel on the Strip.  Would I dine here again?  Probably not.

Great restaurant with large portion sizes. I had the salmon crunch roll and it was amazing! Also ordered fried wontons and senchuan dumplings and they were great too! Loved the koriander sauce on the dumplings.

I unfortunately ended up at the Chin Chin breakfast buffet due to group consensus. All of the regular breakfast items were represented, along with some Asian items like Fried Rice, Egg Foo Young, BBQ Pork, etc... Coffee and juice is also included. Everything seemed OK, nothing unusual until I was running to the washroom in the NYNY Casino to barf up everything I'd just eaten. I could only handle orange juice when I came back. I personally think breakfast foods should not be eaten buffet style! Never again!

Always a great dinner at Chin Chin. Food is great. Fresh. Tasty. Never disappoints. Oscar M gave us great service as well. Would highly recommend the Godzilla roll!  Not always on the menu but you can ask for it!!

The lunch time buffet was absolutely amazing! The food was incredibly delicious for a buffet and the sushi was actually really good for a buffet. They have plenty of vegetarian options if you are vegetarian. My favorite was the noodles. I highly recommend this place if you are in the hotel and want a cheap delicious buffet.

It was my first time in Vegas with friends and we were dying for sushi. I'm sad to say this isn't the best place for that. The rolls were priced as expected for sushi but they were the dinkiest, saddest excuse for rolls I'd ever seen. 

The noodles, however, were exquisite. I even tried a bite of my friend's tangerine beef--I'm not a big meat eater but that was sooo delicious.

Wow Chin Chin is so under-rated. I was surprised nobody ever told me it was hidden in NYNY.

My group stopped here for a quick lunch and opted for the buffet. We thought it was a good deal since most single entrees are $15, and the buffet was approx $19.

The buffet isn't HUGE like your exclusive hotel buffets, but it's just the right size. 

I expected the food to taste like your typical greasy inauthentic Chinese food, but I was wrong! The food was light, not too salty and had just the right amount of everything.

Ooooo and their dessert bar was to die for! I liked everything here. The service was wonderful and I'd eat here again.
Great value for money! Wonderful and friendly staff. My second visit , will come again!

The food was expensive and they are not using a professional chef.  The fried rice was under cooked (like steamed rice) no flavor.  The Chow Mein had no flavor and was extremely salty.  I will not be returning again.
The service was good though.

Meh. Food was decent enough, nothing to write home about. I have definitely had better tasting Asian food. Portions were decent. Service was ok. Waitress kept forgetting to bring my wife's wine. Had to finally flag her down and remind her. I was already half way through my drink... no customer service recovery. I do have to admit that you will pay "Vegas" prices!!! And it really isn't worth it.

First I like you o know that I travel most of the time by myself, and with that said I,  I had one of the most amazing times at Chin Chin!!! The three people at the bar were awesome made me feel like I was one of their family members. Never felt like I was alone sitting there Dana was one of the most attentive bartenders I've ever met!!! Again I travel for a living and bartenders like that our award winners! I have eaten at chin chins in California most of them, by far this young lady takes the cake of bartenders at Chin Chin, she has a  award winning smile that Chin Chin should have for all there employee! The sushi chef was also awesome Ben! I had a great time to talking to both of them and the third bartender. Chin chins you have 3 great individual people working for you! Hats off to you!!!

Service here was great, not impressed with the food however. We were going to go to ghallagers next door but decided to go to chin chin instead. The sashimi was okay, and the pork ribs were dry and forgettable.

Summary/TLDR - Brunch was good, the price wasn't, service was SPECTACULAR, and they'll automatically add tip for a party of 7.

Stopped here for brunch before heading out to the Grand Canyon. The brunch was actually pretty decent. They had eggs (regular, steak and eggs, pepper eggs), waffles, french toast, red velvet pancakes, bacon, sausage... A LOT to choose from! And the food was good! A bit disappointed that they only had syrup up at the buffet though. It would've been nice to have it on the table, but I'm not going to be THAT picky with my review.

I gave it a 3 star rating because although the food was good, it wasn't $17.95 per person good. The price was a bit hard to swallow (no pun intended... well maybe just a little...). Our waiter Cesar was EXTREMELY nice. He made sure we were filled on drinks and had everything we need. The service deserves 5 stars alone!! The other disappointment was that unfortunately Cesar works for a company that will automatically add gratuity of 18% to a check for a party of 7... Anytime a restaurant tells me what I need to pay in gratuity, that's all I'll pay. If I had calculated the tip on my own, he would've likely have gotten 20%+. Way to screw your hard-working and deserving employees.
